Never because an objective standard of truth has been established, agnosticism and skepticism have become popular. Whoever holds the opposite view, that is another astonishing 'inversion'!"
In response to this inverted relationship, the article pointed out sharply: "Marxist theory is science, not superstition; theory must first be subject to practice before it can guide practice; theory is not immutable, it is constantly supplemented, revised, enriched, and developed in practice." Therefore, we cannot stop at old conclusions and old slogans, and of course, it is not easy to change these old slogans. "The reasons are, besides the fact that people's thinking often lags behind reality, that the interests of some people are more or less connected with these old slogans. These people, while verbally saying that they are worried that some old slogans and old statements will cause the entire revolution and the entire theory to be negated (obviously, this is just a kind of Arabian Nights rhetoric), they are actually afraid that some of their personal things will be harmed as a result." In response to some people's criticism, such as: If practice is placed first, as the only standard for testing truth, then what position should Mao Zedong Thought and Chairman Mao's words be in? The article pointed out: For those who are talking nonsense, they only need to ask them back: Chairman Mao said that only the revolutionary practice of tens of millions of people is the measure of testing truth, "there is no other way to test truth." Where do you put this teaching of Chairman Mao? How is it considered to be acting according to Chairman Mao's teaching?
This article, which is more than ten thousand characters long, is full of reasoning, very targeted, and is known as the sister piece of the article "Practice is the Only Standard for Testing Truth". It was published with the care and support of Luo Ruiqing, the Secretary-General of the Central Military Commission. After the article was written, the Liberation Army newspaper sent it to Luo Ruiqing for review. Luo Ruiqing read it three times in detail, made five phone calls personally, consulted relevant works personally, suggested many changes, and required the article to be impeccable. This general, who was persecuted and had his leg broken in the "Cultural Revolution", and amputated high, even made a special call to Hu Jiwei, the person in charge of the People's Daily before he went to West Germany for leg treatment, saying, "If this article is to be hit, I am willing to take 50 big boards first." This risk-taking spirit shows Luo Ruiqing's clear attitude in supporting the discussion on the standards of truth, who later couldn't stand up again in a West German hospital.
The fact that practice is the standard for testing truth has always been self-evident, and there is no need for argument in the field of natural sciences. However, natural scientists are still actively involved in this discussion. In mid-May, a joint meeting was held under the leadership of Fangyi by the National Science Committee, the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and the Party Group of the China Association for Science and Technology, to discuss relevant articles and made a decision: to support this discussion. On July 5th, the "Seminar on the Relationship between Theory and Practice" organized by the Theoretical Group of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and the China Natural Dialectics Research Society was held in Beijing. Many scholars from the fields of natural sciences and social sciences participated in the discussion and made speeches. Scientists illustrated with numerous examples from the history of natural sciences, that when the original natural science theory conflicts with the new scientific experimental facts, the breakthrough of the old theory and the establishment of the new theory must simultaneously rely on practice. The arguments they provided from the viewpoint of natural sciences played a special supporting role in this big discussion in the realm of political ideology.
From July 17th to 24th, the Philosophy Research Institute of the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, and the editorial department of 'Philosophy Studies' invited more than 160 theoretical workers from central and state ministries and commissions, Party schools, colleges and universities, research units, and news units in various provinces, municipalities, and autonomous regions to hold a discussion on the relationship between theory and practice. During the discussion, many social science workers spoke, connected with reality, and fully affirmed the practical significance of this discussion. After the discussion, many representatives of provinces and cities conveyed information, and the discussion on the standard of truth was pushed nationwide.
In the second half of 1978, the theoretical circle, academic circle, literary and art circle, and news circle nationwide actively participated in the discussion on the standard of truth. According to incomplete statistics, by the end of the year, more than 650 special articles on the discussion of the standard of truth had been published in central and provincial-level newspapers and magazines. With the continuation of the discussion, articles were still being published successively. It became a nationwide discussion with theorists as the main force, which affected all circles and everyone paid attention to.
In the heated discussion, one phenomenon caught the public's eye, that was, with the development of the discussion on the standard of truth, most provincial party and government leading bodies and large military district leading bodies around the country have successively started the discussion on the standard of truth. Many principals of provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, and large military districts publicly wrote articles or made speeches, expressing their support for the viewpoint that practice is the only standard to test truth, and highly praised the theoretical and practical significance of this discussion. This is rare in the history of the Party and the Republic. Their speeches generally connected with the national and local realities at the time, not only pointing out the theoretical significance of this discussion, but also emphasizing its political significance. 

Moreover, this movement, later known as a great ideological liberation in the history of modern Chinese thought, laid the foundation for the exploration and a series of theoretical innovations and practical development of socialism with Chinese characteristics after the reform and opening up.

IV. Partial fermentation of the issue of shifting the focus of party and national work



The discussion on the question of the criterion of truth has liberated thinking and promoted the new exploration of the Chinese Communist Party on the path of socialism in China. This new exploration gained a broader vision with the end of the "Cultural Revolution" and the rapid increase of China's foreign exchanges. China began to learn from and draw on the experiences of different types of countries in economic construction, and gradually clarified the basic policy of opening up to the outside world.
1. The Emergence of Understanding on Reform and Opening-Up Through Numerous Visits By Chinese Leaders
Starting from 1978, China changed the situation of very few visits by party and government leaders during the "Cultural Revolution". In that year, 13 Chinese leaders at the level of deputy premier or deputy chairman and above led delegations to visit 51 countries 21 times. Among them, Deng Xiaoping himself made four trips to eight countries. These visits not only improved China's foreign relations, but also gave the party and state leadership a more direct and comprehensive understanding of recent international developments. A common strong feeling among the visiting leaders was that China was far behind the world in economic and scientific-technological development.
At the National Science Conference in March 1978, some comrades mentioned that the relationship between the world's economic development and science and technology is closer now, and the development of the national economy and various industries mainly depends on the development of science and technology. One important reason for China's economic backwardness is that its science and technology are backward. Compared with the world's advanced level, China's science and technology are about 15 to 20 years behind in most fields, and even more in some fields. Therefore, if we want to improve the economy, we must first earnestly learn world-advanced technology. If we turn a deaf ear and do not understand the trends and levels of scientific and technological development internationally, it is impossible to talk about catching up with the world's advanced level. These opinions attracted the attention of the leaders of the CPC Central Committee and the State Council.
On May 17, 1978, the State Council established a leadership group to introduce new technology, responsible for studying and formulating plans to introduce foreign advanced technology. Following this, leaders of the State Council and various departments and localities visited and inspected developed western countries and regions to understand their economic development level and experience in economic development. On the eve of the delegation led by Vice Premier of the State Council Gu Mu to visit Western Europe, Deng Xiaoping specifically asked them to make a detailed survey and study, to see the level of their modern industrial development and how they manage their economy, and to learn from the advanced experience of capitalism.
When Chinese leaders went abroad, capitalism had just passed its "golden age" of great development after World War II. In the first half of the 1970s, capitalist countries experienced the most severe economic crisis since the war. In 1974 and 1975, the GDP of the United States, Japan, West Germany, the United Kingdom, France, and Italy all showed negative growth. In the second half of the 70s, the western economy was in a state of "stagflation" and had difficulty recovering. Under these circumstances, developed countries were willing to expand trade with China, provide preferential loans to China, and even invest in China.
Through visits and inspections, these leaders not only saw the gap in economic development, but also saw the international situation at that time providing opportunities for China's development.



After returning to the country, they all suggested to the central government: to make full use of the current favorable conditions, absorb foreign capital as much as possible, introduce a large number of foreign advanced technology equipment, learn from their advanced management experience, and accelerate the speed of our country's modernization. Gu Mu specifically mentioned when reporting the visit situation to the CPC Central Committee and the State Council: Why can't we do it, given that Western Europe took advantage of foreign investment and introduced advanced technology during its economic takeoff? The opinions and suggestions put forward by the comrades above were compiled into documents, circulated among the leaders of the central and national departments, and caused a strong repercussion.
2. The holding of the State Council's Service Virtual Meeting and the proposal of reform ideas
Understanding the world's advanced level has led people to reflect on the experience and lessons of our country's economic construction. How to summarize experiences, how to accelerate the construction speed, has become an increasingly prominent issue before the whole party.
During this period, Deng Xiaoping talked many times: now there is a relatively good international condition, which we can take advantage of, and we should take the world's advanced achievements as the starting point for our development. He criticized the "Gang of Four" for isolating the country from the world and being ignorant of global progress. He argued that our mindset must be updated to face the realities of the world today. He also suggested that not only are we technologically backward, but our management level is low. He cited that our country's system, including the institutional system, basically inherited from the Soviet Union, are outdated. He proposed that many system issues need to be reconsidered. These views gradually became a consensus within the party leadership.
From July 6 to September 9, 1978, the State Council held a service virtual meeting for two months to study how to speed up the modernization construction of China. The responsible persons at the meeting all came up with ideas for accelerating the construction speed and proposed to reform the economic management system and actively introduce foreign advanced technical equipment based on a thorough review of the lessons learned since the founding of New China.
Several leaders who returned from their visits introduced the current international situation and foreign economic development experience; the State Planning Commission proposed to actively expand exports and increase foreign trade ports; the Ministry of Machinery Industry proposed to combine the introduction of new technology with the reform of domestic management systems; the State Labor Bureau proposed to reform the wage system and effectively motivate workers; Hu Qiaomu enumerated the disadvantages of solely relying on administrative methods to manage the economy, suggesting that such methods “should be minimized to a necessary extent, and most economic work should transition from government administration to enterprise operations. The enterprise itself should also minimize the management of pure administrative methods and expand the management based on economic means”.
In the summary speech of the meeting, Li Xiannian explicitly proposed the implementation of the policy of reform and opening up. He pointed out that in reality, the current international situation was very favorable to the country, and it was necessary to have the courage to utilize foreign advanced technology, equipment, capital, and organizational experience to speed up our construction. He suggested not to miss this very rare opportunity. This would be many times faster than trying to explore everything from scratch behind closed doors.
On September 30, central government forwarded this speech and prepared to further discuss it at the upcoming central work meeting.



Soon after the virtual meeting, the National Planning Conference convened by the State Council proposed that the economic front must implement three transformations: First, attention must be shifted to the production struggle and technological revolution from top to bottom; Second, transition from a bureaucratic management system and methods that do not take into account economic effects and work efficiency, to an effective scientific management track that operates according to economic laws and combine democracy and centralization very well; Third, transition from an isolationist or semi-isolationist state that does not engage in economic and technological exchange with capitalist countries, to actively introducing advanced technologies from abroad, using foreign funds, and bravely entering the international market.

On October 11, Deng Xiaoping said in his speech at the 9th National Congress of the Chinese Union: "Achieving the four modernizations is a great revolution that fundamentally changes the economic and backward technological outlook of our country, and further consolidates the dictatorship of the proletariat. This revolution must significantly change the current backward productive forces and must inevitably change the relations of production, the superstructure, and the management methods of industrial and agricultural enterprises, and the state's management methods of industrial and agricultural enterprises, to meet the needs of modern large-scale economy." Therefore, "Every economic front not only needs to undergo major technical reforms, but also major reforms in institutions and organizations. Carrying out these reforms is in the long-term interests of the people. Otherwise, we cannot get rid of the backward state of production technology and production management."

Under the impetus of these ideas, in 1978, our country signed 22 project import contracts with developed Western countries in succession. Although there was a tendency to be impatient for success in the import work, these projects that were introduced have provided advanced technical equipment and a high starting point for China's modernization construction. The introduction of Shanghai Baoshan Iron and Steel Plant's complete set of equipment enables us to learn the world's top-notch production technology and management methods, and shortened the gap between China's iron and steel industry and the world's advanced level by at least 20 years. Both the ideological preparation and the practice showed that the general policy of reform and opening up is ready to emerge.

3. The Emergence and Proposal of the Idea of Shifting the Focus of Work of the Party and the State

The conception of shifting the work focus of the party and the country among the party's top leaders was early. For example, as early as the tenth day after the smashing of the "Gang of Four", on October 16, 1976, Li Xiannian called Chen Yun to solicit his opinions on future work. After discussing with Wang Zhen and Yao Yilin, Chen Yun proposed several suggestions. One of them is to "vigorously boost production, so that the national economy can recover and develop more quickly." This was the earliest known material hinting at shifting the work focus.

In September 1978, after ending his visit to North Korea, Deng Xiaoping made an unusual inspection of the three northeastern provinces and places such as Tangshan and Tianjin. This was an important effort made by Deng Xiaoping to promote a historical turning point.

During the inspection, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly appealed to local leaders, calling for a liberation of thought and seeking truth from facts. They must, under the existing domestic and international circumstances, dare to think about, raise, and solve problems. Don't have forbidden zones as they cause rigid thinking and inhibit consideration of issues according to one's own conditions. In short, seek truth from facts, open up the mind, and carry out a revolution. After introducing advanced technical equipment, they must manage according to the advanced international management methods and economic laws.



We need revolution, not reform, not patching up. We must encourage and educate all cadres to think independently, to boldly reform unreasonable things. Our superstructure cannot but be changed. 
He also reiterated that the most urgent task for China is to develop productivity. We are too poor, too backward, to be honest, we are sorry for the people. We are a socialist country, and the fundamental manifestation of the superiority of the socialist system is that it can allow social productivity to develop rapidly at a speed never seen in the old society, and the people's constantly increasing material and cultural life needs can be met. From the perspective of historical materialism, the results of correct political leadership must ultimately be manifested in the development of social productivity and improvement of people's material and cultural lives. We need to think about how much we have done for the people. Therefore, we must accelerate the development of productivity and improve people's material and cultural lives now.
For this purpose, Deng Xiaoping proposed to timely end the mass movement of "criticizing the Gang of Four" and shift the focus of the party and the state to the construction of socialist modernization. This is a thought of great strategic significance. When he heard the report of the standing committee of the CPC Shenyang Military Region on the movement of "criticizing the Gang of Four", he said: You can study the movement, what is the end? There is no thorough thing forever. The movement cannot last too long, and it will be tired if it lasts too long. There is a bottom to the movement to expose and criticize the Gang of Four. It can't be done for three or five years. When it's almost done, it can be ended and return to normal work. After leaving the Northeast, he reiterated this view to relevant comrades in the Central Committee and received the support of other leading comrades in the Central Committee. Thus, the shift of focus of work had the potential to become a major decision of global significance.
On October 11, Deng Xiaoping made this point more clearly when he spoke at the Ninth National Congress of the Trade Unions. He proposed that the struggle to "criticize the Gang of Four" has achieved decisive victory in a wide range of the country, "we are able to start a new battle on this victory." The Party Central Committee and the State Council are now calling for accelerating the pace of achieving the four modernizations, "This is a great revolution that will fundamentally change the economic and technological backwardness of our country and further consolidate the dictatorship of the proletariat." He hoped that the delegates would "have a deep discussion on the current situation, so as to unite all members, based on the complete victory of the struggle against the 'Gang of Four', to fight for this great task".
At this point, quite a few people have realized that in order to achieve the goal of socialist modernization and quickly implement the brewing reform and opening up, we must shift the focus of the party and state's work to modernization construction. There is basically no disagreement in the party on this point. However, there is still disagreement in the party on the guiding ideology of modernization construction. Some comrades still adhere to the guiding ideology of "two whatevers", thinking that to achieve the four modernizations, "we must insist on taking class struggle as the guide, and carry out the three great revolutionary movements of class struggle, production struggle and scientific experimentation." The majority of comrades, however, argue that in order to carry out modernization construction, we must adhere to the guiding ideology of seeking truth from facts, and first of all, we must rectify the disorder.




The divergence in guiding thoughts has unavoidably caused an intense ideological debate about the shift in work priorities. 

IV. 1978 Central Work Conference and the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee

From the convening of the Central Work Conference in 1978 to the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee, these are the two significant meetings that had a significant impact on the Party and the country in the process towards a great historical turn after the smashing of the "Gang of Four." Marked by the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee, the Party and the country embarked on a new great journey of reform and opening up.

1. Convening of the Central Work Conference in 1978

On November 10, 1978, the CPC Central Work Conference was held in Beijing. The attendees included key comrades from all provinces, cities, autonomous regions, major military regions, and central departments, as well as some old comrades who had held important posts in the central government, localities, and the army, a total of 219 people. The participants were divided into six groups by region. This was a very important central meeting in preparation for the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee.

At the opening session, Hua Guofeng announced that the items for discussion at the meeting were: first, to discuss the "Decision on Accelerating the Development of Agriculture" and the "Regulations (Draft) on the Work of the People's Communes in the Countryside;" second, to determine the arrangements for the national economic plan for 1979 and 1980; third, to discuss Li Xiannian's speech at the State Council. Before discussing these items, the Politburo decided to discuss the issue of shifting the focus of the Party's work to the construction of socialist modernization from next year.

In his speech, Hua Guofeng did not mention the discussion of the standard of truth, the change of guiding ideology, or the issue of reversing wrongful convictions, which was widely concerned within and outside the Party at that time. He said that the basis for the shift in focus of work is because the mass movement to expose and criticize the "Gang of Four" on a large scale can now successfully come to an end, and new tasks should be put forward to adapt to the development of the situation. "When the main problems of a stage are solved, we need to move on to a new stage." This means that the shift in focus of work is a change in the stage of work rather than a change in the fundamental guiding ideology and the political line of the Party. Influenced by this, the documents on agricultural issues submitted to the meeting still followed the approach of "promoting revolution and boosting production," using the overall estimate of "continuous bumper harvest for more than a decade" that was popular during the "Cultural Revolution" and obscured the actual facts. Obviously, this way of achieving the shift in focus of work is not satisfactory for those participants who first want to resolve guiding ideological issues and major historical questions.

Starting from the group discussions on November 11, some people raised the issue of redressing major wrong cases such as the "Tiananmen Incident." On the 12th, Chen Yun spoke in the Northeast group, suggesting that historical legacy issues need to be resolved first. He said: The realization of four modernizations is the urgent desire of the whole Party and the people of the country, and stability and unity also matter to the whole party and the people of the country. To ensure stability and unity, "for some remaining issues, issues that have a large influence or involve a wide range, need to be considered and decided by the central government." Following this, he raised six major historical legacy issues, including rectifying 61 people including Bo Yibo, redressing the "Tiananmen Incident," and the conclusions about Tao Zhu and Peng Dehuai. These major issues that are of concern to the Party inside and outside were raised, and caused a strong reaction. The atmosphere of the meeting became lively.



The focus of each group's speech quickly converged on the issue of redressing wrongful and false cases, especially the "Tiananmen Incident." Almost every group proposed that it should be redressed as soon as possible.
Under this circumstance, it was approved by the central government that the expanded standing committee of the Beijing Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China would officially redress the "Tiananmen Incident" and redress all comrades persecuted for this reason, thereby restoring their honor. On the 15th, Xinhua News Agency reported on this under the headline "The 'Tiananmen Incident' is Completely a Revolutionary Action." On the 16th, major newspapers such as "People's Daily" and "Guangming Daily" published this news, which greatly encouraged the cadres and the masses. Subsequently, provincial committees in Henan, Zhejiang, Jiangsu, and other provinces formally announced: all comrades who mourned for Premier Zhou during the Qingming Festival in 1976 and opposed the "Gang of Four" and were persecuted as a result, would be completely redressed, restoring their honor.
Regarding the issue of redress for other major wrongful cases proposed at the meeting, some comrades pointed out: these were all set by the central government in the past, and it is necessary for the central government to clarify these issues explicitly. Otherwise, there will be resistance among the cadres and masses. It would be best if the central government could clarify these issues before the focus of work shifts.
Under these circumstances, the standing committee of the Politburo discussed the above opinions. On November 25th, Hua Guofeng, on behalf of the Politburo, announced at the meeting that the central government had decided: to publicly and completely redress the "Tiananmen Incident"; to redress major wrongful cases such as the so-called "February Adverse Current" and the "Treason Group of Sixty One People Including Bo Yibo"; to correct the past wrongdoings to comrades such as Peng Dehuai, Tao Zhu, and Yang Shangkun; for major local events, all provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the Central Government should deal with them based on the actual situation, the central special case group should conclude its work, and all cases should be handed over to the Central Organization Department; there is strong public anger towards Kang Sheng and Xie Fuzhi, they should be exposed and criticized; and so on. Later, on December 14th, in the central working meeting distributing Hua Guofeng’s speech, further opinions were added, acknowledging that the "counter-rightist reversal trend" was wrong, and all central documents related to "counter-rightist reversal trend" were to be revoked. These decisions basically resolved several major issues that the broad masses of cadres have been calling for in the past two years, and the comrades at the meeting felt immediately relieved. Everyone freely expressed their opinions, and their thoughts were further liberated. Some comrades even suggested that the "Cultural Revolution" should also be re-studied and re-evaluated. They believed that the "Command Center of Liu Shaoqi's Bourgeoisie" didn't exist at all, and the evaluation of the "Cultural Revolution" with "seven points of achievement and three points of error" was unconvincing. However, it is not ripe to discuss fully and resolve this issue at this time.
After solving several major historical issues, heated discussions were held on diverging opinions arising from discussions on the standards of truth. Some comrades still believe that discussing the standards of truth is, in reality, "advocating suspicion of everything and guiding people to discuss Chairman Mao's mistakes, which does not conform to the policy of the Party's Eleventh National Congress." This viewpoint was criticized by most comrades. Many comrades also criticized the people responsible for the "Red Flag" magazine and the Central Propaganda Department, who had a passive attitude in the previous discussion, hoping they would correct their attitude as soon as possible. Everyone felt that the disagreement on this issue was essentially a divergence of two different guiding ideologies; without addressing this issue and distinguishing right from wrong, the shift in work focus would not proceed smoothly. After sharp ideological confrontations, some comrades who previously underestimated the significance of this discussion gradually changed their attitudes and made self-criticisms. Everyone also called for the Central Party to clearly express its stance on this discussion to thoroughly resolve the issue of ideological line.



While discussing other issues, everyone also got rid of the shackles of "two whatevers", carried forward the traditional spirit of seeking truth from facts, and seriously reflected on the guiding ideology and some policy guidelines of the past few years, and boldly put forward criticisms and suggestions.
What kind of ideology should guide the shift of focus in work? This is a very crucial problem. Some comrades believe that "we must still insist on taking class struggle as our guide in our construction efforts". However, many comrades pointed out that the issue of class struggle during the construction period should be reconsidered and clarified. This is a problem that the Party must solve in guiding modernization. Some comrades pointed out: The shift of the work's focus is not a change in the usual nature of the Party's specific work, but a fundamental change of historical significance. Unless there is a war in the future, the struggle for production and technical revolution must be taken as the center, and there can be no other center. Some comrades also questioned the wording of "holding the three major revolutionary movements of class struggle, production struggle, and scientific experiment hand in hand", which has been used for many years, and believed that this wording lacks priorities, and the struggle for production should be clearly put as the center in the future. After heated discussions, most people believe that the issue of class struggle in the period of socialism should be reconsidered, thus paving the way for denying the guideline of "taking class struggle as the basic principle".
While discussing the two agricultural documents, many comrades expressed their strong dissatisfaction with the fact that the documents avoided harsh reality and only talked about the "superiority of the people's communes" and the "continuous bumper harvests for more than a decade". They pointed out that there are nearly two hundred million people in the country whose grain supplies are below 150 kilograms and cannot fill their stomachs. The per capita grain is less than that in 1957. The main reason for this situation is that the past policy is too rigid towards farmers. The development of agriculture is largely hindered by "left" mistakes. Some comrades said: do not be afraid of farmers getting rich. If we think that farmers getting rich will lead to capitalism, then we can only be poor forever, then what are we doing revolution for? Many suggestions to restore and develop agriculture as soon as possible were also put forward. Chen Yun proposed in his speech: within three to five years, "we can import up to 20 million tons of grain every year. We can't be tense everywhere, we have to stabilize the farmers first". "Stabilize this end, that is, stabilize the majority... The world will be greatly settled." "This is the biggest measure in economic measures." These opinions and suggestions received attention from the central government, and the two documents about the agricultural problem were also revised according to everyone's opinion.
While discussing Li Xiannian's summary speech at the State Council's meeting, many people agreed to reform the management system and implement an open policy to the outside world. The meeting printed a batch of materials introducing how foreign countries and our Hong Kong and Taiwan regions have rapidly developed their economies. After reading, many comrades proposed: change the past practice of "neither internal nor external debts", make full use of the international situation favorable to us, absorb as much foreign capital as possible, introduce advanced technology and equipment on a large scale, and speed up the construction. The Standing Committee of the National People's Congress should enact laws regarding the acceptance of foreign loans, borrowings, investments, etc., as soon as possible, and encourage foreign businessmen to co-operate with us. These opinions further concretized the brewing about the policy of reform and opening up, and the conditions for making formal decisions on the reform and opening up have matured.



The conference also discussed issues related to the construction of the Party, the democracy and legal system of the country. Drawing from the painful lessons of the "Cultural Revolution", everyone talked about the need to restore the Party's tradition of democratic centralism, to strengthen socialist democracy and legal construction, and put forward a series of suggestions for strengthening the democratic construction of the Party and the country. 

Deng Xiaoping was watching the progress of the conference. Based on everyone's discussions and the issues raised, he felt that the previously prepared speech was no longer applicable and should be more explicitly focused on the most critical and urgent issues at present. Therefore, he personally wrote an outline, listing seven issues: "(1) Liberation of thought, activation of machinery; (2) Extension of democracy, strengthening of legal system; (3) Looking back in order to look forward; (4) Overcoming bureaucratism, over-staffing; (5) Allowing a part to get better first; (6) Strengthening the responsibility system, setting definite targets; (7) New issues." Based on this outline, several comrades redrafted the speech for him.

On December 13, the conference held a closing ceremony. Hua Guofeng, Ye Jianying, and Deng Xiaoping each gave speeches. In his speech, Hua Guofeng self-criticized the issue of "two whatevers," admitting that "the consideration of these two sentences is not comprehensive enough," and it "restricted everyone's thoughts in varying degrees, which is not conducive to implementing the Party's policy in a pragmatic way, nor is it conducive to activating thoughts within the Party." He announced that after the conference, he  will convene the third plenary session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party to further determine the guidelines and tasks after the shift of the focus of the Party's work.

Ye Jianying proposed three opinions: (1) There should be a good leadership team, especially a good leadership team in the Central Committee. (2) It is necessary to promote democracy, strengthen the legal system, and the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress should take on the responsibility of enacting laws and improving the socialist legal system as soon as possible. (3) Diligently study and liberate thinking. He pointed out: "Our socialist modernization is not only to greatly improve social productivity, but also a profound social revolution from the economic basis to the superstructure." Many people are still not prepared for such a revolution, and their thoughts are not liberated enough. Therefore, "we need to break the superstitions caused by feudalism and liberate our thoughts from bondage."

Deng Xiaoping made an important speech titled "Liberate Thought, Seek Truth from Facts, and Unite to Look Forward". In this speech, he pointed out: "The first is to liberate thought. Only when thought is liberated can we correctly use Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought as guidance to solve the problems left over from the past and the emerging series of problems." "Without breaking rigid thinking and greatly liberating the thoughts of cadres and the masses, there will be no hope for the four modernizations."

Regarding the discussion on the standard of truth that the Party has been actively carrying out for half a year, Deng Xiaoping made a summary. He pointed out that the discussion on the issue that practice is the only criterion for testing truth is actually a debate about whether or not to liberate thought. Having this debate is necessary and meaningful, "A party, a country, a nation, if everything comes from a book, with rigid thinking and superstitions, it cannot move forward, its vitality will stop, and it will lead to the extinction of the party and the country." At present, if we want to restore the tradition of seeking truth from facts, we must liberate thinking and overcome the rigid state of thinking formed by various reasons. In this sense, "The debate on the standard of truth is indeed a problem of ideological line, a political issue, a problem related to the prospects and fate of the party and the country."



Deng Xiaoping emphasized: To emancipate the mind and stimulate intellect, a very important condition is to truly implement the democratic centralism of the proletariat. In this period, it is especially necessary to emphasize democracy. We need to create conditions for democracy, and strengthen socialist democracy and the rule of law. This meeting has solved some of the problems left over from the past, clarified the merits and demerits of some people, and rectified a batch of major wrong cases. This is also necessary for the emancipation of the mind. The goal is to look forward and smoothly achieve the shift in the focus of the party's work.

Regarding the upcoming reform, he said: To look forward, we need to study new situations and solve new problems in a timely manner. Now, our economic management work is bloated, overlapping, complicated procedures, and extremely inefficient. Political empty talk often drowns everything. This is not the responsibility of some comrades, but because we did not propose reforms in time in the past. However, if we do not carry out reform now, our modernization project and socialism will be buried.

He also proposed that in future management systems, special attention should be paid to strengthening the responsibility system. For any task or construction project, we need to implement a system of setting tasks, personnel, quantities, quality, and timelines. In economic policy, we should allow some regions and some people to earn more income and live better due to their hardworking efforts and great achievements. This will generate a great exemplary force, influencing neighbors and promoting other regions, and making the entire national economy continuously develop in waves. "This is a major policy, a policy that can influence and drive the entire national economy."

Not only did Deng Xiaoping's speech propose and answer a series of fundamental questions at a historical turning point, and summed up the central work meeting, but it also provided guidance for the upcoming Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee. Therefore, this speech actually became the theme report of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee.

After the closing meeting, the conference continued to discuss for two more days, and ended on December 15. Under the promotion of the older generation of revolutionaries and the joint efforts of most of the participants, the 36-day central work meeting finally broke free from the shackles of the "two whatever" policy, and turned the meeting originally intended to discuss economic work into a comprehensive meeting to rectify and start a new situation.

2. The Convening of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Party Central Committee

On the basis of the major achievements of the central working meeting, the third plenary session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing from December 18 to 22, 1978. The meeting was attended by central committee members, alternate central committee members, and responsible comrades from central departments, a total of 290 people. Hua Guofeng announced at the opening meeting: The main task of this plenary session is to discuss and pass the Politburo's proposal to shift the focus of the party's work to socialist modernization construction from next January.



The conference approved two documents on agricultural issues, namely, the "Draft Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Accelerating Agricultural Development" and the "Regulations for the Work of Rural People's Communes (Trial Draft)"; it also approved the national economic plan for 1979 and 1980; discussed personnel issues and voted to establish the Central Discipline Inspection Committee. Previously, after 36 days of intensive discussions at the central work conference, the participants had reached a consensus on some major issues. On this basis, the conference decided to promptly and decisively end the mass movement across the country to expose and criticize Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". From 1979 onwards, the focus of the Party's work would be shifted to the construction of socialism modernization. From now on, the class struggle in socialist society should be resolved by following the principle of strictly distinguishing and correctly handling two kinds of contradictions of different nature, in accordance with the procedures stipulated by the constitution and laws. There should be no blurring of the boundaries between the two types of contradictions, nor any harm to the stable and united political situation needed for socialist modernization. 

Under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping's principles of liberating thinking, seeking truth from facts, and uniting and moving forward together, the participants had an in-depth discussion on the party's ideological line. It was unanimously agreed that only by liberating thought, seeking truth from facts, and basing everything on reality, could our party successfully achieve a shift in the central focus of work. The plenary session highly praised the discussion on the criterion of practice being the only test of truth, believing it to have profound historical significance in promoting the liberation of thought among all party members and people across the country, and in rectifying the ideological line.

On the basis of carefully summarizing the experiences and lessons learned since the founding of New China, the participants generally felt that after the shift in the focus of work, the previous management system and methods could no longer be used. Instead, they needed to boldly reform the traditional system and methods according to the needs of modernization construction, and explore new paths of development. The plenary bulletin stated: "Now, we need to take a series of major new economic measures based on new historical conditions and practical experience, and seriously reform the economic management system and operation management methods, actively developing economic cooperation with other countries in the world on an equal and mutually beneficial basis, and striving to adopt advanced global technology and equipment. This puts forth reform and opening up as the overall guideline for the construction of socialist modernization, and the shift in the focus of work is also the beginning of a new revolution through reform and opening up.

When discussing agricultural issues, the plenary session proposed a series of policy measures to promote agricultural development, such as raising prices for agricultural products, and agreed to send the "Draft Resolution of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Accelerating Agricultural Development" and the "Regulations for the Work of Rural People's Communes (Trial Draft)" to provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the central government for discussion and trial. Through the rewritten documents, a more practical approach was adopted to highlight the backward situation of our country's agriculture, and a series of policy measures for accelerating agricultural development were proposed. Among them, the emphasis was on "respecting the autonomy of production teams," guaranteeing farmers' democratic rights politically, and fully caring for farmers' material interests economically, thereby effectively initiating rural reforms.

When reviewing the national economic plan for 1979 and 1980, the session affirmed the Central Work Conference's opinion on adjusting the national economy and proposed the principle that infrastructure construction must be active and within one's capabilities, thereby beginning to correct the guiding ideology for economic construction.

The session confirmed the Central Work Conference's decision to rehabilitate a series of major wrongful cases and reevaluate the merits and demerits of some important leaders; it reaffirmed the principle of seeking truth from facts and rectifying mistakes in resolving historical issues, thereby initiating the process of redressing all wrongful cases and thoroughly resolving major historical issues before and including the "Cultural Revolution".



The Conference also made a series of decisions to strengthen socialist democracy and legal system construction, improve the Party's democratic centralism, refine Party rules and discipline, and enforce strict Party discipline, proposing to strengthen the socialist legal system and task of democratization and legislation. It emphasized that there should be national law for the country and Party rules and discipline for the Party. All Party members and cadres must comply with Party discipline.

While steadfastly rectifying the "left" errors of the "Cultural Revolution" and before, the Conference affirmed the contributions of Mao Zedong and Mao Zedong Thought. The conference communique stated: The great exploits made by Comrade Mao Zedong in the long-term revolutionary struggle are indelible. It also pointed out that it is not Marxism to expect a revolutionary leader to have no shortcomings or errors, and it does not conform to Comrade Mao Zedong's self-evaluation. The lofty task of the Central Committee on the theoretical front is to lead and educate the whole Party and the people of the whole country to recognize Comrade Mao Zedong's great contributions scientifically and historically, and accurately grasp the scientific system of Mao Zedong Thought, combining the universal principles of Marxism and Mao Zedong Thought with the specific practice of socialist modernization and developing under new historical conditions. This would allow pointing out and correcting the errors of Mao Zedong's later years while respecting the struggle history of the party and the people without losing direction and losing our fundamental standing point.

After serious deliberation, the Conference elected Chen Yun as a member of the Political Bureau, Standing Committee of the Political Bureau, and Vice Chairman of the Central Committee; Deng Yingchao, Hu Yaobang, and Wang Zhen were elected members of the Political Bureau; Huang Kecheng, Song Renqiong, Hu Qiaomu, Xi Zhongxun, Wang Renzhong, Huang Huoqing, Chen Zaidao, Han Guang, Zhou Hui, were added as Central Committee members for recognition at the 12th Party Congress. The Central Discipline Inspection Commission was elected, with Chen Yun as the first secretary, Deng Yingchao as the second secretary, Hu Yaobang as the third secretary, Huang Kecheng as the permanent secretary, and Wang Heshou as the deputy secretary. On December 25, the Political Bureau decided: Hu Yaobang was appointed as the Secretary-General of the CPC Central Committee and Minister of Propaganda Department, Hu Qiaomu and Yao Yilin as deputy secretaries of the CPC Central Committee; Wang Dongxing was relieved of the director of the Central Office.

These organizational measures provide a reliable guarantee for the smooth implementation of the work shift and the implementation of various policies determined by the conference. Although Hua Guofeng was still the chairman of the party at this time, in terms of reflecting the correct guiding ideology of the party and deciding on major policies for reform and opening up and modernization construction, Deng Xiaoping has actually become the core of the party central leadership.

The series of significant decisions made by the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee in ideology, politics, economy, and organization mark that the Party has re-established the ideological line, political line, and organizational line of Marxism. The conference not only began to comprehensively rectify the "left" errors before and during the "Cultural Revolution" but also laid a solid foundation for the new exploration of the socialist construction path under the correct guiding ideology of the party.

As the focus of the Party and the state's work begins to realize strategic transfer, the guiding ideology of the Party and China's socialist cause has also begun to shift from "taking class struggle as the guideline" to focusing on the development of productive forces, from closed or semi-closed to openness, from a highly centralized planned economic system to a vibrant socialist market economic system, from guiding by Mao Zedong Thought to gradually guiding by Deng Xiaoping Theory. These changes not only sparked a revolution in China that completely changed the face of poverty and backwardness but also broke through the old mode of socialist construction that was behind the times and increasingly rigid worldwide, creating a new path and theory of socialist construction with Chinese characteristics. The report "Liberate the Mind, Seek Truth from Facts, and Unite and Look Forward" by Deng Xiaoping is a declaration of the opening of a new era, a new path, and the creation of a new theory of socialist construction.



After a history of 29 years, China's socialist cause has finally embarked on the road to victorious progress. The Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee is a symbol of this great historical transformation and the beginning of a new path and new theories. One statement in the conference's communique stands out: “To achieve the Four Modernizations, we must significantly improve productivity, which inevitably requires changes in all aspects of production relations and superstructures that are incompatible with the development of productive forces, and change all inappropriate management methods, activities and thinking.” With such historical demands, China began a new era of reform and opening up, marching towards a grand era.

Chapter II: Comprehensive Rectification and Adjustment of Social Relations under New Circumstances 

I. Comprehensive Redress of Wronged Cases 

After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, with the rectification work and deepening of the chaos by the whole party, the work of mass redress of wrong cases and adjustment of social relations also started, which greatly liberated people's minds and mobilized all aspects of enthusiasm.

1. Further Establishing a Series of Major Policy Principles for Redressing Wronged Cases 

The work of redressing wrongful cases is generally considered to be carried out in two stages. The first stage is from the crushing of the "Gang of Four" to the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee. The rectification of some important historical figures of the party and major events of party history during this stage created favorable political conditions for the impending historical shift. However, this stage of redressing wrongful cases didn't go smoothly. Due to the deep-rooted influence of the mistakes of class struggle within the party, and the maintenance of a series of "leftist" mistakes by Mao Zedong and his "two everywheres" policy by the main leaders of the central committee of the party during these two years, the progress was not smooth and could only be carried out partially and relatively slowly. 

The convening of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee created conditions for the large-scale redress of wrongful cases. After the meeting, a nationwide large-scale redress of wrongful cases and implementation of cadre policies were quickly carried out. According to public documents released by the Central Organization Department, the work of redressing wrongful cases at this time made breakthroughs in several aspects. 

During the process of redressing wrongful cases and implementing cadre policies, the Central Committee of Communist Party of China issued a large number of important documents, such as "The Notice of Completely Removing the Hats of Rightists", "The Notice of Rectification and Correction of Right Opportunism", "The Notice of Processing Methods for Central Documents involved in Historical Legacy Issues", "The Notice of Public Rectification for the 'Yang, Yu, Fu Incident'," "The Notice of Rectification for the So-called 'North China Mountain-headism'," and "The Notice of Diligently Spreading the Resolution to Rectify Liu Shaoqi". Many documents such as the Central Organization Department's "Investigation Report on the 'Case of 61 People'," Sichuan Provincial Committee's "Notice on Several Issues to be Noted in the Implementation of Policies," Shanghai Municipal Committee's "Requesting Report on Solving the so-called 'January Revolution'," and, the Central Organization Department's "Report on Rectifying the Novel 'Liu Zhidan'," were forwarded and approved.



In these documents and comments, the Central Committee, according to the fundamental principle of seeking truth from facts established by the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, determined the "Two Don't Cares", that is, any untruthful statements, any incorrect conclusions and handling, no matter when and under what circumstances, no matter which level of organization, who determined and approved, all need to be corrected; "Totally wrong, totally compensated; partially wrong, partially compensated; no wrong, no compensation"; "we need to solve problems and stabilize the situation"; we should deal with political and historical issues in a coarse manner, not entangle in minor details and not leave a "tail"; for the issues of economic compensation such as confiscation of wealth and withholding wages, due to the large quantity, the Central Committee decided to "primarily solve the problem politically, and give appropriate economic compensation"; and a series of major policy principles including "leaders take responsibility, personally take action, and the whole party handles the case".

According to the relevant documents and spirit of the Central Committee, in accordance with the instructions of the central leadership comrades, in order to redress wrong cases and implement cadre policy, the central organization department, or the central organization department in conjunction with the central united front department, the public security department, the ministry of education, the national science commission, the state council overseas Chinese office and other relevant departments, have drafted a series of specific policy provisions for redressing wrong cases and implementing cadre policy.

Before the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, based on thorough investigation and repeated verification, the Central Organization Department successively drafted policy documents such as the "Notice on Correctly Treating the Families and Children of Persons Under Investigation", "Notice on the Issue that Parents' Serious History and Political Problems Should Not Affect Their Children", "Notice on Implementation of Policies for Rural Grassroots Cadres", and "Notice on Specific Opinions on Implementing the Party's Intellectuals' Policy", forming the basic framework for redressing wrong cases and implementing cadre policy in thinking, guideline, and policy.

After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, according to the arrangements of the central government, Hu Yaobang was transferred to be the central secretary-general and the head of the central propaganda department, and Song Renqiong succeeded as the head of the central organization department. With the full development of the work to redress wrong cases and implement cadre policy, the Central Organization Department had encountered new issues in its work, according to the spirit and requirements of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, on the basis of thorough investigation and research, it accelerated the research and formulation of policy regulations in the work of redress wrong cases and implement cadre policy. According to incomplete statistics, from 1979 to 1982, by the Central Organization Department, or with the cooperation of relevant central and state departments, nearly thirty specific policy regulations were established on some aspects, which further improved the policy system of redress wrong cases and implement cadre policy.

The formulation and implementation of these guidelines and policies greatly promoted the unification and improvement of understandings of organizations and leaders at all levels to redress wrong cases, and implement cadre policy, standardized the methods and procedures in specific work, gave organizations at all levels the "laws" to follow in redressing wrong cases and implementing cadre policy, and ensured that the work of redress wrong cases and implement cadre policy has developed along a healthy track.

2. Further liberate thoughts, and promote the work of redressing wrong cases.

After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, in the work of redressing wrong cases and implementing cadre policy, some units and regional leaders and staff still have some "leftist" poison in their thinking that has not been completely purged, especially under the influence of the two "whatsoever" errors, their thoughts are not emancipated, they are reluctant to study and solve some cases, and they are hesitant to solve some issues that should be solved as instructed by the higher authorities, they even believe that policy implementation has gone too far; in some regions and units, the leadership is negatively resisting rectifying wrong cases and implementing cadre policy due to sectarianism, and they long-term neglect some people's problems, even cover them up. In response to these issues, the relevant central departments, firstly, intensified the effort to implement the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, widely publicized the party's ideological line of liberating thoughts and seeking truth from facts, further purged the "leftist" poison, especially the interference of the "two whatsoever".



The second step is to promote people's liberation of thought, improve the process of rectifying wrongful convictions of significant cases, and enforce cadre policy work through rectifying and redressing significant cases of wrongful convictions, such as the most wrongful court case during the Cultural Revolution - the case against Liu Shaoqi. The redressing of the Liu Shaoqi case significantly liberated the thoughts of the majority of cadres and the masses, powerfully drove the work of rectifying wrongful convictions and implementing cadre policy. The third step involves formulating and issuing documents, clearly stipulating that a severe response will be taken against a small number who resist the spirit of the third plenary session of the 11th Central Committee, stubbornly refuse to take action, or intentionally delay or passively oppose the rectification of wrongful convictions, as well as the implementation of cadre policies due to factional interference.

During the process of overturning wrongful convictions and implementing cadre policies, some leaders and workers have developed a sense of slackness because of their inadequate understanding of the importance, continuity and difficulty of this work. Some even removed their offices without inspection and acceptance. Therefore, party organizations at all levels have strengthened education on the importance and difficulty of reversing wrongful verdicts and implementing cadre policies, which has made them realize the far-reaching historical significance and significant practical significance of reversing wrongful verdicts and implementing cadre policies, and recognize the historical responsibility they shoulder. It is emphasized that you must do a good job until the end, and be responsible for the political life of each comrade. If there is still a wrong case that has not been corrected, then for this comrade, his problem is not resolved at all. We need to rectify each case and person thoroughly and stand the test of history.

In the work of rectifying wrongful cases and implementing cadre policies, the Central Organization Department requires all levels of organization departments to strengthen political and ideological work. Political solutions to problems must be prioritized, not lost in minor details. Strengthen the political care for the targets of policy implementation, strictly follow the Party's policies.

3. New progress in the work of rectifying wrongful cases during the "Cultural Revolution"
Under the guidance of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, by the end of 1982, the task of rectifying wrongful cases during the "Cultural Revolution" was basically completed, achieving a decisive victory in the work of rectifying wrongful cases and implementing cadre policies. A total of 2.3 million cadres were reviewed and rehabilitated during the "Cultural Revolution", and nearly 20,000 group cases were wrongfully judged, including a batch of major cases that had a major impact on the party, the country and even the world. These cases were handed over to the Central Organization Department from the central special case group, which reviewed a large number of senior cadres. 





All case materials are to be submitted to the Central Organization Department for processing. During the handover process, not a single page of material is allowed to be destroyed. On the morning of December 20, Chen Yeping, Deputy Minister of the Central Organization Department, conveyed the spirit of the handover meeting at the departmental and bureau chiefs' meeting. He made specific arrangements for the receipt and review work, and appointed special personnel to form a receiving agency, which was devoted to this work day and night. By the end of February 1979, the handover work of all case materials was completed. The Central Organization Department received a total of 1730 volumes and 391,363 items of materials transferred by the former central special case group, involving a total of 669 people under investigation.

Subsequently, the Central Organization Department immediately carried out the work of review and rehabilitation. According to statistics, among those included in the central special case investigation, there were 213 officials at the level of deputy ministers of central and national agencies, and deputy governors of provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities (including those at the same level in the military). Among them, there were 10 members of the 8th Political Bureau, 10 members of the Central Secretariat, 71 central committee members and alternate members (excluding those reviewed by provinces and cities), 7 deputy prime ministers, and a host of marshals and generals who fought in the north and south, as well as secretaries of the original central bureaus, provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities. Those under inspection were categorized as "serious issues or antagonism" amounting to 320 people, accounting for 47.8% of the total. Faced with such a large number of major cases, it would be impossible to realistically carry out reviews and rectifications in a short time with the power of only the Central Organization Department. As a result, the Central Organization Department adopted the following measures: first, it recalled all the leading comrades who were still working under the supervision of the Central Special Case Group. After the third plenary session of the Eleventh Central Committee, the Central Organization Department had more initiative on this issue. The ones who returned to Beijing were Peng Zhen and Zhang Jieqing couple. The previously imprisoned Wang Guangmei was also brought out. Other comrades were also gradually brought back by their respective units. Second, it adopted the procedure of first assigning work and then reviewing and rehabilitating some comrades, enabling these leading comrades to return to work as soon as possible. Third, according to the principle of handling the cases by the whole party and the mass line, the original units were asked to review the cases, and then the Central Organization Department would examine and report to the central government for approval, thus greatly speeding up the process of review and rehabilitation. Practice has proved that these measures have achieved good results. From 1979 to 1980, 445 people were directly concluded by the Central Organization Department and approved by the Central Government, including a large number of senior leaders such as Peng Zhen, Lu Dingyi, Tao Zhu, Liu Lantao, Xi Zhongxun, An Ziwen, Qian Ying, Hu Qiaomu, Shuai Mengqi, Zhao Yimin, Lin Feng, Tan Zhenlin, Li Lisan, and Wang Renzhong.

2) A thorough rehabilitation of a number of major cases of significant impact has been carried out.

i) The complete rehabilitation of the "July 20th Incident" in Wuhan. The "July 20th Incident" in Wuhan was on July 20, 1967, when workers, peasants, and soldiers in Wuhan took to the streets in a demonstration to oppose the conspiratorial activities of those sent by the "Gang of Four" to agitate against the army, disrupt military-civilian relations, support armed struggle, support smashing and looting, and disrupt production, and they engaged in reasoned struggle with them. Afterwards, Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" described the "July 20th Incident" as "a thorough counter-revolutionary incident". They falsely accused Wang Renzhong and Chen Zaidao, the main leaders of the Hubei Provincial Party Committee and the Wuhan Military Region Party Committee, as the "backstage" of the "July 20th Incident", and labeled a number of party, government and military leaders as "a handful of capitalist roaders" within the Party and the military. The vast number of cadres and masses who participated in or supported the demonstration were also subjected to brutal persecution.



In the struggle to denounce the "Gang of Four", the Hubei Provincial Party Committee, the Provincial Revolutionary Committee, and the Wuhan Military Region Party Committee, in response to the demands of the masses, considered that Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" described the "720 incident" as a "counter-revolutionary incident". This was a complete distortion of facts and a confusion of right and wrong. They believed it should be redressed and the false accusations imposed on the People's Liberation Army and the masses should be overturned. They submitted a report to the Central Government on "Request for Handling the Wuhan 720 Incident". In November 1978, the Central Committee of the Chinese Communist Party forwarded the report from the Hubei Provincial Party Committee, the Provincial Revolutionary Committee, and the Wuhan Military Region Party Committee, fully vindicating the Wuhan "720 Incident". 

② Redressing the so-called "February Adverse Current" issue. Around February 1967, leaders of the Central Politburo and the Military Commission, including Tan Zhenlin, Chen Yi, Ye Jianying, Li Fuchun, Li Xiannian, Xu Xiangqian, and Nie Rongzhen, criticised the "Cultural Revolution" and its erroneous practices at meetings such as the Central Military Commission meeting and the Central Politburo meeeting. They represented the will of the party members and the people, and fiercely opposed Lin Biao, the "Gang of Four", Kang Sheng, Chen Boda and their associates. However, they were suppressed and attacked under the pretext of the "February Adverse Current". After the Lin Biao group was crushed, Mao Zedong proposed to redress the "February Adverse Current", and indicated that once this issue was clarified, the term "February Adverse Current" should no longer be used. 

③ Redress for the case of the "61 Traitor Group". The so-called "61 Traitor Group" case was an extremely serious political case that caused sensation both domestically and internationally during the "Cultural Revolution". The so-called "traitors" refers to 61 Communist Party members including Bo Yibo who were specially approved by the central government to be released from the Grassland Prison in Beiping in 1936.

④ Redress for the cadres and masses criticised and persecuted in the so-called "January Revolution". The so-called "January Revolution" refers to the plot to seize power by Zhang Chunqiao and Yao Wenyuan from their return to Shanghai on January 4, 1967 to the establishment of the "Shanghai People's Commune" on February 5, where they initiated their machinations from Shanghai. In 1966, Zhang Chunqiao and Yao Wenyuan colluded with Lin Biao, Chen Boda, and Jiang Qing to incite "the creation of opposition to the Shanghai Municipal Committee"".



On January 4, 1967, Zhang Chunqiao and Yao Wenyuan returned to Shanghai, further stoked the idea that "there is no need to hold any more illusions about the Municipal Committee," and "the basic problem at the moment is to take back the leadership from the capitalist-roader faction," etc., creating an atmosphere of overthrowing everything and seizing power. On January 6, they convened the "Overthrow the Municipal Committee Conference" under the pretext of the names of various rebel organizations across the city, criticized the leaders of the Shanghai Municipal Committee, pointed out hundreds of cadres above the bureau level to be humiliated at the meeting, and declared that they no longer recognized Cao Diqiu as the Secretary and Mayor of the Shanghai Municipal Committee. In fact, they had seized the power of Shanghai and established the so-called "Shanghai People's Commune" on February 5. Subsequently, a power-seizing frenzy erupted across the country, many places even degenerated into armed conflicts, causing a severe situation where local party and government leadership organs were paralyzed or semi-paralyzed, and the social order and industrial and agricultural production were further damaged.
The so-called "January Revolution" was a conspiracy meticulously planned by Lin Biao, Chen Boda, and the "Gang of Four", it was an important step in their attempts to seize control of the party across the country.
In December 1978, the Shanghai Municipal Committee decided to rehabilitate Cao Diqiu and all other cadres and masses who were publicly named and criticized in the "January Revolution". In January 1979, the CPC Central Committee forwarded the Shanghai Municipal Committee's "Request Report on Resolving the So-called 'January Revolution' Issue", fully vindicating the cadres and masses who were criticized and persecuted in the so-called "January Revolution".
Ⅴ. Rehabilitation for the "Yang, Yu, Fu Incident". In March 1968, Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" created the so-called "Yang, Yu, Fu Incident" in order to subvert the party and seize power. They falsely accused Yang Chengwu (Alternate Member of the 8th Central Committee of the CPC, Standing Member of the Central Military Commission, Acting Chief of Staff), Yu Ligong (Political Commissar of the Air Force, Second Secretary of the Air Force Party Committee), and Fu Chongbi (Commander of the Beijing Garrison) of "attempting to reverse the February Adverse Current".  In March 1979, the CPC Central Committee issued a "Notice on Public Rehabilitation for the 'Yang, Yu, Fu Incident'", pointing out that the so-called "Yang, Yu, Fu Incident" was purely a wrongful case fabricated by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". The Central Committee decided to publicly rehabilitate for the "Yang, Yu, Fu Incident". All slanders and falsehoods should be overturned; previously issued Central documents are revoked. Due to the case, comrades who were implicated and persecuted to death or disability should be rehabilitated unconditionally and their reputations restored.
Ⅵ. Rehabilitation for the So-called "North China Parochialism". In March 1968, Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" fabricated the charges of "North China Parochialism" and "Shanxi-Chahar-Hebei Parochialism" during the creation of the "Yang, Yu, Fu Incident". Later, the "Crusade against North China Parochialism" was held in the Beijing Military Region time and again, with the spearhead directly pointing at Nie Rongzhen, Xu Xiangqian, Luo Ruiqing, and Yang Chengwu, who had held major leadership positions in North China. They fabricated crimes on some leaders of the Beijing Military Region, brutally persecuted them, implicated a large number of comrades, messed up people's minds, undermined the unity and construction of the troops, causing serious harmful effects.



In December 1979, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued a notice "On the Rectification of the So-called 'North China Hilltopism,'" pointing out that Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" maliciously slandered and defamed the glorious history of the Jinji, North China, and Beijing Military Regions, entirely out of their anti-revolutionary political needs. They saw the Beijing Military Region as a serious obstacle to their anti-revolutionary coup, so they frequently stirred up the nasty waves of anti-"North China Hilltopism" and tried every possible means to overthrow the older revolutionary comrades who had worked in North China and some leading comrades in the Beijing Military Region at that time to realize their conspiracy to usurp the party and power. The Central formally announced: The so-called "Jinji Hilltopism," "North China Hilltopism," etc., are pure baseless slanders and should be completely overthrown. All related materials shall be withdrawn. All comrades who have been persecuted and implicated due to this case shall be rehabilitated and their honor restored.

⑦ Rehabilitation of Liu Shaoqi and a large number of comrades implicated in Liu Shaoqi's unjust, false, and wrong cases. The case of Liu Shaoqi, the Vice Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and President of the People's Republic of China, is the largest unjust case during the "Cultural Revolution" and in the history of the Republic. After the "Gang of Four" was smashed, a large number of cadres inside and outside the party and the masses demanded and suggested to the Central to review the case of Liu Shaoqi. The Central decided in February 1979 for the Central Discipline Inspection Committee and the Central Organization Department to review the case of Liu Shaoqi. The result was presented in February 1980, and the Fifth Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee discussed it seriously and unanimously passed the "Resolution on Rehabilitation of Comrade Liu Shaoqi," pointing out: "The original review report imposed on Comrade Liu Shaoqi the 'traitor, spy, scab' three major charges and various other charges, which were fully intended to frame Liu Shaoqi by Lin Biao, Jiang Qing, Kang Sheng, Chen Boda, and others. The decision of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Eighth Session based on this to 'expel Liu Shaoqi from the party forever and revoke his duties inside and outside the party' was wrong." "Comrade Liu Shaoqi was a great Marxist and a proletarian revolutionary who devoted his life to communism. As one of the outstanding main leaders of the party and the state, he has indelible achievements in the construction of our party, the democratic revolution, the socialist revolution, and socialist construction." "All the slanders, false charges, fabricated materials, and words of truth about Comrade Liu Shaoqi in the past should be completely overthrown."

The plenary session decided to revoke the charges imposed on Liu Shaoqi by the Twelfth Central Committee of the Eighth Session and his treatment decision; restore Liu Shaoqi's reputation as a great Marxist and proletarian revolutionary and one of the main leaders of the party and state; and the Central Organization Department will rehabilitate the wrongful, false, and mistaken cases related to Liu Shaoqi. On March 19, 1980, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued a notice "On earnestly conveying the resolution for the rehabilitation of Comrade Liu Shaoqi."

The plenary session required all levels of the party organization to implement this spirit and actively and responsibly continue to solve similar unresolved or not fully resolved issues.
