In discussing democracy, it is necessary to explain what socialist democracy is by analyzing the activities of several illegal organizations. The conclusion is, can we not uphold the four continuous actions? Can we not take the bad people in society seriously? This may be more powerful and targeted. If the language is too vague, it will not be prominent and lack persuasive power, and the power to mobilize will also be lacking. We need to mobilize the masses to fight against these bad people. He also pointed out that democracy is a democracy under the guidance of high concentration, and concentration is a concentration based on a high degree of democracy. We must develop democracy, fully utilize the wisdom of the people, and mobilize the enthusiasm of the people. Only on the basis of democracy can we solve bureaucracy and the will of the authorities. However, without a high degree of concentration based on democracy, these cannot be achieved. Talking about party leadership emphasizes the need for unified leadership and authority. Without the unified leadership of the party, there is no efficiency. With the unified leadership of the party, as long as this leadership is correct, our adjustments will be fast, and the construction speed will be fast. If we are not unified, nothing will be achieved. Lenin strongly emphasized centralized unity and discipline. Our revolutionary war was won under high concentration and high discipline. 

Deng Xiaoping sternly pointed out that the Democracy Wall actually has a program. Those who misuse democracy and the Democracy Wall to do bad things, sell intelligence, and inform foreign countries should be banned. We need to separate the minority of bad people from the masses.



To mobilize the masses to fight against these villains. Without stopping the troublemakers, without opposing these villains, there is no hope for the Four Modernizations. The destructive activities and absurd theories of some illegal organizations in Shanghai and Beijing are opposed by the majority. What they are doing is the same as Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". These people just want chaos. We need to tell people, especially young people, not to be fooled by them. Their nature, ideological system, and organizational goals are against socialism, against the dictatorship of the proletariat, against the Communist Party, against Marxism-Leninism, and Mao Zedong Thought.

During the conversation, Deng Xiaoping also criticized the problems in the theoretical field. He said that the ideological and theoretical front cannot be said to have truly implemented the shift in focus. There is a tendency to dwell on old scores. There is less publicity of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, and there are some ambiguous and even radical expressions. This is not good, not conducive to unity and progress, not conducive to mobilizing the enthusiasm of the people, not conducive to striving for the Four Modernizations. Why not publicize the good traditions of the party more? Traditional education includes discipline, hard work and consideration of the overall situation. Theory should serve politics. The largest politics in the country is now to unite and look forward, striving for the Four Modernizations. To implement the Four Modernizations, we will encounter many difficulties and the masses should be prepared. Many new issues need to be researched and answered by theorists, but such theorists are currently lacking.

5. The Formal Proposal of the Four Fundamental Principles
On March 30, three days after the resumption of the theoretical work conference, Deng Xiaoping delivered a famous speech at the Great Hall of the People on behalf of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, titled "Adhering to the Four Fundamental Principles".
The speech is strongly targeted, but it does not focus on specific issues, but deeply elaborates on the unique political basis and connotation of modernization construction in the Chinese style.
Deng Xiaoping proposed adhering to the four fundamental principles as a basic condition for achieving the Four Modernizations, and emphatically emphasized that the "four fundamental principles" are one of the basic connotations of the newly proposed "China-style Four Modernizations".
Deng Xiaoping pointed out that in the past, the democratic revolution had to adapt to Chinese conditions and take the path of Mao Zedong's encirclement of cities from rural areas. Now in construction, it also needs to adapt to Chinese conditions and take a Chinese-style modernization path.
To achieve the Four Modernizations in China, at least two important characteristics must be recognized:
One is the lack of basis. The long-term destruction of imperialism, feudalism, and bureaucratic capitalism has made China a poor and backward country.



After the founding of New China, our economic construction has achieved great achievements, establishing a relatively complete industrial system and cultivating a batch of technical talents. The average annual growth rate of our industry and agriculture from the time of liberation until last year is relatively high in the world. However, due to the thin foundation, China is still one of the poorest countries in the world. China's scientific and technological strength is insufficient, and the level of science and technology is generally lagging behind the advanced countries in the world for twenty to thirty years. In the past thirty years, our economy has gone through two rises and two falls, especially the great destruction of the national economy by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" from 1966 to 1976, the consequences of which are extremely serious. Now we want to adjust, that is, to further eliminate this serious consequence.

Another issue is the large population and the lack of arable land. There are now more than 900 million people in the country, eighty percent of whom are farmers. Having many people has both advantages and disadvantages. Under the conditions of insufficient production, eating, education, and employment have all become serious problems. We need to vigorously strengthen family planning work, but even if the population does not increase several years later, the problem of high population will still exist for a period. We have abundant resources, which is our advantage. But many resources have not been fully explored, and they have not been exploited and used, so they are not effective means of production yet. The land area is vast, but the arable land is very small. The situation of less arable land and a lot of population especially farmers is not easy to change. This is a feature that must be considered in China's modernization construction.

Chinese-style modernization must start from China's own characteristics. For example, modern production only requires fewer people, but we have such a large population. How can we balance these two aspects? If we don't balance these two aspects, we will face a long-term social problem of insufficient employment. There are many problems here that need to be studied by comrades from the whole party who are doing practical work and theoretical work. We can certainly find appropriate methods to solve them properly.

Then, Deng Xiaoping changed the subject and pointed out that the Central Committee believes that if we want to achieve the four modernizations in China, we must adhere to the four basic principles in thought and politics. These are the fundamental prerequisites to achieving the four modernizations. These four are: First, we must adhere to the socialist road; Second, we must maintain the dictatorship of the proletariat; Third, we must maintain the leadership of the Communist Party; Fourth, we must adhere to Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought.

Deng Xiaoping said, as everyone knows, these four basic principles are not new things. They are what our party has consistently stuck to for a long time. From the smashing of the "Gang of Four" to the Third Plenary Session, the series of policies implemented by the Central Committee of the Party have always adhered to these four basic principles.

In practice and theory, we have criticized the "Gang of Four"'s advocacy of universal poverty under the guise of extreme leftist fake socialism. We stuck to the principles of socialist public ownership and distribution according to work.



We adhere to the principle of self-reliance, supplemented by seeking foreign aid, and learning and introducing advanced foreign technology for the development of our socialist economic construction. We try to act according to objective economic laws, which is to say, we adhere to scientific socialism. 
We have smashed the feudal fascism of the "Gang of Four", redressed a large number of wrongful cases, resolved a series of historical issues, consolidated the proletarian dictatorship, and restored and developed socialist democracy, especially after the Third Plenary Session, a vibrant political situation that Comrade Mao Zedong had hoped for many years was realized. 
We have restored the party's three major styles that were damaged, perfected the party's democratic centralism, and strengthened the unity of the whole party and the unity of the party and the masses, thereby greatly enhancing the prestige of the party and strengthened the leadership of the party over the state and social life. 
We have broken the mental shackles created by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". We insist that leaders are humans, not gods; we grasp the scientific system of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought in a complete and accurate way; and we proceed from reality and seek truth from facts. This has restored the true features of Mao Zedong Thought and maintained the high status that Comrade Mao Zedong, as a great revolutionary, should enjoy in the history of Chinese revolution and world revolution. 
Deng Xiaoping pointed out that despite this, the Central Committee believed it was necessary to emphasize and propagate these four fundamental principles. On one side, some in the party are still deeply poisoned by the extreme leftist thoughts of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". A small number of individuals even spread rumors and slander, attacking the Central Committee's violation of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought in its series of policies since the smashing of the "Gang of Four" and especially after the Third Plenary Session. On the other side, a small number of individuals in society are disseminating thoughts that doubt or oppose these four fundamental principles. Yet inside the party, a few comrades not only fail to recognize the danger of these thoughts but even directly or indirectly offer some degree of support. Although these individuals are few in number both inside and outside the party, we cannot ignore their impact. The facts have shown that they have caused, and can cause, significant harm to our cause. Therefore, we must both continue to firmly purge the poison of the "Gang of Four" and help comrades who are still under its influence wake up, and also strike at the reactionary speeches slandering the Central Committee spread by a small number of individuals. At the same time, we must make great efforts to resolutely combat the thoughts that doubt the four basic principles mentioned above. Both of these streams of thought violate Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought and impede the progress of our socialist modernization. 
Then, Deng Xiaoping emphatically refuted the thoughts of doubting or opposing the four basic principles from the right, with a clear viewpoint, profound depth, and highly persuasive arguments. 
In the summary section, Deng Xiaoping especially pointed out that the Central Committee considers it necessary to repeatedly stress the adherence to these four basic principles today, as there are individuals (even if only a very few) attempting to shake these basic principles. This is absolutely impermissible. Every Communist Party member, let alone every party ideological and theoretical worker, is not allowed to waver in the slightest on this basic position. If any of the four basic principles are shaken, then the entire socialist cause and the entire modernization project are shaken. 
At the historical turning point when the party and the state were correcting chaos and shifting the focus of work to socialist modernization, Deng Xiaoping, on behalf of the Central Committee, put forward the four basic principles for the first time in a clear and complete manner, and gave them a profound and systematic explanation, whose significance is deep and profound. Since then, the four basic principles, as an important theme in our country's political life, have become the foundation of our party's policy-making, and continue to be enriched and perfected with the development of practice.




In 1982, the Four Basic Principles was officially incorporated into the Party Constitution and state Constitution, becoming the common will of the whole Party and the people of the country. The 13th Party Congress regarded the adherence to the Four Basic Principles as a fundamental point in the basic line of the Party at the primary stage of socialism. The 14th Congress listed it as a "foundation of the state" and a basic part of Deng Xiaoping's theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The 15th Congress established Deng Xiaoping's theory as the guiding thought of the Party, and the Four Basic Principles as an integral part of Deng Xiaoping's theory was highly reaffirmed. The Four Basic Principles are a high summary of the long-term historical experience of our Party and country and are the common political foundation for the unified struggle of the whole Party and the people of the country.

Vincent: The "Remedial Class" of the Discussion on the Criteria of Truth

After the "Working Conference on Theoretical Issues", the trend of opposing the Four Basic Principles from the right was quickly defeated. However, the long-standing rigid or semi-rigid state of mind is hard to overcome in a short term, the "leftist" thinking tendency is still quite serious, and it has become a major obstacle to rectification. 

1. Proposal of the Issue of Remedial Classes in the Discussion on the Criteria of Truth

The promotion of democracy and the liberation of thought since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee has just begun. Yet some people believe that it has gone too far. Some people wrongly attribute the chaos once appeared in society to the Third Plenary Session, believing that these chaotic phenomena were caused by the promotion of democracy and the liberation of thought. Some others pit the Four Basic Principles against the line of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, viewing the Four Basic Principles as a "correction" of the Third Plenary Session. All these incorrect views in cadres' minds suggest that it is still a major long-term task of the ideological and theoretical front to continue liberating our minds and overcome rigid thinking. Therefore, it is important and urgent to continue a profound discussion on the criteria of truth, further rectify the Party's ideological line.

On May 21, 1979, The People’s Liberation Army Daily published a commentary titled “Unswervingly Continue to Implement the Spirit of the Third Plenary Session”. The article pointed out some ideological understanding problems that emerged in the process of implementing the spirit of the Third Plenary Session. The article explains that the discussion on practice being the sole criterion for testing truth had a great effect in liberating thought. However, many units in the army did not carry out this discussion. The article proposed that our army comrades must hurry to make up this lesson, and re-study the Third Plenary Session documents. This earliest, clearest proposal of a “make-up class” for the discussion on the criterion of truth.

On May 22, 1979, People's Daily republished this commentary in a prominent position on the first page, with the title, "Re-study the Third Plenary Session Documents and Make Up the Lesson on the Criterion of Truth". This was the first time that People's Daily explicitly proposed to "make up classes".

2. Various Localities and Departments Respond to the Remedial Discussion on the Criteria of Truth

Starting from May 1979, leaders from various regions and departments gave speeches, analysed the situation, and pointed out that the main current issue was still the liberation of thought. Local Party committees and propaganda departments also held meetings in succession, emphasising that practice is the sole criterion for testing truth, and continuing to conduct in-depth discussions on the criteria of truth. The official newspapers of central and local Party also published many articles on this aspect.



In mid-May, Feng Wenbin, Vice President of the Central Party School, pointed out during a report to all students of the school: The main obstacle to implementing the policies of the Third Plenary Session of the Central Committee still lies in the ideological rigidity among some cadres. He said: "At present, in many places, education on distinguishing between two lines of thought is not widespread or deeply rooted. Some comrades say, 'The general situation of freeing our minds is that the Central Committee has taken the lead, some places have followed suit, but many places have not taken initial steps.' Therefore, continuing to propagate the line of thought based on dialectical materialism, freeing ourselves from the spiritual shackles of Lin Biao and the 'Gang of Four', and daring to ponder, bring up, and solve new problems in the new Long March, are absolutely necessary."

In mid-May, the main leaders of the Sichuan Provincial Communist Party Committee pointed out in a speech at the second plenary session of the Provincial Committee: From the perspective of the ideological state of the party, especially senior and mid-level cadres, it is relatively easy to adhere to the four fundamental principles, but to continue to free people's minds is still a big problem, especially to combine Marxism, Mao Zedong Thought, and the practicalities of the Four Modernizations, to study new situations and solve new problems, are far from enough. He said that the rigid and semi-rigid state of thought within the party still exists, and a considerable number of comrades have not resolved their lingering fears, which will take a long time and a lot of effort to resolve. Therefore, he proposed to further study, propagate, and implement the spirit of the Third Plenary Session, and to unify the adherence to the four basic principles with the liberation of thought.

The leaders of the Anhui Provincial Communist Party Committee pointed out at the Provincial Committee's work meeting held in May: We need to distinguish between the mainstream and tributaries regarding the situation. For a period of time, some people took advantage of our promotion of democracy and freedom of thought to spread doubts and denials about the four basic principles. There were also a few instances of anarchism and extreme democratization in society. This is the tributary. After conveying and implementing the leaders' speeches about the "Four Persistences", the situation quickly changed. We must not be confused by these tributaries. Currently, there is also a wave of erroneous thought that denies the Third Plenary Session. Some people seize on some tributary phenomena, exaggerate them, and then attack the party's line as being "too right", and the policies of the Third Plenary Session as being "biased". We must also pay full attention to this kind of trend that appears with a "leftist" face. This shows that many people's thoughts are still in a rigid state. Therefore, we need to understand the situation accurately, firm up our political direction, continue to deeply implement the spirit of the Third Plenary Session, continue to free thought, and lead the discussion on the criterion of truth into depth. This discussion has surpassed any theoretical problem discussion on the ideological front since the founding of New China, and it is another deeply meaningful Marxist educational movement and thought liberation movement after the Yan'an Rectification Movement.

The leaders of the Jiangxi Provincial Communist Party Committee delivered a speech at the Provincial Committee's work meeting held in May, calling on party organizations at all levels in the province to adhere to the principle of emancipating the mind, getting things moving, being realistic, looking forward in unity, and bringing the thoughts of the party and the people in line with the spirit of the Third Plenary Session. The Jiangxi Provincial Committee's work meeting believes that as long as it adheres to the resolutions of the Third Plenary Session, persists in liberating the mind, adheres to the line of thought that practice is the only standard for testing the truth, persists in getting into the heart of the matter, conducting research, and taking the mass line, the existing problems and difficulties can be completely solved.

In early June, the leaders of the Guangdong Provincial Communist Party Committee pointed out at the meeting of cadres at the prefectural, city, and county levels across the province: We must pay attention to opposing the interference of erroneous thinking from the "left" and the right. Compared to the rightist thought, the "left" thought is more likely to confuse people, poses a greater threat to us, and needs to arouse everyone's vigilance. The emergence of "leftist" and rightist thoughts is not because we have implemented the spirit of the Third Plenary Session, on the contrary, it is a manifestation of our not yet fully implementing the spirit of the Third Plenary Session. It should be said that we have only initially implemented the spirit of the Third Plenary Session, it's 'the beginning', definitely not 'overdoing it’.



Therefore, we need to continue to study the documents of the Third Plenary Session seriously. In many places, we still need to catch up on the discussion of the criterion of truth; the education of the dialectical materialist ideological line must also continue. The head of the Communist Party of Hubei Province pointed out at the expanded meeting of the provincial committee that there were differences in our party and among the cadres regarding the policies of the Third Plenary Session, and there appeared a trend of doubting or opposing the spirit of the Third Plenary Session. A few comrades believed that after the Third Plenary Session, the "policies have shifted to the right." This misunderstanding is due to a lack of comprehensive and correct understanding of the guidelines and policies of the Third Plenary Session, and the confusion of some unavoidable issues during the implementation of the spirit of the Third Plenary Session with the established policies of the Third Plenary Session. Therefore, it is necessary to continue to free up thoughts and eliminate the influence of the extreme leftist ideology left among the cadres.

The head of the General Political Department of the People's Liberation Army also put forward demands to continue to understand that practice is the sole criterion for testing truth and to further eliminate the harmful influence and effects of the extreme left lines of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four." Subsequently, the expanded meeting of the Standing Committee of the Navy Party Committee decided to launch an in-depth study and discussion among the navy that practice is the sole criterion for testing truth, seriously solving the issue of the ideological line and discussing the problem of the criterion of the truth.

3. Expansion of the nationwide discussion on the criterion of truth- standard issue
Some of the central leaders, especially Deng Xiaoping, paid great attention to the discussion of the criterion of truth. On July 29, 1979, he pointed out in a speech when meeting with all the participants of the expanded meeting of the Standing Committee of the Navy Party Committee: "There were many people who opposed the argument that practice is the only criterion for testing truth in the beginning, but the vast majority of cadres and the people in the country have gradually accepted it. This debate is not over yet. The consideration of remedial studies by the navy now is very important. The discussion of the criterion of truth is basic construction. If the problem of the ideological line is not resolved and if thoughts are not freed, the correct political line cannot be formulated; if it is formulated, it cannot be implemented. So don't underestimate the debate that practice is the only criterion for testing the truth. The significance of this debate is too great, and its essence lies in whether to adhere to Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought."

In mid-August of the same year, Deng Xiaoping inspected the work in Tianjin. At that time, the Tianjin Municipal Party Committee of the Communist Party of China was holding an expanded meeting of the Standing Committee. Deng listened to the work report of the city's Standing Committee, and made important remarks on the implementation of the policies of the Third Plenary Session, deepening understanding of the party's political, ideological, and organizational lines in the new period, and especially the extensive promotion of the discussion on "Practice is the sole criterion for testing truth." According to the spirit of Deng Xiaoping's speech, the person in charge of the Communist Party of China Tianjin Municipal Committee proposed that to adhere to the political line of the Third Plenary Session, we must keep our minds open and carry out a major discussion on the standard of truth. We must put in a lot of effort and engage in serious discussion from the municipal party committee to the grassroots units. Especially, leaders above districts, counties, and bureaus should study earnestly.

On September 29, 1979, Ye Jianying gave a speech at the celebration marking the 30th anniversary of the founding of New China. He proposed in his speech: "We need to carry out in-depth studies and discussions on the issue of the criterion of truth in all areas and industries, from leadership organizations to the grassroots level, and carry out education on the dialectical materialist ideological line. Especially, the main responsible cadres should take the lead in freeing their minds clearly and prominently. The responsibility of leading lies in further guiding the thinking of the masses of cadres onto the political line of realizing the four modernizations." This speech was discussed and approved by the party's Eleventh Fourth Plenary Session, so it can be seen as the layout and requirements made by the party central committee for catching-up studies on the issue of the criterion of truth.



Before and after this time, all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the Central Government, as well as all branches of the People's Liberation Army under the unified leadership and deployment of Party committees at all levels, had successively carried out "make-up sessions" for discussions on the standard of truth. Beginning in the summer and autumn of 1979, the "make-up classes" on the issue of the standard of truth started nationwide, reaching its climax by late 1979. This round of "make-up classes" surpassed the discussions of 1978 in both breadth and depth, especially by reaching down to the grassroots level, catalyzing a strong resonance among the masses and cadre at the grassroots level, and creating a true atmosphere of large-scale discussion. In fact, this broad discussion lasted until June 1981, when the Sixth Plenary Session of the 11th Party Central Committee issued the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic of China," basically completing the rectification of guiding principles. Only then were the "makeup classes" considered to conclude.
The "make-up sessions" for the discussions on the standard of truth represented not only a continuation of the 1978 discussions under new circumstances but also a widespread dissemination of the Marxist ideological line. It also further promoted and implemented the spirit of the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee.
III. Passage of the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic of China"
Following the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, the Party undertook substantial rectification of the devastation caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" during the "Cultural Revolution" across various fields. At the same time, it cleared up and corrected some "leftist" mistakes that had occurred prior to the "Cultural Revolution." On this basis, the Party thoroughly reviewed and summarized the history of the socialist revolution and the building of socialism since the founding of New China and drafted and passed the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic of China."
1. The Objective Requirement to Summarize Historical Experiences and Lessons
Even during the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, Deng Xiaoping proposed to summarize the history of the "Cultural Revolution." He pointed out that it was necessary to summarize the drawbacks and mistakes that occurred during the "Cultural Revolution" as lessons learned when the time is appropriate, for the unity of cognition of the whole Party. The "Cultural Revolution" has already become a stage in the history of our country's socialist development; it needs summary, but there is no need to rush it. Rigorous research is necessary to make a scientific evaluation of such a historical phase. Deng Xiaoping's opinion was accepted by the whole Party and incorporated into the plenary communiqué. 
After this plenary session, the Party Central Committee immediately began undertaking this specific work. In September 1979, on the eve of the 30th anniversary of the founding of New China, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China organized some cadres engaged in theoretical work to conduct a relatively comprehensive research and summary of the history of the 30 years since the founding of New China, and drafted a speech draft, which was then widely solicited for opinions inside and outside the Party. From September 25th to 28th, the Fourth Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee was held to discuss and approve this speech draft, to be delivered by Ye Jianying on the 30th anniversary of the National Day.
On September 29th, Ye Jianying, on behalf of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress, and the State Council, gave a lengthy speech at the 30th anniversary celebration of New China. He comprehensively reviewed the 30 years of history since the founding of New China and pointed out: The achievements we have made over the past 30 years have been great, and failing to see such great achievements is entirely wrong. Of course, as everyone knows, the road we have traversed has been anything but smooth. We have experienced both relatively smooth development and serious setbacks. Compared with the hard efforts made by the whole Chinese people and the superiority that the socialist system should have brought forth, our achievements are not enough. We must seriously summarize our experiences and lessons, and strive to achieve even greater success.
Ye Jianying recalled in his speech: since the founding of New China, we treated the wounds caused by the long-term war in just three years, successfully completed the remaining tasks of the democratic revolution, and restored the national economy to the highest level of old China's history while carrying out aid to North Korea against the U.S. aggression.
Subsequently, in 1956, we successfully carried out the socialist transformation of agriculture, handicrafts, and capitalist industry and commerce, completed the development of the national economy and the first Five-Year Plan, and achieved brilliant achievements in the socialist revolution and construction. However, in front of great victories, we began to be less cautious.




In 1957, the mistake of overgeneralization was made in the counterattack against the right-wing elements of the bourgeoisie. In 1958, principles of objective laws were violated in the guidance of economic work, separating from the principles of thorough investigation and empirical testing, leading to mistakes like blind commands, boastfulness, and the "communist wind". In 1959, a struggle against so-called right-leaning opportunism was inappropriately launched within the party.

When discussing the "Cultural Revolution", Ye Jianying pointed out that the starting point of initiating the "Cultural Revolution" was anti-revisionism. For a ruling proletariat party, it is of course necessary to always be vigilant and prevent the imperialist path of oppressing the people and pursuing hegemony. The problem lies in the fact that when the "Cultural Revolution" was initiated, an unrealistic assessment was made of the situation within the party and the country, and an accurate explanation of what revisionism is was not provided. Moreover, it deviated from the principles of democratic centralism and adopted erroneous policies and methods of struggle. Lin Biao, the "Gang of Four" and others, for their anti-revolutionary purposes, exploited these errors, pushed them to the extreme, caused great destruction to our country for a decade, and brought a major disaster to the Chinese people. The cause of socialism suffered the most serious setbacks since the founding of New China.

After reviewing the history of New China since its establishment, Ye Jianying summarizes several lessons as follows: 
(1) The fundamental purpose of the socialist revolution is to liberate productivity. Therefore, after the proletariat has won national power and established a socialist system, it must steadfastly focus on economic construction to develop social productivity and gradually improve people's lives.
(2) A scientific understanding conforming to objective reality of the class conditions and class struggle situation after the establishment of the socialist system must be provided and correct policies and methods must be adopted.
(3) It is especially important to correctly comprehend the interrelationship between the masses, the classes, the party, and leaders in a socialist society.
(4) It is necessary to further improve party discipline and socialist legal system, to genuinely guarantee the democratic rights of all party members and citizens, and to institutionalize and legalize the democracy within the party and the socialist democracy.

The above-mentioned statement by Ye Jianying shows that the Chinese Communist Party is an upright proletarian party that dares to admit its own mistakes. It also indicates that after experiencing a long period of setbacks and mistakes, the Chinese Communist Party has correctly summarized the lessons from its work and is thus more mature.

2. Correctly evaluate Mao Zedong and scientifically recognize Mao Zedong Thought

At that time, when the Central Committee of the Party was summarizing the history since the establishment of New China, it faced the complex problem of how to scientifically and correctly evaluate the merits and demerits of Mao Zedong's life. This is because, on the one hand, Mao Zedong was the main leader of the Chinese Communist Party and the main founder of the People's Republic of China, a leader deeply loved by the Chinese people and a contributor to the immortal merits of the Chinese Revolution and the liberation of the Chinese nation. On the other hand, Mao Zedong made serious "leftist" mistakes in his later years, leading to the disaster of the "Cultural Revolution". At the same time, how to evaluate Mao Zedong is an unavoidable issue when summarizing the history of the Party since the establishment of New China. And whether such a leader can be evaluated is a key factor in the success of the Party's rectification work.

After the third plenary session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, with the advancement of rectification and the gradual correction of "left" errors, especially with the deepening discussion on the criterion of truth, the long-standing superstition about individuals was broken, and people no longer regarded Mao Zedong as a god or a flawless revolutionary leader. At that time, two tendencies existed on the issue of how to view Mao Zedong's merits and demerits. One tendency was that some people still failed to free themselves from the influence of personality worship and would not admit the fact that Mao Zedong had made mistakes. Another tendency was that due to resentment towards the consequences of "leftist" errors on the party, the state, their own families or themselves, some people had extreme psychology and blamed all errors on Mao Zedong personally.



Clearly, neither of these biases is conducive to a correct evaluation of Mao Zedong, nor to the work of correcting the "leftist" mistakes and scientifically summarizing historical experiences. In response to the above situations, the Party Central Committee, especially elder revolutionaries like Deng Xiaoping, called for people to liberate their minds and break through forbidden areas, while guiding them on how to pragmatically treat Mao Zedong's achievements and mistakes, and to fully and accurately understand Mao Zedong Thought.

On March 30, 1979, Deng Xiaoping, in his speech titled "Persist in the Four Cardinal Principles", addressed the erroneous trend against Mao Zedong Thought that appeared in society at that time. He pointed out that the series of victories achieved in China's revolution and construction are inseparable from Mao Zedong Thought, and Mao Zedong has made immortal contributions to the Chinese people throughout his life. As with every person, Mao Zedong also had his shortcomings and mistakes. When analyzing his shortcomings and mistakes, we must acknowledge personal responsibility, but it is more important to analyze the complex historical background. Only in this way, can we treat history and historical figures fairly, scientifically, and in a Marxist manner. 

In August 1980, when answering a question from the Italian journalist Faraci, Deng Xiaoping elaborated on the Chinese Communist Party's evaluation of Mao Zedong, and the attitude towards Mao Zedong Thought. He pointed out that Chairman Mao's accomplishments should be ranked first. He is the main founder of the Chinese Communist Party and the People's Republic of China. The things he did for the Chinese people cannot be erased. He saved the party and the people from crisis several times. Without Chairman Mao, at least our Chinese people would have to grope in the dark for a longer time. Mao Zedong Thought is the guiding thought of our party. Mao Zedong Thought is principally his own, but it is not solely his creation; it includes the participation of older revolutionaries in its establishment and development. 

Regarding the mistakes Mao Zedong made in his later years, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that some unhealthy factors and thoughts gradually emerged, mainly some "leftist" ideas. The mistakes started in the late 1950s. He did not implement the past good work style, such as democratic centralism, the mass line, and did not establish or form a good system, which finally led to the "Cultural Revolution". Mao Zedong committed political mistakes. This mistake is not small. On the other hand, the mistake was exploited by the two counter-revolutionary groups of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". Their goal was to conspire to seize power. Therefore, it's necessary to distinguish Mao Zedong's mistakes from the crimes of Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four". Chairman Mao's errors should be ranked second. We must speak the truth about his later mistakes, and we must continue Mao Zedong Thought.

From Deng Xiaoping's answers to the journalists, it can be seen that the correct evaluation of Mao Zedong's merits and demerits by the Chinese communists contrasts sharply with the complete denial of Stalin's merits by the then Soviet leader Khrushchev in the international communist movement. This signifies the greatness and maturity of the Chinese Communist Party.

Subsequently, from March 1980 to June 1981, during the process of drafting the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party Since the Founding of the People's Republic", Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized the need to establish Mao Zedong's historical position and to uphold and develop Mao Zedong Thought. He pointed out that evaluating Mao Zedong and explaining Mao Zedong Thought does not just concern Mao Zedong as an individual; it is inseparable from our party and our country's entire history. Regarding Mao Zedong's mistakes, they must be criticized unequivocally, but they must be handled truthfully and with analysis of different situations. We must uphold Mao Zedong Thought. Our party has educated an entire generation with Mao Zedong Thought. Now, when we talk about "rectifying chaos", we are referring to correcting the chaos caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four", criticizing the mistakes of Mao Zedong's later years, and returning to the correct path of Mao Zedong Thought.

Other older comrades also set aside personal grudges, and, starting from the best interests of the party and the people, they contributed to the correct evaluation of Mao Zedong's merits and demerits and set an example.



Huang Kecheng, a devoted communist who suffered from the long-term persecution of "leftist" mistakes since 1959 and was wrongly criticized and managed by Mao Zedong at the Lushan Conference, still highly affirmed Mao Zedong's historical achievements at that time. In November 1980, he discussed the issue of how to evaluate Mao Zedong and the attitude towards Mao Zedong's thoughts at the meeting of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection. He talked about the history and reviewed Mao Zedong's significant contributions to the Chinese revolution. At the same time, he pointed out that we should have a correct attitude towards Mao Zedong's mistakes. If all the mistakes made by our party since the founding of the People's Republic of China are counted on Mao Zedong and let him bear the responsibility alone, it does not conform to the historical facts. In the past, we old communists also made contributions to liberating the whole of China and building a new China; the credit belongs to everyone. Now if all errors are attributed to one person, as if we have no part in it, it is unfair. We should all share the responsibility that should be shared, which conforms to historical facts and materialism. Huang Kecheng said earnestly: some comrades have said many extreme words about Chairman Mao, and some people even say that he is completely wrong. I think this is wrong, not only does it fundamentally violate the facts, but it is also very disadvantageous to our party and the people. For some comrades, especially those who have been hit and persecuted, it is understandable to have some angry emotions. As you know, I also suffered in Chairman Mao's later years. But I believe that for such a significant issue, we mustn't let emotions affect judgement, we can only start from the fundamental interests of the entire party and country.

Huang Kecheng's speech was later organized into an article published in the People's Daily on April 10, 1981. His article had a significant impact on society. Many people were deeply moved after reading this article. If such a troubled old comrade can treat history impartially without resentment, what reason do others have to be emotional and vent personal resentment! It was the spirit of seeking truth from facts and the broad mind of the older generation of revolutionaries that set an example for the entire party and the people of the country to correctly evaluate Mao Zedong and correctly understand Mao Zedong's thoughts, and also made the opinions of the entire party and the people of the country on Mao Zedong gradually converge.

3. The Drafting and Adoption of the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the Country"

With the deepening of the rectification work and the gradual consensus of the understanding of Mao Zedong's merits and demerits by the entire party and the people of the country, the conditions for comprehensively summarizing the history of the party since the founding of the new China gradually mature. Consequently, the central party committee began to draft the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the Country".

Shortly after Ye Jianying delivered the 30th anniversary of the founding of the country, the CPC Central Committee began the drafting work of the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the Country" in November 1979. This work was led by the CPC Central Political Bureau, the Central Secretariat, and was presided over by Deng Xiaoping, Hu Yaobang and other leaders of the Central Committee. The specific work of the drafting team was mainly responsible by Hu Qiaomu. Deng Xiaoping attached great importance to the drafting of the resolution and repeatedly provided guiding opinions on the drafting and revision of the resolution draft.

In March 1980, the drafting group proposed a preliminary concept for the resolution. On March 19, Deng Xiaoping put forward three opinions on the drafting of the resolution: (1) To establish the historical position of Comrade Mao Zedong and adhere to and develop Mao Zedong's thoughts, which is the most core one.



(2) We should analyze which major events in the 30 years since the founding of New China are correct and which were mistakes. This includes the merits and demerits of some responsible comrades, which should be fairly assessed. (3) This resolution should be a basic summary of the past. The summary should be broad rather than detailed, and its purpose is to guide everyone to look forward and unite. On April 1 of the same year, he gave his opinion on the overall design of the draft resolution and shared his view on the 17-year history after the founding of New China and before the "Cultural Revolution".

On June 27, after reading the draft resolution, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that the focus should be on what Mao Zedong Thought is, what are the correct things about Comrade Mao Zedong, and what mistakes should be criticized. However, it has to be very appropriate. Criticizing only the mistakes of Comrade Mao Zedong himself cannot solve the problem. The most important issue is a systemic one. Deng Xiaoping's talk demonstrated his profound insight and superb ability to perceive problems and observe things as a great Marxist. 

In October 1980, the draft resolution was discussed among 4,000 senior officials for 20 days. During the discussion, everyone spoke freely, and there were many good ideas. However, some people still proposed extreme ideas during the discussion. Some people suggested not to write about Mao Zedong Thought at all; Mao Zedong in the early stage was a Marxist and a Communist, but Mao Zedong in the later stage was neither a Marxist nor a Communist. Some people even thought that all the mistakes made before and during the "Cultural Revolution" should be borne by Mao Zedong alone.

According to this situation, Deng Xiaoping proposed during a conversation with the leaders of the Central Committee on October 25, 1980: If Mao Zedong's contributions and mistakes are not properly evaluated, the old workers and the poor peasants who turned over during land reform will not pass it, and a large number of cadres in contact with them will not pass it either. We cannot abandon the banner of Mao Zedong Thought. If we abandon this banner, we are actually denying the glorious history of our Party. The part that elaborates Mao Zedong thought in the draft resolution cannot be omitted. This is not just a theoretical problem, but especially a political problem, a big political problem at home and abroad. If we do not write or write this part well, it is better not to make the whole resolution at all. If we do not write or adhere to Mao Zedong thought, we will make a historic mistake. As for the mistakes of Comrade Mao Zedong, they must be criticized without ambiguity. But they must seek truth from facts, analyze various different situations, and must not attribute all problems to personal qualities. Comrade Mao Zedong was not an isolated person. Until he died, he was always the leader of our Party. We must not go too far in writing about the mistakes of Comrade Mao Zedong. If we go too far, we will smear Comrade Mao Zedong, and we will also smear our Party and our country. This is a violation of historical facts.

In March 1981, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that the outline of the draft resolution can be determined: the achievements of the first seven years after the founding of New China are widely recognized. The ten years before the "Cultural Revolution" should be affirmed, generally good, and basically developing on a healthy path. There were twists and turns in between and mistakes were made, but achievements are the main part. The part about the "Cultural Revolution" should be written in summary. Compared with the errors in the previous 17 years, the "Cultural Revolution" was a serious and overall error. Its consequences were extremely serious and are still having an impact today. On April 7, he talked to the person in charge of the drafting group about his views on some problems during the "Cultural Revolution": (1) We should recognize the legitimacy of the 12th Plenary Session of the 8th Central Committee and the "9th Congress".



During the "Cultural Revolution", we still had a party existing. (2) During the "Cultural Revolution", great achievements have been made in foreign affairs work. Simultaneously, Chen Yun also made important suggestions for the amendment of the resolution. On March 24, Chen Yun made two suggestions on the draft resolution: one was to specifically add a paragraph to discuss the history of the party before the founding of the country, writing about the 60 years of the party, so that Mao Zedong's achievements and contributions would be more comprehensive, establishing Mao Zedong's historical position, upholding and developing Mao Zedong Thought, would also have a comprehensive basis; the second one was to suggest that the central government promote learning, the focus is on studying Mao Zedong's philosophical works. Deng Xiaoping took these opinions seriously and conveyed these two opinions to the draft resolution group two days later. Around this time, Chen Yun also made the following suggestions on the resolution: (1) The errors of the party's work in the 32 years since the founding of New China must be written accurately, judgements must be in line with reality. It needs to be "nailed down"; (2) to suggest adding a paragraph reviewing the 28-year history before the establishment of New China; (3) to fully affirm Mao Zedong's historical achievements; (4) to write about the help from the international community.

In May 1981, the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee invited more than 40 people to discuss the draft resolution for 12 days. Based on the discussion, the drafting group made repeated amendments. 

On May 19, Deng Xiaoping pointed out at the expanded meeting of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee that the resolution of history should be presented as soon as possible and that late presentation would be unprofitable. In order to present it earlier, the current method is to hold an expanded meeting of the Political Bureau. Seventy-some people would spend some time and energy to scrutinise the draft more meticulously and make better changes, then finalise it, and then propose it to the 6th Plenary Session of the 6th Central Committee, expected to be published on the 60th anniversary of the party.

Afterwards, the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee discussed the draft resolution for 12 days, inviting more than 70 people based on Deng Xiaoping's opinion. After the modification, the viewpoints and opinions of 130 representatives of various democratic parties were sought again, which led to further amendment and perfection to the content of the resolution. In June 1981, the preparatory meeting of the 6th Plenary Session of the 11th CPPCC National Committee conscientiously and meticulously discussed the draft resolution again. Deng Xiaoping also made several important remarks on the draft resolution at the meeting.

So, after more than a year, the draft resolution went through a process of drafting, discussion, and repeated revision. During this process, there were four or five extensive discussions. Through brainstorming, collective modification, and concentrating the wisdom of the whole party, we eventually reached a consensus with the majority of comrades and achieved the purpose of drafting the resolution.

On this basis, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China held the 6th Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee from June 27 to 29, 1981. The plenary session deliberated the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic of China" (shortly referred to as the "Resolution"). After ample discussions, the plenary session unanimously passed the "Resolution". The "Resolution" used Marxist dialectical materialism and historical materialism to correctly summarise the significant historical events of the party in the 32 years since the founding of New China, especially the "Cultural Revolution".



The most important contribution of this historical document is:

Firstly, it provides an objective scientific assessment of Mao Zedong's historical status, fully discussing the great significance of Mao Zedong Thought as the guiding thought of the Party. The "Resolution" states: Mao Zedong is a great Marxist, a great proletarian revolutionary, strategist, and theorist. Looking at his life as a whole, his contributions to the Chinese revolution far outweigh his mistakes. Mao Zedong has made indelible merits for the founding and development of our Party and the People's Liberation Army of China, the victory of the liberation cause of all ethnic groups in China, the founding of the People's Republic of China, and the development of our socialist cause.

The "Resolution" fully elaborates on Mao Zedong Thought, pointing out: Mao Zedong Thought is the application and development of Marxism-Leninism in China. It is the proven correct theoretical principles and summarized experiences about the Chinese revolution. It is the crystallization of the collective wisdom of the Chinese Communist Party. Many of our outstanding Party leaders have made significant contributions to its formation and development. Mao Zedong's scientific works are its concentrated summary. The scientific system of Mao Zedong Thought mainly includes the following parts: the construction of revolutionary armies and military strategy; policies and strategies; ideological, political, and cultural work; and party building. Among the above components, the three basic aspects of "seeking truth from facts," "the mass line," and "independence" run through, which is the living soul of Mao Zedong Thought.

The "Resolution" distinguishes the mistakes Mao Zedong made in his later years from Mao Zedong Thought, pointing out: the attitude of attempting to deny the scientific value of Mao Zedong Thought because Mao Zedong made mistakes in his later years is completely wrong. At the same time, it is completely wrong to take a dogmatic attitude towards Mao Zedong's remarks and not willing to admit the mistakes made by Mao Zedong in his later years, and attempt to persist in these mistakes in new practices. Mao Zedong Thought, which has become a scientific theory through long historical tests, must be distinguished from the mistakes Mao Zedong made in his later years. Mao Zedong Thought is a precious spiritual wealth of our Party and it will guide our actions for a long time.

The discourse in the "Resolution" about Mao Zedong Thought not only scientifically summarizes and defines this first theoretical achievement formed by the Party in the path of sinicization of Marxism but also paves the way for inheriting and developing this theory and continuing to advance the sinicization of Marxism.

Secondly, it makes a scientific summary of the history of the Party, especially the history of the 32 years after the founding of New China. Regarding the seven years of basically completing socialist transformation (1949-1956), the "Resolution" believes that the guiding principles and basic policies determined by the Party during this period are correct, and the victories achieved are brilliant. The establishment of the socialist system is the deepest and greatest social change in China's history, which has become the basis for all progress and development in China in the future. Regarding the ten years of the beginning of the full construction of socialism (1957-1966), the "Resolution" believes that we have achieved great achievements, but also suffered serious setbacks. All the achievements of these ten years were achieved under the collective leadership of the Party Central Committee led by Mao Zedong. Later, due to complex reasons such as lack of experience, there were subjective deviations in the analysis of the situation and understanding of national conditions, mistakes such as the intensification of class struggle and the impetuous rush of economic construction were made, including the "Cultural Revolution" which brought serious setbacks and losses to the socialist cause.

The "Resolution" made a complete denial of the "Cultural Revolution" (from May 1966 to October 1976). The "Resolution" points out that the "Cultural Revolution" has caused the most serious setbacks and losses to the Party, the state, and the people since the founding of New China. The main arguments made by Mao Zedong in launching the "Cultural Revolution" are neither consistent with Marxism-Leninism nor with China's reality.



The arguments summarized as "the theory of continuing the revolution under the dictatorship of the proletariat" were completely incorrect in their estimation of the class situation and the political conditions of the party and state in our country at the time. History has proven that the "Cultural Revolution" was a civil disorder wrongly initiated by the leadership, exploited by the Lin Biao and Jiang Qing group, causing serious disaster to the Party, the country, and the people.

The "Resolution" evaluates the two years of groping progress after the smashing of the "Gang of Four" as follows: The victory of smashing the Jiang Qing counter-revolutionary group in October 1976 ushered our country into a new historical development period. However, in the first two years, the strong demands from comrades inside and outside the party to correct the errors of the "Cultural Revolution" encountered serious obstacles. This was not only due to the political and ideological chaos caused by ten years of the "Cultural Revolution" which was not easy to eliminate in a short period of time, but also because Hua Guofeng, who was then serving as Chairman of the Central Committee of the Party, continued to make "leftist" mistakes in his guiding ideology. The Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee held in December 1978 was a significant turning point in the history of our party since the founding of New China. The Plenary ended the situation of groping progress in the work of the Party since October 1976, began to comprehensively and seriously correct the "leftist" errors during and before the "Cultural Revolution", achieved a series of victories in rectifying the chaos, leading to a good situation in the economy and politics of our country.

Third, for the first time, the "Resolution" pointed out that our socialist system is still in an initial stage, and it clearly states that our socialist system must go through a long process to move from being relatively imperfect to relatively perfect. This understanding goes one step further than the past. On the basis of correctly summarizing historical experience, a preliminary summary of the socialist construction path suitable for China's national conditions gradually established by the Party after the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee is as follows: (1) After the basic completion of socialist transformation, the main contradiction that our country needs to resolve is between the people's ever-growing material and cultural needs and the backward social productivity. The focus of the party and state must shift to socialist modernization with economic construction at the centre; (2) Socialist economic construction must start from the realities of our country, acting within our means and progressively achieving modernization goals in stages; (3) Changes in production relations and improvements must adapt to the status of productive forces. There is no fixed pattern for the development of socialist production relations. According to the requirements of our country's productive forces development, at each stage it is necessary to create specific forms of production relations that are compatible and conducive to continued progress; (4) After the exploiting class is eliminated as a class, class struggle is no longer the main contradiction. It is necessary to oppose both views that expand class struggle and views that believe class struggle has already ended; (5) The gradual construction of a highly democratic socialist political system is one of the fundamental tasks of socialist revolution; (6) Socialism must have a high level of spiritual civilization, striving to improve the status and role of education, science and culture in modernization construction; (7) Improving and developing socialist ethnic relations is of great significance to our multi-ethnic country; (8) It is necessary to strengthen modern defense construction, and defense construction must be compatible with the country's economic construction; (9) In foreign relations, it is necessary to insist on opposing imperialism, hegemonism, colonialism and racism, and safeguarding world peace; (10) The Chinese Communist Party must be built into a party with a sound democratic centralism. Although the individual expressions of these main points may have changed in later documents, their basic spirit and main content reflect the initial understanding of the Party's re-exploration of the socialist construction path under new historical conditions.

The adoption of the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the Nation" is of great importance for party building and state political construction. It further unified the thoughts and understandings of the entire party and the people of the whole country, strengthened the unity of the entire party and people of all ethnic groups, and marked the successful completion of the task of rectifying chaos in the guiding ideology of the Party. After the resolution was announced, it immediately resonated strongly within the whole Party and among the people of the whole country, receiving widespread and enthusiastic support.



At the same time, the passage and announcement of this resolution also had a profound influence abroad and internationally.

Chapter Four: The Proposition of "Building Socialism with Chinese Characteristics" and the Formulation of the Comprehensive Reform Programme

I. The Proposition of "Socialism with Chinese Characteristics"

From September 1 to 11 in 1982, the Communist Party of China (CPC) solemnly held its Twelfth National Congress in Beijing. This was the most important national congress in the history of the party since the Eighth National Congress.

In December 1978, the third plenary session of the Eleventh CPC Central Committee adopted a series of major decisions concerning the destiny of the Party and the country, criticized the erroneous principles of "two whatever’s", fully affirmed the importance of comprehensively and accurately understanding the scientific system of Mao Zedong Thought, and determined the guiding principles of emancipating the mind, seeking truth from facts, and uniting and looking forward. These decisions decisively put an end to the slogan of "taking class struggle as the key link", and made a strategic decision to shift the focus of the Party's work to the modernization of socialism.

1. Preparation for the 12th National Congress of the Party

The changes realized by the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee marked a fundamental break with the Party's long-standing "left" errors, rectified the Party's guiding ideology, re-established Marxist ideological, political and organizational lines, ended the stagnation of the Party's work since October 1976, and laid the foundation for exploring the road to construction and the basic line of the party that is suited to China's national conditions. This heralded a new era for the modernization of socialism in China.

After the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, the party carried out large-scale rectification work, and step by step resolved many problems left over from the founding of New China and new problems emerging in practical life. Around the theme of shifting the focus of the work of the whole Party and the whole nation to economic construction, efforts were concentrated to develop the productive forces and to carry out the construction of modern socialism in our country. How to further depict the blueprint of our country's reform and opening up and modernization, and explore the road to the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics, had become a new issue before the whole Party. The Twelfth Party Congress was held against this backdrop.

To successfully convene this party congress, the party central committee undertook more than two years of preparation work. As early as February 1980, the Fifth Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the CPC formally decided to convene the Twelfth Congress of the CPC ahead of schedule, and the plenary session also stipulated the main agenda, the distribution principle and method of representative quotas for the Twelfth Congress.

The plenary session held the view that since the Eleventh Party Congress, and particularly since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, significant changes and developments have taken place in both domestic and international situations. With the shift in the focus of the Party's work, the cause of the construction of modern socialism began to get on track of healthy development. The political, ideological and organizational lines of the party determined by the Third and Fourth plenary sessions have been widely accepted by the people. Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four’s" extreme left line and their residual influence in the organization and thought have been further exposed and criticized. A large number of wrongful cases left from history have been redressed, and the party's policies have been widely implemented across the country. On this basis, the whole party, the whole military, and the people across the country were united firmly around the central committee of the party, arduously struggling for the great cause of the modernization of socialism and the implementation of the policy of adjusting, reforming, rectifying and improving the national economy. There were continued success reports on all fronts such as agriculture, industry, finance and trade, education, science, culture, politics, defense, and diplomacy; and an atmosphere of stability, unity and vitality is growing. These facts prove that the lines, guidelines and policies implemented by the Central Committee of the Party are correct. Our country has basically changed from a state of serious chaos caused by Lin Biao and the "Gang of Four" to a good situation where there is leadership, order, direction and objective, and conditions and confidence for victory. This is a great victory won by our party after overcoming great difficulties.

This plenary session pointed out: the great practice of the people of all ethnic groups marching toward four modernizations has now posed a series of major issues to our Party that need to be solved promptly, including the formulation of a long-term plan for the development of the national economy, the determination of an economic system suitable for the needs of national economic development, the formulation of education plans and education system suitable for the needs of national economic development, etc.




With the transformation of the domestic situation, a series of important issues in the national political life and party life, and some important issues in ideological and theoretical terms, also need to be resolved accordingly, for the sake of stable and lively political situation's development and strengthening, and for the smooth progress of modernization construction. In order to solve these urgent problems, it is necessary for the Central Committee to convene the 12th National Congress of the Party in advance. The Plenary Session of the Central Committee unanimously passed a resolution to convene the 12th National Congress of the Communist Party of China ahead of schedule. The specific time of the congress was decided by the Politburo.

This plenary session has preliminarily decided on the main agenda of the 12th Congress. It stipulates that the quota for delegates to the 12th Congress is 1600, and each election unit elects alternate delegates at a ratio of one tenth of the number of representatives. By each province, autonomous region, municipality directly under the Central Government, central directly affiliated organs, central state organs, headquarters of the People's Liberation Army, military branches, major military regions, they respectively convened party congresses or representative meetings, after full deliberation, they were elected by secret ballot in a method of competitive election.

After the fifth plenary session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party was convened, the Central Committee of the Party immediately began preparations for the 12th Congress.

Regarding the election of the delegates to the 12th Congress, in order to do this work well, the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee passed "Several Opinions on the Work of Electing Delegates to the 12th Congress" in April 1980. The document, in accordance with the spirit of the resolution of the Fifth Plenary Session of the Central Committee, put forward specific opinions on several issues related to representative elections, and required that all local party congresses or representative meetings must uphold the principle of democratic centralism throughout. The delegates to the 12th Congress must be fully deliberated and elected by secret ballot through competitive elections. Each provincial, municipal, and autonomous regional party committee should strengthen its leadership and hold county and city party congresses or representative meetings well.

In this document, the Political Bureau also made principled provisions on the proportion of representatives from all aspects: female party member representatives accounted for about 15% of the total number of representatives; nationally renowned labor models and combat heroes accounted for about 6%; professionals in science and technology, culture, education, health, sports, etc. accounted for about 15%; and representatives of ethnic minorities were not less than 5%. At the same time, it was required that representatives should strive for rejuvenation, and the goal was that no less than two-fifths of the representatives should be under 55 years old.

The meeting of the Political Bureau also made a decision on "Elderly Comrades who Lost their Ability to Work Not Being Delegates to the 12th Congress and Candidates for Central Committee". It pointed out: In order to have a considerable proportion of young and strong comrades among the representatives attending the congress and the central committee members elected by the congress, to enable the party's leading bodies to adapt to the needs of the heavy tasks of socialist modernization, to ensure the long-term continuity of the party's line, principles, and policies, and to ensure the centralized leadership of the party and long-term stability, according to the suggestions of many old comrades and the masses inside and outside the party, according to the spirit of the Fifth Plenary Session and the principles of the new party constitution (draft), the center decided that the elderly comrades who are old, lose their ability to work and take care of their lives, should not be the representatives of the 12th Congress of the Party and candidates for the Central Committee. It is not hard to see that this is an important step to abolish the de facto life tenure of cadres and gradually renew the leadership team.

From May 18 to 19, 1980, Hu Yaobang made a speech at the seminar on the selection of excellent middle-aged and young cadres convened by the Central Organization Department, pointing out that efforts should be made to make the 12th Congress of our party one of the best congresses since the founding of New China. He said: To hold the best representative congress, there are generally three standards: (1) Its established line is correct; (2) The leadership team it elects has prestige, and it is satisfied and supported by the vast majority of party comrades; (3) Its method embodies the principle of democratic centralism, and it fully follows the mass line.



When discussing how elected representatives can truly be representative, Hu Yaobang required organizational departments to seriously study and carefully examine under the leadership of party committees at all levels. Those who met the conditions to be representatives should assume the role, and those who did not meet the conditions should not be forced to. 
There needs to be ample brewing, and the agreement of a wide range of party members should be genuinely sought. It should not be determined by a minority, there is nothing secretive about the list, it can be brought up among party members for discussion. Change should not be feared, it is also a dialectic, through the convening of the party congress, to carry out an exercise of party democracy, improve the Party's life, and provide a vibrant education on strengthening Party leadership.
Based on the resolution of the Fifth Plenary Session of the 11th Party Congress and the spirit of the central instructions, party organizations in all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, central agencies and the People's Liberation Army have successively held party congresses or representative meetings, electing representatives to attend the 12th Congress, and the election work has been completed on schedule.
Another preparatory work for the Twelfth Congress, i.e., the amendment of the party constitution, is also being carried out in a hurry.
Starting from the winter of 1979, under the leadership of the Standing Committee of Central Political Bureau, a group of cadres have been convened by relevant central units to hold several talks, and to survey many places around the country and solicit opinions, drafting a draft.
In January 1980, Deng Xiaoping made many important guidelines on the amendment of the Party Constitution. Under the central leadership, a special constitution amendment group was established, chaired by Deng Xiaoping and Hu Yaobang, and specifically responsible by Hu Qiaomu. The original draft was discussed and revised repeatedly, forming the first draft of the revision proposal. It was submitted for discussion at the Fifth Plenum of the Eleventh Central Committee in February 1980, and the first revision was made according to the discussion opinions of the plenary session. In April, it was sent to all parties for discussion by the Central Secretariat, and solicited opinions from some people outside the party. In May 1980, a second more significant revision was made. In June of the same year, it was sent to party organizations and all representatives of the twelfth congress in all provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, large military regions, and central party, government, and military departments to solicit opinions. A third revision was made in July.
On the basis of all the above preparations, the Central Political Bureau convened an expanded meeting in Beijing in late July 1982. More than 130 leaders from central and provincial, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government attended the meeting. The meeting discussed some major issues related to the Twelfth Congress.
On August 6, 1982, the Party Central Committee convened the Seventh Plenary Session of the Eleventh Session. The meeting was attended by 185 central committee members, 112 alternate central committee members, 21 observers, and the meeting was chaired by Hu Yaobang, Ye Jianying, Deng Xiaoping, Zhao Ziyang, Li Xiannian, Chen Yun, and Hua Guofeng.
The plenary session decided to convene the Twelfth National Congress of the Communist Party of China on September 1, and publicly announced to the whole party and the people of the whole country, revived the good tradition of laying open its congress to the whole nation as the Eighth National Congress of the Communist Party of China, and abandoned the secret practises carried out by the Ninth National Congress. The Plenary Session reviewed and approved the Report of the Central Committee on the Twelfth National Congress of the Party and the "Constitution of the Communist Party of China (Amendment Draft)", and decided to submit these two documents to the Twelfth National Congress of the Party for review.
On August 30, the preparatory meeting for the Twelfth Congress was held in Beijing.



The conference established four agenda items for the congress, elected the 12th Presidium consisting of 252 people, and elected Zhao Ziyang as the Secretary-General of the conference. Hu Yaobang proposed at the conference that the task of the Twelfth Congress was: to make a victorious summary of the great historical turn achieved since the smashing of the "Gang of Four" six years ago, especially since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh CPC Central Committee, and to identify the grand objectives and combat missions of the Party in the new era, enabling our Party to lead the people of all ethnic groups across the country in striving to create a new situation for socialist modernization with a refreshed image and strong combat power. The conference adopted the decision on approving the supplemented members of the Central Committee at the Third and Fourth Plenary Sessions of the Eleventh CPC Central Committee, and the Presidium selected a Standing Committee consisting of 31 people including Hu Yaobang, Ye Jianying, Deng Xiaoping, Zhao Ziyang, Li Xiannian, Chen Yun, Hua Guofeng, Xu Xiangqian, Nie Rongzhen, Peng Zhen, and Deng Yingchao. The inspection report of the representative qualification examination committee represented by Song Renqiong was adopted and the congress schedule was approved.
