The next year, the central relevant departments held a national "Five Talks, Four Beauties, Three Loves" work conference in Sanming city, Fujian province, summarizing the experiences of large and medium-sized cities in carrying out the "Five Talks, Four Beauties, Three Loves" activities, especially summarizing the experiences of Sanming city, requesting that the whole country learn from Sanming city to promote the construction of urban spiritual civilization. Since then, the "Five Talks, Four Beauties, Three Loves" activities have been widely organized and led throughout the country, focusing on creating a beautiful environment, establishing a good order, providing high-quality services, and building civilized units.
The formulation of the first guiding principle for the construction of spiritual civilization. After 1984, with the full unfolding of China's reform and opening up, a large number of new contradictions and problems appeared in the social field, the task of spiritual civilization construction was more prominent than before. In October 1984, the decision of the CPC Central Committee on economic system reform passed by the Third Plenary Session of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China set corresponding demands for the construction of spiritual civilization. The national conference of the party held in September 1985 reaffirmed the insistence on "strengthening the construction of socialist spiritual civilization while promoting the construction of material civilization" as one of the basic guiding principles that must be followed during the "75" period of national economic and social development. This was the first time that the issue of spiritual civilization construction was included in the planning of national economic and social development, demonstrating that the Party was considering the issue of spiritual civilization construction strategically and from guiding ideology. On this basis, the Sixth Plenary Session of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China held in September 1986, reviewed and passed the Resolution of the CPC Central Committee on the Guiding Principles for the Construction of Socialist Spiritual Civilization (referred to as "the Resolution"). This was the first programmatic document formulated by our Party on the construction of socialist spiritual civilization. The resolution clearly defines the guiding principles and basic tasks of spiritual civilization construction from the strategic height of comprehensively building socialism and the overall layout of China's modernization construction.
First, it clarifies the position and role of spiritual civilization construction in the overall layout of China's socialist modernization construction. The Resolution points out that the overall layout of China's socialist modernization construction is: focus on economic construction, unswervingly carry out economic system reform, unswervingly carry out political system reform, unswervingly strengthen spiritual civilization construction, and make these aspects cooperate with each other mutually promote.
Second, it puts forward the guiding principles and basic tasks of spiritual civilization construction. Its guiding principle is that the construction of spiritual civilization must promote socialist modernization construction; must promote comprehensive reform and the implementation of openness to the outside world; must adhere to the four basic principles. Its basic task is: to meet the needs of socialist modernization construction, to cultivate socialist citizens who have ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, and to improve the ideological, moral and scientific quality of the entire Chinese nation.
Third, it elaborates on the specific contents of spiritual civilization construction in a more realistic way.



The "Resolution" proposes to mobilize and unite all ethnic groups in the country with the common ideal of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and clarifies the relationship between our Party's highest ideal and the current common ideal of all ethnic groups in our country, dialectically combining the requirements of advancement and broadness; it proposes the basic requirements for the construction of socialist morality; stresses the need to educate all people in socialist democracy, legality and discipline, vividly reflecting the unity of revolutionary spirit, democratic spirit and scientific spirit in the socialist spiritual civilization we want to build; emphasizes the need to realistically promote the popularization and improvement of education, science and culture throughout the nation.

The "Resolution" also clarifies the guiding role of Marxism in the construction of spiritual civilization, and defines the responsibilities of Party organizations and members in the construction of spiritual civilization. The "Resolution" upholds the basic viewpoint on the construction of socialist spiritual civilization put forward by our Party since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, and at the same time, it has new developments in many aspects, marking the preliminary formation of the theory of socialist spiritual civilization construction with Chinese characteristics. This "Resolution" is of significant guiding significance for guiding and promoting the construction of socialist spiritual civilization and ensuring the smooth development of socialist modernization.

(2) Eliminating spiritual pollution in the ideological field and opposing bourgeois liberalization. In the early 1980s, in the theoretical circle, some people caused confusion on humanism and alienation issues, blaming all existing problems in society on the socialist system and the leadership of the Communist Party; in journalism, some people opposed party nature and people's nature; in the literary and art world, some people denied Mao Zedong's artistic thought and showed indifference to the slogan proposed by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of "serving art for the people and socialism", "enthusiastic about writing dark, gray, and even inventing, distorting the history and reality of the revolution", resulting in some works with serious erroneous tendencies, even vulgarity, pornography, appearing on the screen, stage, and the book market.

In response to this situation, at the Second Plenary Session of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Communist Party of China held in October 1983, Deng Xiaoping delivered a speech, "We cannot pollute our minds on the ideological front", "The essence of spiritual pollution is to spread all kinds of bourgeois and other exploiting class decadent and falling thoughts, spread distrust of socialism, communism, and the leadership of the Communist Party". "In the long run, this problem is about who will take over our cause, and it is about the fate and future of the Party and the state." This must be criticized and corrected.

In accordance with the spirit of this conference, a struggle against spiritual pollution and bourgeois liberalization was launched nationwide. After a series of work, the spread of bourgeois liberalization trend was basically curbed, and the leadership of the Communist Party of China on the ideological front was also strengthened. However, the elimination of one interference does not mean that the interference of bourgeois liberalization will no longer appear.

In 1986, Fang Lizhi, Liu Binyan, Wang Ruowang and others took the opportunity of studying political system reform to wantonly attack the leadership of the Communist Party of China and the socialist system, attracting the attention of some senior leaders of the Chinese Communist Party, especially Deng Xiaoping. In September 1986, at the Sixth Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, in response to some opinions that did not approve of opposing bourgeois liberalization, Deng Xiaoping clearly stated: "I speak the most against bourgeois liberalization, and I insist the most." "What is liberalization? It's actually about guiding our current policy in China towards the capitalist path." "Liberalization itself is bourgeois. There is no proletarian or socialist liberalization. Liberalization itself is a confrontation or opposition, or a modification, against our current policy and system. "It seems that it is not only this time that we should oppose liberalization, we should talk about it for ten or twenty years."

However, Deng Xiaoping's warning did not attract enough attention, especially from the leaders who were in charge of central work at the time. In the second half of 1986, the wave of liberalization resurfaced. People like Fang Lizhi, Wang Ruowang, Liu Binyan became more active.



They pointed the finger at our country's political system, claiming that the socialist cause of the People's Republic of China since its establishment was a failure, and that the communist movement over the past thirty or so years was a failure. They completely denied the leadership of the Communist Party of China, advocated for a multi-party system, and attacked the leadership of the Communist Party of China as a continuation of feudal rule and a one-party dictatorship. They glorified bourgeois democracy and advocated for the abandonment of the people's democratic dictatorship. They continuously belittled the guiding position of Marxism in the Chinese revolution and construction.

Under this situation, party newspapers and periodicals did not take strong resistance measures, resulting in directional mistakes that allowed the tide of bourgeois liberalization to spread. In the second half of 1986, various liberalizing ideologies poured into the lecture halls of higher education institutions. According to incomplete statistics, from October to late December 1986, Peking University, Tsinghua University, and Beijing Normal University held over twenty lectures and seminars attended by these individuals. These reports had a significant influence on the thoughts of some university students.

In January 1987, several young ideological and political workers surveyed the ideological conditions of some university students in key universities in Beijing. They discovered that to varying degrees, college students were involved in discussions on political system reform and cultural reflections. The survey revealed that the university students had four dissatisfactions: First, dissatisfaction with the speed of reform. They believed that the reform was progressing too slowly, with high resistance and low returns; Second, dissatisfaction with democratic rights. They believed that workers, peasants, and intellectuals could barely exercise their democratic rights; Third, dissatisfaction with the Party's malpractices. They believed that despite major corruption cases being handled, people were still indignant at the phenomenon of seeking personal gain with power; Fourth, dissatisfaction with the implementation status of the intellectuals' policy. They felt there was more talk than action. These four dissatisfactions led to the students' four reflections: First, on the fundamental lessons of the Chinese revolution; Second, on the comparison of the two social systems; Third, on traditional Chinese culture; Fourth, on Marxism.

"Reflections" produced many negative effects, and combined with international political changes in 1986, like the exile of former President Marcos of the Philippines, the collapse of Haitian dictatorial politics, and a series of major events, all of these continually impacted students' values. They were no longer satisfied with mere changes in concepts and empty talks. Most students' emotions shifted from unease to dissatisfaction which implied impulsivity, exhibiting a strong sense of participation. In the second half of 1986, there were demonstrations of different scales appearing in many cities.

In response to the above phenomena, on December 30, 1986, Deng Xiaoping met with Hu Yaobang and other central leaders and reaffirmed, in his conversation, the adherence to the Four Cardinal Principles and opposition to bourgeois liberalization. He highlighted the extreme importance of maintaining and developing a stable and unified situation, insisting on reforms and opening up, promoting the modernization construction of socialism. He correctly set out the central policy for dealing with student disturbances at the time. The core points were, "the Four Cardinal Principles must be upheld", "The people's democratic dictatorship is indispensable", and "Without the leadership of the Communist Party of China and committing to socialism, China has no future", "Democracy can only be gradually unfolded and western protocols cannot be adopted". Firmly "oppose bourgeois liberalization", "China has hope". Deng Xiaoping's conversation further strengthened the determination of the Communist Party of China to oppose bourgeois liberalization. On January 6, 1987, campuses across Beijing relayed Deng Xiaoping's aforementioned conversation to all students and promptly dealt with a small number of student disruptions.

On January 12, the Communist Party of China Central Committee and the State Council decided to restructure the leadership of the University of Science and Technology of China. The Shanghai Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection, the Anhui Province Commission for Discipline Inspection, and the Party Committee of the People's Daily Office made decisions on January 13, 17, and 23, respectively, to revoke Wang Ruowang, Fang Lizhi, and Liu Binyan’s Party membership.




Through a series of actions, the Party and government pacified the student protests that broke out at the end of 1986, adhered to the correct leadership of the Party on reform and opening up and socialist modernization construction, and ensured the healthy development of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
(3) Cracking down hard on criminal activities in the economic field. After the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Party and the state determined and implemented the policies centered on economic construction, opening up to the outside world and invigorating the economy internally, which led to rapid development in our country's economic construction. However, some unhealthy elements inevitably arose during the process of reform and opening up. As a result of various reasons, such as the failure of necessary management measures to keep up in a timely manner, insufficient attention to and inadequate prevention and control of economic crimes, economic criminal activities increased. Some national cadres were ideologically eroded. They exploited their power or loopholes in economic management, wantonly embezzled, stole, and defrauded national property, forming a wave of economic crimes. Accompanied by the serious development of other criminal acts, economic crimes such as smuggling, speculation, corrupt practices, theft, market disruption also grew and proliferated.
The aforementioned criminal activities in the economic field drew high attention from the central government. In January 1982, the Central Committee issued an urgent notice on cracking down on serious economic crimes, declaring this a major issue concerning the Four Modernizations and the survival of the state. On March 8, the 22nd meeting of the Standing Committee of the Fifth National People's Congress passed the "Decision On Severely Punishing Serious Economic Criminals", which intensified the punishment for serious economic crimes, including sentencing especially serious and particularly malignant economic criminals to death. On April 10, Deng Xiaoping pointed out at a meeting of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee to discuss "On Cracking Down on Serious Crimes in the Economic Field": Cracking down on economic crimes is a long-term and regular struggle accompanying the Four Modernizations. "We need two hands. One hand is to persist in opening up to the outside world and invigorating the economy domestically, the other hand is to decisively strike against economic criminal activities. Without the latter, not only would our policy of opening up to the outside world surely fail, but also our policy of invigorating the domestic economy would surely fail. With the latter, opening up to the outside world and invigorating the domestic economy can proceed in the right direction." "The trend is very strong. If our Party does not pay serious attention and decisively curb this trend, then indeed the issue of whether our Party and state will 'change face' will arise."
On April 13, 1982, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council publicized the "Decision On Cracking Down on Serious Crimes In The Economic Field", sharply pointing out: Cracking down on serious criminal activities in the economic field and conducting a struggle against corruption and degeneration concern the success or failure of our country's socialist modernization construction, and the rise and fall of our Party and state. This struggle is bound to be long-term and persistent. In accordance with the central government's requirements, a large-scale campaign against crime in the economic field was carried out nationwide. As indicated in the report "On Cracking Down on Serious Crimes in the Economic Field" submitted by the Central Discipline Inspection Commission of the Communist Party of China to the Standing Committee of the Sixth National People's Congress in July 1983: From January 1982 to the end of April 1983, the country uncovered and prosecuted approximately 192,000 cases of various economic crimes, involving more than 71,000 party members; over 131,000 cases were closed, nearly 30,000 people were sentenced according to law, and more than 8,500 party members involved in these cases were expelled from the party; nationwide, 24,400 people surrendered themselves and confessed to various economic illegalities and crimes; illegal gains and loot worth over 410 million yuan were recovered. On May 31, Wan Li spoke at a meeting of leading cadres from Central Party and government agencies held by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, requiring all units to seriously undertake the campaign against serious crimes in the economic field.



The Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI) has dispatched 151 cadres at the level of department or bureau or above to various regions to enhance and strengthen the investigation force against crimes in the economic zone, directly participating in the investigation and handling of major cases. 
According to the central government's plans, the CCDI has taken resolute actions against some major cases that violated Party discipline and had a severe impact. At that time, the notable ones were the "Jinjiang fake medicine" case in Fujian and the "Hainan Island reselling imported cars" case.
In Chenkang Town, Jinjiang County, Jinjiang Region (now Quanzhou City), some people marketed a Tremella fuciformis beverage as a cold remedy in order to boost sales. They labeled it as "nourishes yin and moistens lungs, mainly used for treating asthenia and cough," and falsely used the approval number of the pharmaceutical regulatory department for promotion in and outside the province. From September 1982 to April 1985, illegal elements from 59 township enterprises faked more than 170 approval numbers from the health administrative department, 62 of which were frequently used, manufacturing more than 100 types of counterfeit drugs, with a total production of over 100,000 boxes, worth about 40 million RMB. These counterfeit drugs were sold to 28 provinces (regions) nationwide, causing significant national uproar and attracting the attention of senior central government officials. 
On July 13, 1985, the CCDI issued an open letter to the Jinjiang District Committee and Executive Office Party Group, requesting legal actions be taken against the massive production of counterfeit drugs by various enterprises and for using various bribery measures to sell the drugs in different regions. On July 27, the Standing Committee of the CCDI heard reports from the Fujian Provincial Party Committee and Provincial Discipline Inspection Commission, punished the parties involved, decided to dismiss and investigate the standing committee and secretary of the Jinjiang County Discipline Inspection Commission who profited from the manufacturing and sale of the counterfeit drugs. In September 1986, the Fujian Provincial High People's Court and Quanzhou City Intermediate People's Court legally sentenced the criminals involved in the "Jinjiang fake drugs case." Three were sentenced to more than 10 years of fixed-term imprisonment, seven were sentenced to fixed-term imprisonment ranging from 1.5 years to 8 years, four were granted probation, and three were exempted from criminal punishment.
From January 1, 1984, to March 5, 1985, the leaders of the Hainan District Party Committee and District Government, abusing the autonomy granted by the central government, imported a large amount of nationally controlled goods for resale. More than ten thousand imported cars were resold out of the island; most other imported goods were also resold off the island. To import cars and other goods, Hainan Island officials violated state foreign exchange regulations, illegally purchasing 570 million USD in foreign exchange from outside the island at a high price. This number is ten times the amount of foreign exchange that the state allowed Hainan to retain. Concurrently, loans used for importing cars and other goods accumulated up to 42.1 billion RMB, 10 billion more than the total industrial and agricultural output value of Hainan in 1984.
The enactment of these economic crime cases has powerfully upheld the seriousness of party discipline and national law, and to a certain extent, ensured the healthy development of the reform, opening up, and modernization construction.



II. The "June Fourth" Political Turmoil and The Formation of the Third Generation of Central Leadership

Just when in-depth work was needed to govern the economic environment and rectify the order of the economy, political turmoil occurred in Beijing and elsewhere at the turn of spring and summer in 1989. The central leadership of the Party swiftly took decisive measures to quell this unrest. For a long time, some political forces in Western countries, through various channels, have been infiltrating socialist countries ideologically and politically, supporting various anti-communist and antisocialist activities. After some Eastern European socialist countries experienced turbulence, some Western countries intensified their peaceful evolution in China through various channels. Additionally, for some time, a few leaders within the Party lacked consistency in adhering to the Four Cardinal Principles in the process of promoting economic reform and development, and the political ideology work had been weakened. The image of the Party among the people was damaged by the fairly severe corruption of a few cadres. At the turn of spring and summer in 1989, an extremely small number of people took advantage of the existing problems within the Party and the displeasure of the masses towards price hikes, especially against some instances of cadre corruption, stirring up activities against Communist Party leadership and the socialist regime. They exploited the public mourning of Hu Yaobang, spread rampant rumours, and stirred up a planned, organized, premeditated anti-party and antisocialist disturbance, inciting some clueless citizens to occupy Tiananmen Square and assault the critical departments of the Party and government authorities. With the firm and staunch support from senior revolutionaries like Deng Xiaoping, the Central Politburo, relying on the people, unequivocally opposed the disturbance, quelling the political turmoil, safeguarding the political regime of the socialist state, and defending the fundamental interests of the people. 

This political turmoil served as a profound education for the Party and the people. On June 9, 1989, Deng Xiaoping stressed in a speech: The nature of this event is the opposition between bourgeois liberalization and the adherence to the Four Cardinal Principles. This turbulence was bound to come, as decided by the international macro environment and the microclimate of China, not by the will of the people. The occurrence of this event is worth our contemplation, prompting us to reflect on our past and future with a cool head. He proposed two issues that needed serious consideration: First, was the strategy, guideline, and policy, including the “Troika” development strategy formulated at the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee, correct? Would the occurrence of this turmoil cast doubt on their correctness? Should we continue to hold them as our future goals? Second, was the Thirteenth National Congress’s summary of “one centre, two basic points” correct? Is it wrong to adhere to the four balances and reform and opening up? To these two questions, he answered categorically that the policies formulated at the Third Plenary Session of the 11th CPC Central Committee, including our "Troika" development strategy, were correct. The occurrence of this event cannot be used as a basis to say that our strategic goals were wrong. The principle of  "one centre, two basic points" was not wrong. It is not wrong to maintain balance and to reform and open up. Our direction, principles, and policies should be steadfastly implemented. "If there is any mistake, it is that the adherence to the Four Cardinal Principles was not consistent enough"; "If there is not enough, it is that there is not enough reform and opening up". 

This turmoil severely interfered with the progress of reform, opening up, and modernization, and exposed existing issues within the leadership of the Party Central Committee, which needed to be reorganized. Even before the unrest had been quelled, Deng Xiaoping proposed to change the central leadership, stating that the new central leadership organ should give the people a feeling of rejuvenation, as a hopeful leading group committed to reform. They should be people who are recognized by the masses as adherent to the path of reform and opening up and who have political achievements. This group should be able to gain public trust, trustworthy both within the party and to the people. According to Deng Xiaoping’s opinion, after considering it fully, Jiang Zemin, a member of the Central Politburo and secretary of the Shanghai Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China, was selected as the core of the new generation of central leadership..




The Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party held in late June 1989 analyzed the nature and causes of the political turmoil that had occurred in the country in the preceding two months, initially summarized the lessons learned, and clarified the party's policy and tasks at that time and for a period thereafter. In view of the serious errors committed by Zhao Ziyang at the critical moment of stopping the unrest, the plenary session decided to revoke all his internal leadership positions within the party and made adjustments to some members of the central leadership structure. The plenary elected Jiang Zemin as the General Secretary of the Central Committee and formed a new Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee. The plenary emphasized the need to continue to firmly implement the party's line, principles and policies since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, and to firmly implement the party's basic line of "one center, two basic points" as defined at the 13th National Party Congress; it explicitly declared that this basic line and the decisions of the 13th National Party Congress would never waver due to political upheaval, thus enabling the party to maintain the correct course of the socialist cause with Chinese characteristics amid raging waves.

Quelling the political storm in the country is essentially China's domestic affairs. However, some Western countries took the opportunity to impose sanctions on China in an attempt to force China to change its socialist developmental direction. At this pivotal historical moment facing tremendous pressure both domestically and internationally, the central leadership group, with Jiang Zemin at the core, undertook the significant responsibility of leading the party and country. They led the whole party and the people of all nationalities across the country to withstand the pressure, and firmly adhere to the party's basic line at the primary stage of socialism. The Central Party Committee took a series of significant measures, promptly restored normal production and social order in Beijing and other places, maintained the stability of the national political situation, handled several major cases, and vigorously punished corruption. To overcome the phenomenon of "one hand hard, one hand soft", it demanded the full concentration of party organizations at all levels on party building and the reinforcement of leadership over propaganda and ideological work. It continued to implement the principle of rectification, promoting reform and opening up while developing the economy, which gradually improved the national economic situation.

In light of the effective work undertaken by the new central leadership group, Deng Xiaoping proposed to the Political Bureau of the Central Committee his resignation from the position of Chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Chinese Communist Party. The Fifth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party, held in November 1989, approved Deng's request. The plenary expressed high respect for Deng Xiaoping's decision to resign from his current position in line with the fundamental interests of the party and country, setting an example for the abolition of lifelong tenure for leadership positions. The plenary stressed that "Comrade Deng Xiaoping's series of viewpoints and theories based on the principle of combining Marxist-Leninist principles with China's actual conditions, especially his basic theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics, is an important part of Mao Zedong Thought, and an inheritance and development of Mao Zedong Thought under new historical conditions. It is the treasured mental wealth of the Chinese Communist Party and the Chinese people." The entire party must carefully study Comrade Deng Xiaoping's works and let them play a significant guiding role in the great progress of China's socialist modernization.

From the Fourth to the Fifth Plenary Sessions of the 13th Central Committee of the Party, the smooth transition from the second generation of central leadership with Deng Xiaoping at the core to the third generation of central leadership with Jiang Zemin at the core ensured the stability, continuity of the party's policy, and the country's stability, enabling continued advancement of the reform and opening up, and socialist modernization. This fully demonstrated the party's political maturity and strong organizational strength, and also provides the most important political and organizational assurance for maintaining the long-term stability of the country, advancing the great cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics into the 21st century.

III. Publication of Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour speeches and preliminary establishment of Deng Xiaoping Theory's guiding status

With the advent of the 1990s, the theoretical documents exploring socialist experiences saw dramatic changes among Eastern European socialist countries, the Soviet Union proclaimed its dissolution, and some countries around China, especially some countries and regions in Southeast Asia, showcased a momentum for accelerated economic development. The world landscape showed trends of political multipolarity and economic globalization. This brought severe challenges to China but also presented new development opportunities.



The governance rectification that began in 1988, despite achieving significant results in stabilizing the economy, resulted in a slowdown in the rate of economic development. In 1989 and 1990, the growth rates of our country's economy were 4.1% and 3.8% respectively. Deng Xiaoping was deeply concerned about this. On March 3, 1990, he pointed out in a conversation with central leaders: We need to pay special attention to the problem of the economic growth rate slipping. "This is not just an economic issue, it is actually a political issue." "Whether China can withstand the pressure of hegemony and power politics, stick to our socialist system, the key is whether we can strive for a faster growth rate, and implement our development strategy." Faced with complex domestic and international situations, some people were ideologically confused, doubted China's reform and opening up, and lacked confidence in the future of socialism.

1. The Publication of Deng Xiaoping's Southern Talk

At a critical juncture in the historical development of the Party and the country, from January 18 to February 21, 1992, 88-year-old Deng Xiaoping, after inspecting Wuchang, Shenzhen, Zhuhai, Shanghai and other places, made very important speeches. He profoundly summarized the experience of the Party's leadership in exploring the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, and clearly answered many major theoretical and policy issues that have often been troubling and restraining people's thoughts since the reform and opening up. The Southern Talk made the following ten important points clear:

(1) We must unswervingly adhere to the basic line that will guide us for 100 years, and propose that reform is also a liberation of productivity. Deng Xiaoping pointed out that the revolution is to liberate productivity, and reform is also to liberate productivity. In the past, only the development of productivity under socialist conditions was talked about, but there was no mention of liberating productivity through reform, which was incomplete. We should talk about both liberating and developing productivity. He emphasized that we must adhere to the line, principles, and policies since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, and the key is to adhere to the "one center, two basic points". "Adhere to socialism, reform and opening up, economic development, and improve people's livelihoods, or else there is only a dead end. The basic line must be followed for a hundred years without wavering. Only by sticking to this line, the people will believe and support you. Whoever tries to change the line, principles, and policies since the Third Plenary Session, the people will not agree and he will be overthrown."

(2) Deng Xiaoping proposed the "Three Favorable" standards for judging whether the reform and opening up is correct. The 13th National Congress of the Party played a major role in adhering to the Party's basic line of focusing on economic construction, based on the "productivity standard" proposed by Mao Zedong in "On The People's Democratic Dictatorship". In order to continue to dispel people's ideological doubts about reform and opening up, Deng Xiaoping further pointed out in his Southern Talk that we should take bigger steps and dare to experiment in reforming and opening up. If it's feasible, dare to try, dare to take risks.



The crucial experience of Shenzhen is daring to break new ground. Who would dare to claim that they could accomplish anything with absolute certainty, without taking any risks? If one is not bold in pushing reform and opening up, it simply means they fear an overabundance of capitalist elements and taking a capitalist path. The crux is whether we "favor capitalism" or "favor socialism". In response to debates over the establishment of special economic zones for a period of time, he clearly stated: "The criteria for judgment should primarily be whether it's conducive to the development of the productive forces of socialist society, whether it strengthens the comprehensive national strength of socialist countries, and whether it improves people's standard of living." "The Special Economic Zones favor 'socialism' and not 'capitalism'." He also stated that differing opinions on policies of reform and opening up should be allowed to be expressed, but debates should not be engaged in, for they would consume all the time and get nothing done.

(3) It was clearly stated that planning and markets are not the essential differences between socialism and capitalism; socialism can engage in market economics. As early as 1979, Deng Xiaoping pointed out that it cannot be said that the market economy only exists in capitalist societies, socialism can also engage in market economics. Since then, he has been paying attention to and researching this very issue, speaking about it dozens of times, believing that there is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and market economy, "Do not think that engaging slightly in market economy is taking the capitalist road, that's not the case", "If it serves socialism, then it's socialism's". In his talks in the south, he emphasized again: "Whether planning or marketing is more prevalent is not the essential difference between socialism and capitalism. Planned economy does not equate to socialism; capitalism also involves planning. Market economy does not equate with capitalism; socialism also has a market. Planning and markets are both economic tools.” And he requested that socialism should boldy absorb and draw lessons from advanced practices and management techniques reflecting the laws of modern socialized production from all countries in the world, including capitalist developed countries. This standpoint had a decisive influence in, at the party's 14th National Congress, formally proposing the theory of a socialist market economy and finally enabling our country to transition from a planned economy to a socialist market economy.

(4) For the first time, the essential question about socialism was clearly raised, correcting unscientific understandings of the essence of socialism. What is the essence of socialism? For the 160 years since utopian socialism to scientific socialism, Communists have pursued socialism as an ideal but have never posed such a question, and the "original works" of Marxism-Leninism have not defined this question either. People are accustomed to thinking that socialism is public ownership, distribution according to labor input, planned economy, proletarian dictatorship, guidance by Marxism, and so on. For the construction of socialism, these elements are undoubtedly all very important, but to see them as understanding the essence of socialism is not scientific. This is because it is not in line with the general principles of defining social forms from both aspects of the contradiction between productive forces and relations of production from the perspective of historical materialism, and it deviates from the understanding of the basic contradiction in socialist society—the contradiction between relations of production and productive forces and the contradiction between the superstructure and the economic base. These elements, which are vaguely seen as the essence of socialism, all belong to the aspects of relations of production and superstructure and completely neglect the requirement to develop productive forces. This is one of the epistemological roots of past mistakes in exploring socialism. In the mid-1980s, Deng Xiaoping pondered the lessons learned from our country's construction of socialism and once pointed out earnestly: "Although we now call ourselves socialists, we are actually not up to par." One important reason was that we did not concentrate on the fundamental task of socialism—to develop productive forces.



With such a painful lesson, Deng Xiaoping first raised the issue of the nature of socialism in his talks in the south. He pointed out: "The essence of socialism is to liberate and develop productivity, eliminate exploitation, eliminate polarization, and ultimately achieve common prosperity." This new definition of the essence of socialism highlights the ultimate decisive role of productivity and the contradictory movement of productivity and productive relations, between the economic base and the superstructure, thereby laying the theoretical foundation for the fundamental task of socialism and the number one task proposed by the Party.
(5) He emphasized seizing the opportunity to develop oneself & the key is to develop the economy, proposing the important idea that "development is the hard truth". Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized: Now, the economic development of some countries and regions around us is faster than ours. If we don't develop or develop too slowly, there will be problems when the people compare. Therefore, if we can develop, we should not obstruct it, and those with conditions should try to speed up as much as possible. As long as it is beneficial and quality-oriented, focused on export-oriented economy, there is nothing to worry about. The important thing is to seize the opportunity. China's economic development must strive to step up a level every few years. Of course, we are not encouraging unrealistic high speed, but we still need to be down-to-earth, pursue benefits and develop steadily and in a coordinated manner. He pointed out clearly: "For a big country like us in development, the economy needs to develop a little faster, it can't always be so calm and stable. We need to pay attention to economic stability and coordinated development, but stability and coordination are relative, not absolute. Development is the hard truth." Developing the economy not only needs to seize opportunities, but also needs to rely on science and education. We need to promote science, and rely on science for hope.
(6) He proposed that China should be on guard against the right, but mainly to prevent the "left" strategic estimate. Since the reform and opening up, Deng Xiaoping has always adhered to the struggle on two fronts, opposing the "left" and the wrong tendencies of the right, but he has pointed out many times that he mainly opposes the "left". This is stated more clearly in this southern talk: "Now, there are right and 'left' things affecting us, but the deeply rooted ones are still 'left' things. Some theorists, politicians, those who scare people with big hats, are not right, but are 'left'. 'Left' has a revolutionary color, it seems the more 'left', the more revolutionary. 'Left' things in the history of our party are scary! A good thing, a good thing, was ruined by him at once. The right can bury socialism, and the 'left' can also bury socialism. China should be vigilant about the right, but mainly to prevent the 'left'." This deafening conclusion is a profound summary of the party's historical experience and the historical experience of other socialist countries, as well as the main tendencies that have emerged since the reform and opening up.



It is of great significance for our Party to adhere to the basic line for 100 years without wavering and to keep a clear mind in strategic estimates.
(7) It is proposed to adhere to "grasping with both hands," and both hands must be firm. Deng Xiaoping, in view of the political turmoil that occurred in the 1980s, clearly pointed out: "We must adhere to grasping with both hands, one hand grasping reform and opening up, and the other hand cracking down on all kinds of criminal activities. Both of these hands must be firm. Cracking down on all kinds of criminal activities, eliminating all kinds of ugly phenomena, you can't be soft." Regarding Guangdong's goal of catching up with the "Four Little Dragons" in Asia in 20 years, he told comrades in Guangdong that not only the economy needs to rise, but the social order and social atmosphere also need to be well managed. "We must surpass them in building both civilizations, and this is socialism with Chinese characteristics." He emphasized that throughout the process of reform and opening up, corruption must be opposed. For cadres and members of the Communist Party, building a clean government should be treated as a major task. It is still necessary to rely on a legal system, as the legal system is more reliable. As long as our productivity develops, maintains a certain economic growth rate, and adheres to grasping with both hands, the construction of socialist spiritual civilization can be promoted.
(8) It emphasizes that the correct political line must be guaranteed by the correct organizational line, and the key to the country's long-term stability is to manage well within the Communist Party. Deng Xiaoping emphasized during the transition of the new and old leadership collective of the Party: "The key to China's issue lies in the Communist Party having a good Politburo, especially a good Politburo Standing Committee. As long as this link does not have a problem, China will be as solid as a rock." "The most important thing is to have a unified leading core. If it is maintained for fifty years, sixty years, socialist China will be invincible." In the Southern Dialogues, he further talked about this issue from the relationship between the political line and the organizational line, pointing out: "Whether China can do well, whether socialism and reform and opening can persist, whether the economy can develop faster, and whether the country can be stable for a long time depends, in a certain sense, on people." We must pay attention to cultivating people, select people who are both virtuous and capable into the team according to the standards of "revolutionization, youthfulness, intellectualization, and specialization". The imperialist hope for peaceful evolution is placed on the future generations of our country. Therefore, we should educate our army well, educate the dictatorship apparatus well, educate the members of the Communist Party well, and educate the people and the youth well. "If China has a problem, it is still within the Communist Party. We need to be clear about this...we say that the Party's basic line has to last a hundred years, and to be stable for a long time, we need to rely on this one."



(9) Emphasizing the consolidation and development of the socialist system requires a very long historical stage. Whether the socialist society is a short transition stage or a long historical period is a problem that has not been solved from Marx to Lenin, and Mao Zedong did not really solve this problem. According to previous views, although socialism is also the lower stage of communism, due to the lack of understanding of the long-term nature of communism, more is said about the transition of socialism. This is a theoretical root cause of all socialist countries' eagerness for quick success errors. After China's three-year "Great Leap Forward", Mao Zedong also talked about socialism as a relatively long historical period, but he mainly spoke from the perspective of class struggle. Deng Xiaoping summarized the historical lessons of socialist development, admonishing the whole party with a politician's strategic thinking and a historian's deep eyesight: "We have been building socialism for only a few decades, and we are still in the initial stage. Consolidation and development of the socialist system still require A very long historical stage requires several generations of us, even dozens of generations, to strive tirelessly. We must not take it lightly."

(10) Made a scientific summary of the essence of Marxism and emphasized using historical materialism to educate young people about the laws of human social development. Although Deng Xiaoping said that he had not read many books, he had rich political wisdom and high theoretical comprehension, and scientifically summarized the essence of Marxism, he pointed out: "Seeking truth from facts is the essence of Marxism. We should advocate this, not stick to the book. Our success in reform and opening up is not based on the book, but on practice, based on seeking truth from facts." "We have talked about Marxism all our lives, in fact, Marxism is not esoteric. Marxism is a very ordinary thing, a very ordinary truth." Based on this, he proposed "learn from Marx and Lenin need to be refined and useful". He emphasized that Marxism is a science, using historical materialism to reveal the laws of human social development, and more people who agree with Marxism will appear in the world. After a long-term development process, socialism will inevitably replace capitalism, which is the irreversible overall trend of social historical development. Some countries have serious twists and turns, and socialism seems to have been weakened, but the people have been tested and learned from it, which will promote the development of socialism in a healthier direction. We have to continue to move forward on the road of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. "If it takes a hundred years from the founding of the People's Republic to build our country into a moderately advanced country, it would be amazing! From now until the middle of the next century, it will be a very important period and we have to work hard. We shoulder heavy responsibilities!"

Deng Xiaoping's Southern Talk, the content is extremely rich, in a sense, it is both the concentrated embodiment of Deng Xiaoping's reform and opening up thoughts, and it also marks the development of his ideological theory to a new height. This is mainly manifested in two aspects: on the one hand, the Southern Talk is a systematic writing, not only the content of the argument has a system structure, answers many major issues such as what is socialism and how to build socialism in a more comprehensive way, and compared with his other writings, it is more of a comprehensive theoretical document that forms a relatively complete system of personal thought. On the other hand, the Southern Talk has brought many new meanings to the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The above ten views are not only the new development of the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics, but also reflect the new realm it has reached.



Not only does it have profound discussions and sharp ideas with solid theoretical strength, but the language expression is also vivid and thorough, with an engaging novelty. The Southern Tour Speeches are an important part of Deng Xiaoping's enrichment and development of the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics in his later years. It is also a "manifesto that promotes the reform and opening up and modernization construction to a new stage with the liberation of thought and seeking truth from facts".
2.Formation of Deng Xiaoping's Theory and Its Initial Establishment as Guiding Status
In mid-October 1992, the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party was held. The main tasks of the congress were: to take Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics as the guidance, to fully summarize the great practice and basic experience of 14 years of reform and opening up, to determine the strategic deployment for the next period, to seize the opportunity, to accelerate the pace of reform and opening up, and modernization construction, to win greater victories in the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The congress made three historically significant decisions: Firstly, Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics has preliminarily established its guiding status in the whole party. Secondly, the goal of China's economic system reform is to establish a socialist market economic system. Thirdly, the Party is urged to seize the opportunity, accelerate development, and concentrate on improving the economy. Marked by Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speeches and the 14th National Congress, the cause of socialist reform, opening up, and modernization construction, entered a new stage of development. 
Since the 3rd Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, the Party has continuously enriched its understanding of the road to socialism with Chinese characteristics in the practice of reform and opening up, gradually forming the theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics. The development of this theory has primarily gone through three phases: 
The first phase is from the 3rd Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee at the end of 1978 to the 12th National Congress of the Party in 1982. Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics began to take shape during the process of correcting errors and initiating reforms. Since the 3rd Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, the Communist Party of China has seriously rectified and corrected past "leftist" errors, successfully completed the rectification of guiding thoughts, and recorrectly combined the basic principles of Marxism with the practice of socialist construction in China. During this process, under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping, a series of new guiding principles and policies on the construction of socialism in China were put forth, forming new understandings of what socialism is and how to build socialism. In 1981, the "Resolution on Certain Historical Issues of the Party since the Founding of the People's Republic" summed up these new cognitive achievements as ten main viewpoints, which can be considered as the rudiment of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. At the 12th National Congress of the Party, Deng Xiaoping proposed "building socialism with Chinese characteristics", providing a clear theme for the second historic leap in the sinicization of Marxism and its theoretical results. 
The second phase is from the 12th National Congress of the Party in 1982 to the 13th National Congress of the Party in 1987. Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics formed its basic outline amidst the comprehensive unfolding of reform and opening up. The comprehensive unfolding of the reform and opening up, spanning from agricultural reform to urban reform, from economic system reform to multi-faceted system reforms, from domestic rejuvenation to external opening up, experienced a grand development process. The deepening of the reform urgently demanded theoretical guidance. During this time, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly raised the primary basic theoretical issue of "what is socialism and how to build socialism". In October 1984, the "Resolution on Economic System Reform" adopted at the 3rd Plenary Session of the 12th Central Committee proposed that the socialist economy is a "planned commodity economy based on public ownership", breaking through the traditional concept that the planned economy is opposed to the commodity economy. In 1987, the 13th National Congress of the Party systematically expounded the theory of the initial stage of socialism.



It, along with the theory of socialist commodity economy, has become the two new achievements in the process of sinicization of Marxism, providing a powerful theoretical guide for reform and opening up. At the thirteenth National Congress of the Party, the party highly praised the great significance of the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics since the third plenary session of the eleventh Central Committee of the Party, referring to it as the second historic leap of the combination of Marxism with Chinese practice, and referred the theoretical results of this leap as "The Theory of Building Socialism with Chinese Characteristics". The thirteenth National Congress of the Party outlined twelve main views of this theory, which are: (1) The view about liberating the mind, seeking truth from facts, and using practice as the only criterion for testing the truth; (2) The view that building socialism must be based on the national conditions of the country and follow its own path; (3) The view that under economically and culturally backward conditions, building socialism must go through a long initial stage; (4) The view the primary task of the socialist society is to develop productive forces and strive for modernization; (5) The view that socialist economy is a planned commodity economy; (6) The view that reform is the important driving force for the development of socialist society and opening to the outside world is a necessary condition for realizing socialist modernization; (7) The view that socialist democracy and socialist cultural and ethical progress are important features of socialism; (8) The view of combining and the four basic principles with the overall guideline of reform and opening, both are indispensable; (9) The view of achieving national unification by using "one country, two systems"; (10) The view that the integrity and style of the ruling party is related to the survival of the party; (11) The view of developing relations with foreign communist parties and other parties according to the principles of independence, complete equality, mutual respect, and non-interference in internal affairs; (12) The view that peace and development are the themes of the contemporary world. "These views form the framework of the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, preliminarily answering the basic problems of the phase, tasks, driving forces, conditions, layout, and international environment of our country's socialist construction, and outlining our scientific path forward."

The third stage is from the thirteenth National Congress of the Party to the fourteenth National Congress of the Party, which is the stage of maturity for Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics and forming a scientific system. In the late 1980s and early 1990s, China's reform entered a crucial stage, and severe political storms occurred domestically and internationally. At this major historical juncture, the Communist Party of China relied closely on the people, adhered unswervingly to the four basic principles, defended the country's independence, security, and stability, unswervingly focused on economic construction, and firmly promoted reform and opening up. The cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics not only withstood the severe test smoothly but also the theory guiding this cause - Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, also further improved.

In 1990, the "Proposal on Formulating the Ten-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the 'Eighth Five-Year' Plan" approved by the seventh plenary session of the thirteenth Central Committee of the Party summarized the basic theory and basic practice of building socialism with Chinese characteristics since the third plenary session of the eleventh Central Committee of the Party into twelve principles.



These twelve principles are: (1) Persisting in the people's democratic dictatorship system, led by the working class, and based on the alliance between workers and peasants; (2) Adhering to the development of social productivity as the fundamental task of socialism; (3) Continuously perfecting the economic, political, and other management systems of socialism through reform; (4) Adopting various forms of fostering foreign economic and trade relations, utilizing foreign capital, and introducing advanced technology to continuously expand outward openness; (5) Persisting in the co-existence of the socialist public ownership as the main body and various other economic components; (6) Actively developing a planned commodity economy in socialism; (7) Implementing a distribution system that is primarily based on labor, supplemented by other forms of distribution; (8) Adhering to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought, continuously improving the ideological, moral, and cultural qualities of the entire nation, and building a socialist spiritual civilization; (9) Establishing and developing socialist ethnic relations of equality, mutual assistance, unity and cooperation, and common prosperity, adhering to and improving the system of ethnic regional autonomy; (10) Pursuing the conception and practice of "one country, two systems" to promote the gradual realization of the great cause of national unification; (11) Persisting in an independent and peaceful foreign policy, developing friendly relations with all countries based on the five principles of peaceful coexistence; (12) Persisting in the leadership of the Communist Party, continuously improving the Party's leadership system, style, and methods, making the Party always the strong leading core of the socialist cause. Some of these principles have been consistently upheld by the Party for decades and have new developments under new historical conditions; Some summarize the fresh experience of modernization construction and reform and opening up for more than a decade, which embodies Deng Xiaoping's outstanding contribution to inheriting and developing Mao Zedong's thought under new historical conditions. The generalization of these twelve principles is a further deepening of the understanding of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

In 1991, Jiang Zemin summarized the main content of the theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics from the economic, political and cultural aspects in his speech at the 70th anniversary of the founding of the party. At the beginning of 1992, Deng Xiaoping's southern tour speech further summarized the basic experience since the 3rd Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee, deeply answering many major issues that have long troubled and bound people's thinking from a theoretical point of view. This not only marked that Deng Xiaoping's thought had risen to a new height but also brought the whole Party's understanding of the theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics to a new realm. In view of this, the 14th National Congress of the Party made a new summary of the content of the theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics on the basis of the above theoretical advancement, and for the first time used the term "Comrade Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics."

The nine aspects summarized by the 14th National Congress of “Comrade Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics” are:
(1) On the issue of the path to socialist development, emphasizing our own normative way, not tying to the doctrines of books, not duplicating foreign models, guided by Marxism, with practice as the only criterion for testing truth, emancipating the mind, seeking truth from facts, respecting the pioneering spirit of the masses, and building socialism with Chinese characteristics.
(2) On the issue of the development stage, a scientific judgement is made that our country is still in the primary stage of socialism, emphasizing that this is a very long historical stage of at least hundreds of years. All guidelines and policies must be based on this fundamental national condition, and cannot be detached from reality and exceed stages.
(3) On the issue of the fundamental task of socialism, it points out that the essence of socialism is to liberate productivity, develop productivity, eliminate exploitation, eliminate polarization, and ultimately achieve common prosperity. We must give top priority to developing productivity, focus on economic construction, and promote comprehensive social progress. The standard for judging the pros and cons of all aspects of work is ultimately the "three favors."
(4) On the issue of the driving force for socialist development, it emphasizes that reform is a revolution and also a necessary path to liberate productivity and realize modernization in China. At the same time, it emphasizes that opening up is an indispensable means for reform and construction, and we should absorb and use all advanced cultural achievements created by countries around the world, including capitalist countries, to develop socialism.



(5) On the issue of external conditions for socialist construction, it points out that peace and development are the two major themes of the contemporary world. We must adhere to an independent and peaceful foreign policy, to strive for a favorable international environment for our country's modernization construction.
(6) On the issue of political guarantees for socialist construction, it emphasizes the need to adhere to four basic principles. They are not only the guarantees for the healthy development of reform, opening-up and modernization, but also need to acquire new era content from reform, opening-up and modernization. 
(7) On the issue of strategic steps, it proposes that the basic realization of modernization should be carried out in three steps. We must allow and encourage a part of the regions and people to get richer first through hard work, in order to drive more and more regions and people to gradually achieve common prosperity. 
(8) On the issue of leadership and reliance, it emphasizes that the Communist Party is the leading core of the socialist cause. The Party must adapt to the needs of reform, opening-up and modernization, continuously improve and strengthen the leadership of all aspects of work, and the construction of the Party itself. We must rely on the broad masses of workers, peasants, intellectuals, the unity of all nationalities, as well as the widest united front of all socialist workers, patriotic supporters of socialism and patriots who support the reunification of the motherland. 
(9) On the issue of national reunification, it proposes the innovative concept of "one country, two systems", advancing the great cause of peaceful reunification of the motherland. 

The summary of these nine aspects indicates that Deng Xiaoping’s theory of the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics has formed a relatively complete scientific system. The report of the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party pointed out that this scientific theoretical system has gradually formed and developed under the historical conditions of peace and development becoming the theme of the times, based on the experience of our country's successful and failed socialist practices and lessons from the rise and fall of other socialist countries. The report highly praises the great significance of this theory.

Given the theoretical significance and guiding function of "Comrade Deng Xiaoping's theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics", the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party proposed the strategic task of arming the whole party with this theory. 

Chapter 7: The Socialist Market Economy System and Basic Program of the Primary Stage of Socialism
Section 1: Final Determination of goals for market economy system reform and the formation of action program

How should China's economic system be reformed, whether to repair and mend within the existing planned economic system framework, or to target a new market economy system? This debate has always accompanied the full-scale process of reform and opening up.



It is an economic issue, as well as a political one, relating to the overall situation of the construction of socialist modernization. The Party has made relentless exploration into this issue, experiencing a process where thoughts are gradually liberated and understanding progressively clarified. The previous discourse on the Party's 12th Third Plenum's decision on economic reform has already partly touched upon this issue. We will now systematically review the ideological understandings of the central decision-making level. 

As early as a State Council meeting held between July and September 1978, some suggested that the law of value should play a more significant role. In December 1978, in the outline of the draft speech "Emancipate the mind, seek truth from facts, and unite and move forward," Deng Xiaoping said the following, "The contradiction between autonomy and the state plan mainly drifts from the law of value and the supply-demand relationship (product quality), i.e., regulated by the market." This was Deng Xiaoping's initial expression of his thoughts on economic activities being regulated through the market.

In March 1979, Chen Yun proposed in the outline of "The Issue of Plan and Market" that "There must be two types of economies during the whole socialist period: (1) the planned economy (the proportional part); (2) the market-regulated part (that is, not planned, only produced according to changes in market supply and demand, that is, it is blind regulation). The first part is basic and major; the second part is minor and auxiliary, but necessary." He also pointed out, "In the further adjustment of the economy and reform of the system, the adjustment of the proportions of these two economies will actually take up a large part. It is not necessarily the case that the absolute sum of the market economy will be reduced as the planned economy increases. Both may well increase correspondingly." The unfolding process of reform has proven the accuracy of Chen Yun's foresight. The economic system reform in our country did not break the planning system from the outset; rather, it tried to apply and emphasize the role of the market and law of value within the planning system, appropriately reducing the weight of mandatory plans and increasing the weight of guiding plans. On the other hand, it also played a role in expanding the scope of market regulation outside the planning system. With the increase in both the guiding plans within the planning system and the market regulation outside the system, the role of the market was embodied both inside and outside the planned system. Practice has proved that the importance of the market in economic development cannot be ignored, and the socialist economy cannot do without the role of market regulation. Deng Xiaoping provided more explicit exposition on this and was the first to associate the market economy with socialism.

In November 1979, when meeting with foreign guests, Deng Xiaoping pointed out, "To say that the market economy exists only in capitalist society and that there is only a capitalist market economy is definitely incorrect. Why can't socialism have a market economy? This cannot be said to be capitalism. We primarily have a planned economy, combined with a market economy, but this is a socialist market economy." Here, Deng Xiaoping explicitly used the term "socialist market economy." In June 1981, at the Sixth Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Party, the resolution "On Certain Historical Issues of the Party Since the Founding of the People’s Republic of China," while summarizing the road to socialist modernization in our country, proposed to "give play to the auxiliary role of market regulation." This statement was confirmed in the report of the 12th National Congress of the Party as the principle of "the planned economy is the mainstay, with market regulation as a supplementary aid," reflecting the understanding and perception of this issue at that time.



The major contribution of the "Decision on Economic System Reform" passed by the Third Plenary Session of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Party in 1984 was to solve the unification problem of socialism and commodity economy, but the disadvantage is that the unity problem of socialism and market economy has not yet been solved. The traditional concept that socialism cannot operate a market economy still has a significant influence. However, the "Decision on Economic System Reform" pointed out when it proposed that the socialist economy "is a planned commodity economy based on public ownership": implementing a planned economy does not mean relying mainly on directive plans, and indicative plans are also a specific form of planning. This provided a theoretical basis for gradually narrowing the scope of directive planning, continuously expanding the scope of market regulation, and promoting market-oriented reforms. The Thirteenth National Congress of the Party further pointed out: "The new system of socialist planned commodity economy should be a system in which planning and market are inherently unified." Since then, the phrase "planned economy as the main part" is no longer used in central documents. After the Fourth Plenary Meeting of the Thirteenth National Congress of the Party, it was proposed to establish an economic system and operating mechanism that combines planned economy and market regulation to adapt to the development of the planned commodity economy.

Since the Third Plenary Session of the Twelfth Central Committee of the Party, various places have vigorously developed the commodity economy, and market-oriented reforms have continued to expand and deepen. At the same time, in theory, issues about the nature of the market economy and whether China should implement a market economy have also caused a series of debates. The focus of the debate is whether the market economy is "surnamed" socialism or capitalism. On this issue, Deng Xiaoping has made clear statements and has repeatedly stated the view that "there is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and the market economy", emphasizing that we must understand theoretically that the difference between capitalism and socialism is not a problem of planning or market. Here is a summary of Deng Xiaoping's multiple discussions on the market economy: in addition to the above-mentioned discussion in November 1979, the second time was in January 1980 in "The Current Situation and Tasks", he proposed that we can "combine plan regulation and market regulation" when talking about seeking a road to develop economy suitable for China's actual situation. The third time was a conversation with the person in charge of the National Planning Commission in July 1982: "The superiority of socialism compared to capitalism is that it can centralize power and ensure priorities on a national scale. The disadvantage is that the market is not well utilized, and the economy is not lively. How to solve the relationship between planning and market? If it is solved well, it will be very beneficial to economic development; if it is not, it will mess things up." The fourth and fifth times are comments on the "Decision on Economic System Reform" (referred to as the "Decision") of the Third Plenary Session of the Twelfth National Congress of the Party. The fourth time was in an impromptu speech on October 20, 1984 when the plenary session passed the "Decision". He said that the "Decision" is a political economy that combines Marxist basic principles and the practice of Chinese socialism. The fifth time was a speech for the Central Advisory Commission two days later, saying that the "Decision" said some new things that our ancestors had never talked about. The sixth time was a conversation with a U.S. business delegation in October 1985, he clearly pointed out that "there is no fundamental contradiction between socialism and the market economy. The question is what method can be used to more effectively develop social productivity. We have been doing a planned economy in the past, but years of practice have proved, in a sense, that only doing a planned economy will restrict the development of productivity. Combining planned economy and market economy can liberate productivity and accelerate economic development. The seventh time was in February 1987, he said in a conversation with several central leaders: "Why is it said to be capitalism as soon as the market is discussed? Should planning be the only socialism? Planning and market are just methods. As long as it is beneficial for the development of productivity, it can be utilized.



"It serves socialism, it is socialist; it serves capitalism, it is capitalist. It seems that planning is socialist, which is also incorrect. Japan has a planning department, and the United States also has plans. We used to learn from the Soviet Union and engage in planned economy. Later, the planned economy was emphasized. Now, we should no longer talk about this." The eighth time is in September 1988, during the feedback of economic work, saying that macro-management should be reflected in the central government's words counting, and now it is the macro-management of the well-off society. Here, there is no direct reference to planning and market issues on the surface, but it is based on the implementation of a socialist market economy. Subsequently, it emphasized central macro-control under the conditions of a socialist market economy, which was an important authoritative basis. The ninth time was a speech on June 9, 1989: "We must continue to adhere to a combination of planned economy and market regulation, and this cannot be changed. In actual work, during the adjustment period, we can strengthen or have more planning, and more market regulation at other times to make it more flexible." The tenth time was a conversation with several central leaders in December 1990: "We must understand from a theoretical point of view that the distinction between capitalism and socialism is not about planning or markets. Socialism also has a market economy, and capitalism also has planned control...Don't think that engaging in a bit of market economy is the capitalist road, that's not a thing." The eleventh time was a conversation when inspecting Shanghai in early 1991: "Don’t think that planning economy means socialism and market economy means capitalism. That’s not the case. Both are means. The market can also serve socialism." The twelfth time was the conversation in the south mentioned in the text. In the southern conversation in 1992, specifically targeted at the debate over plan and market named "Social" or "Capitalist", Deng Xiaoping pointed out: Whether planning more or the market more, it’s not the essential difference between socialism and capitalism. A planned economy is not equal to socialism, and capitalism also has plans; a market economy is not equivalent to capitalism, and socialism also has a market. Planning and markets are all economic means. This thoroughly and incisively answered the major theoretical issue that had been debated for a long time about whether socialism could develop a market economy, fundamentally relieved the ideological restriction of viewing the planned economy as a basic feature of socialism, and laid the ideological and theoretical foundation for establishing the goal of the socialist market economic system.
During the preparation for the 14th Party Congress, the Party Central Committee repeatedly studied and determined the target model of economic system reform and made decisions. On June 9, 1992, Jiang Zemin gave a speech at the Central Party School, clearly proposing the establishment of a socialist market economic system. He first expounded Deng Xiaoping's idea of "socialism also has a market", saying that through more than ten years of reform and opening up, we have a deeper understanding. In the past, we often only saw the negative effects brought about by the spontaneity of the market, seldom saw the positive effects of the market on encouraging enterprise competition, and promoting economic development, especially did not see that the market is also a way to allocate resources, and did not see its promotion of optimizing resource allocation. This is a kind of one-sidedness in cognition.
