Of course, emphasizing the advantages of the market does not mean that the market is comprehensive and omnipotent, and the market also has obvious limitations.




Therefore, it is necessary to leverage the advantages of planning regulation to compensate for and resist the negative effects of market regulation, in order to ensure the comprehensive development of the entire economy. He also pointed out that it is imperative to fundamentally reform the highly concentrated planned economic system, otherwise, it would be impossible to achieve modernization in our country. How to reform, and what is the goal? He said that there are three ways to establish a new economic system: First, to establish a socialist commodity economic system that combines planning and markets; Second, to establish a planned market economy system under socialism; Third, to establish a socialist market economic system. After extensive solicitation of opinions and repeated comparisons, the Central Government "tends to use the socialist market economic system." On June 12, Jiang Zemin told Deng Xiaoping his ideas. Deng Xiaoping immediately agreed, saying that in fact we are doing this, Shenzhen is a socialist market economy. Thereafter, the party committees of 30 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the Central Government all agreed with the idea of a socialist market economic system. 
In the fall of 1992, the 14th National Congress of the Party officially proposed the goal of reforming to establish a socialist market economic system. Jiang Zemin pointed out in his report at the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party that the goal of China's economic system reform is to establish a socialist market economic system in order to further liberate and develop productive forces. Our country should set up a socialist market economic system that allows the market to play a basic role in resource allocation under the macro-control of socialist countries, and ensures that economic activities comply with the requirements of the laws of value and adapt to changes in supply-demand relationships. Through the functions of price leverage and competition mechanisms, resources are allocated to sectors with better benefits and pressures are applied to enterprises to phase out inferior products. We should also use the advantage of the market's sensitivity to various economic signals to promote the timely coordination of production and demand. At the same time, it should also be seen that the market has its own weaknesses and negative aspects, and it is necessary to strengthen and improve the state's macroeconomic control. The report also pointed out that the socialist market economic system is integrated with the basic socialist economic system. In terms of ownership structure, the public ownership economy, including all-people ownership, and collective ownership economy, are the main body while individual economy, private economy, and foreign economy are supplements. Different economic components can voluntarily carry out various forms of joint operations. State-owned enterprises, collective enterprises, and other enterprises all enter the market, playing a leading role through equal competition. In terms of distribution systems, distribution according to labor is the main body, with other distribution methods as supplements, taking into account both efficiency and equity. In terms of macro control, we should better align the immediate interests of the people with long-term interests, and local interests with overall interests, and give full play to the strengths of both planning and market tools. In March 1993, the First Session of the Eighth National People's Congress made amendments to the Constitution and changed "the state practices socialist planned economy" to "the state practices socialist market economy." The socialist market economy was written into the Constitution.
The establishment of the socialist market economic system signifies the party's new leaps in understanding of scientific socialist theory and reform and opening-up practices. From the beginning of the reform, the party proposed to play a supporting role in market regulation, to the 14th National Congress of the Party confirming the goal of the socialist market economic system, a full 14 years had passed. The final establishment of this goal is a major achievement from the hard exploration of the party in reform, opening-up, and the practice of modernization construction, and also the inevitable result of the in-depth development of the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. This new decision has made the direction of our country's economic system reform and socialist modernization construction clearer.



In accordance with the decisions of the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party, the Central Committee of the Party and the State Council have been speeding up all kinds of reforms and urgently formulating an overall plan for the establishment of a socialist market economic system. In November 1993, the Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party adopted the "Decision on Certain Issues Concerning the Establishment of a Socialist Market Economic System" (hereinafter referred to as the "Decision"), which put forward a relatively complete idea and plan on how to establish a socialist market economic system. The "Decision" pointed out: The establishment of a socialist market economic system aims to enable the market to play a fundamental role in resource allocation under state macro-control, to liberate and develop productivity to the greatest extent, to enhance the comprehensive national strength of the state, to improve people's living standards more quickly, and to fully take advantage of the superiority of the socialist system. To achieve this goal, the "Decision" elaborated on the five main links in the establishment of a socialist market economy. 

At the closing session of the plenary session, Jiang Zemin pointed out that this "Decision" is the action program for the Party to carry out economic system reform in the 1990s based on Deng Xiaoping's theory of socialism with Chinese characteristics and the spirit of the Fourteenth Congress of the Party. 

II. Full implementation of the reform of the socialist market economic system
With the establishment of the goal of reforming the socialist market economic system by the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party and the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party, China's reform and opening up have entered a new stage of overall transformation from a planned economy to a market economy. 

1. Actively promoting the reform of state-owned enterprises and establishing a modern enterprise system
State-owned enterprises are the mainstay of China's national economy. The reform of state-owned enterprises is the core of economic system reform. The modern enterprise system with public ownership as the main body is the basis of the socialist market economy. The direction of state-owned enterprise reform determined by the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party is to establish a modern enterprise system. This is an inevitable requirement for developing large-scale socialized production and a socialist market economy. It marks that the thinking of China's economic system reform has shifted from the policy adjustment based on power delegation, profit to tax, and separation of two rights in the past to the stage of institutional innovation centered on the reform of property rights of public ownership.




This marks a significant shift in the direction of reform, which is an important indicator of deepening reform. To this end, the central government has made the decision to concentrate on improving large and medium-sized enterprises, while also liberating and invigorating small state-owned enterprises. This will be done by increasing the intensity of merging, reorganizing, acquiring, and liquidating companies, thus promoting the optimization and restructuring of state-owned assets. Since 1994, the State Council has made it clear that first of all, a trial of the modern corporate system will be carried out in 100 large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises. Then 18 cities will carry out trials to restructure and reorganize their capital and assets. The focus will be on 1,000 key state-owned enterprises that are vital to national economy and people's livelihood. Cross-area and cross-industry corporate groups were developed, with 56 enterprise groups being reorganized first. Within these trial companies, a majority has been restructured into joint-stock companies, with business mechanisms undergoing change, industrial structures adjusted, and an array of experiences gathered regarding the establishment of modern corporate systems in large and medium state-owned enterprises. For small state-owned enterprises, a variety of liberated and invigorating business modes and organizational structures were adopted. And by the end of 1993, nearly 4,000 companies nationwide were participating in joint-stock trials in line with standardization requirements. Corresponding rules and regulations about joint-stock systems were steadily set up. Adopting a joint-stock system has become the effective way to transform business mechanisms and establish a modern corporate system.

2. Cultivate and grow the market system; vigorously promote financial system and pricing system reforms

The key to establish a socialist market economy is to allow the market mechanism to play a fundamental role in allocating resources, which demands nurturing and growing a market system. While continuing to develop commodity markets, it is particularly crucial to vigorously develop the market for production materials, actively nurture a financial market inclusive of bonds, stocks and other securities, develop technology, services, information and real-estate markets, and form a unified, open market system as quickly as possible. The 14th Party Congress' third plenary session passed the "Decision on Establishing the Socialist Market Economic System" (abbreviated as the "Decision"), one major breakthrough was the introduction of the "labor market". According to Marx's "Capital", labor power only becomes a commodity under capitalism. The practice of reform and opening-up has shown that in the primary stage of socialism, due to the existence of various forms of ownership, labor still has commodity attributes and produces surplus value. A large influx of rural laborers into urban employment represents a massive labor market. Recognizing the existence of a labor market in objective reality can both protect the rights and interests of workers through labor laws and promote optimal allocation of labor resources. The "Decision" to change the longstanding term "Services Market" to "Labor Market" represents a major ideological liberation.

The development of a market economy, the financial market plays a pivotal role. Shortly after the Third Plenum of the 12th Party Congress approved the decision on economic system reform, Deng Xiaoping pointed out: Our banks in the past were currency issuance companies and treasuries, not real banks. "The pace of financial reform needs to be stepped up. To make banks truly operate like banks." In the early 1990s, when speaking of developing Pudong, he stressed: "Finance is very important and is at the core of modern economics. If the finance is well managed, one chess move can invigorate the whole board."



"Shanghai used to be a financial center, a place where currency could be freely exchanged, and it should also be in the future." In November 1990 and July 1992, with the authorization from the State Council and the approval from the People's Bank of China, the Shanghai and Shenzhen stock exchanges were established one after another, achieving the centralized trading of stocks and forming a nationwide securities trading market. This has also become an important symbol of the formation and financial system reform of our country's capital market. Since 1994, our country has gradually established a central bank macro-control system independently executing monetary policy under the leadership of the State Council, implemented the separation of policy finance and commercial finance, and established a financial organization system with state-owned commercial banks as the main body and various financial institutions coexisting, as well as a financial market system that is unified, open, orderly competitive, and strictly managed. Subsequently, the practice of aligning the RMB price with the foreign exchange adjustment market price, and the free conversion of foreign exchange under current items, established a managed single floating exchange rate system based on market supply and demand, which played an important role in further communicating domestic and foreign markets, improving the foreign economic environment, further attracting foreign investment, and developing an open economy.

The reform of the price management system, both as one of the earliest initiated reforms of the economic system and a reform with continuous increase in adjustment intensity. With consecutive years of good agricultural harvests and an increasingly abundant supply of agricultural products, by 1993 the prices and operations for the vast majority of agricultural products, including grain, were liberalized. The original grain rationing was replaced with market supply, and grain tickets and grain booklets for urban residents were all abolished. Most prices for production materials transitioned from a "dual-track system" to a single market price. The proportion of market prices in the total retail sales of social commodities rose from 50.3% before 1991 to 93.8% in 1993, establishing the dominant position of market prices in the pricing system. During this period, economic means, legal means, and necessary administrative means were used in combination, with a price control system primarily based on economic means being established. This marked a smooth transition in price reform, which was previously considered to cause the most social unrest. This is yet another major achievement of the economic reform.

3. Establish and improve the macro-control system, actively promote the reform of the fiscal and tax system and the investment system

The socialist market economy system established by our country aims to better combine planning and market means. The main task of macro-control is to maintain the basic balance of economic total, promote the optimization of economic structure, guide the sustainable, rapid, and healthy development of national economy, and drive comprehensive social progress. The main economic methods employed are the establishment of a mechanism coordinating and restricting planning, finance, and fiscal policy, strengthening the comprehensive coordination of economic operation.

Actively promoting the reform of the fiscal and tax system is a key point in establishing and improving the macro-control system after the third plenary session of the twelfth Party Central Committee. In December 1993, the State Council decided to implement a tax-sharing system, dividing various income into fixed central fiscal income, fixed local fiscal income, and shared income between the central and local governments; correspondingly adjusted the tax collection and management system, established a standardized distribution relationship between the central and local governments, institutionally ensured the unity of fiscal power and authority at all levels of government, gradually increased the proportion of fiscal revenue in gross national product, appropriately increased the proportion of central fiscal income, to enhance the ability of macro-control of the central government. At the same time, on the basis of unifying tax laws, fair tax burdens, simplifying tax systems, and rationalizing decentralization, the focus is on implementing a turnover tax system mainly composed of value-added tax, changing product tax to consumption tax, collecting business tax in the service industry, uniformly adopting the method of progressive tax on personal income, gradually forming a fair competitive environment. Starting in 1997, the tax policies of the financial and insurance industry were further adjusted, and China's tax system gradually aligned with international rules.

Another important measure to strengthen the macro-control system is to actively promote the reform of the investment and financing system. This is mainly to further strengthen the investment position of enterprises, and to introduce more market competition mechanisms in the field of investment and financing.



The capital system is implemented for various operational fixed asset investment projects. The investment project can only be established after the capital is realized. Various financing methods are introduced in the infrastructure, basic industries, and public utilities construction, widely absorbing funds from all sectors of society and promoting the maximum economic and social benefits of investment financing.  
4. Deepen the reform of the foreign trade system and establish an operating mechanism adapted to international economic common rules  
To establish a socialist market economic system, it is necessary to fully utilize both international and domestic markets and resources. This necessitates the normalization of foreign economic activities and the deepening of foreign trade system reforms. Three measures were mainly adopted at the time.  
First, the directive plan for foreign trade import was cancelled and replaced with a guiding plan. For goods needed by domestic production and the market, enterprises organize imports according to the market demand, reduce the number of quota-managed goods, and standardize the management methods of import quota goods. Second, granting import and export rights to qualified enterprises, changing the laggard state of the business mechanism transformation of foreign trade enterprises, improving their adaptability to increasingly fierce international market competition, and cultivating and expanding a number of large-scale foreign trade enterprises with international competitiveness. Third, in conjunction with international conventions, foreign trade laws and regulations are improved, efforts are accelerated to align the foreign trade system with international standards, and the overall tariff level is lowered. From April 1, 1996, the overall import tax on more than 4,000 commodities was reduced to 23%, and on October 1, 1997, it was further lowered to around 17%. Not only did these measures help more competitive foreign goods enter the Chinese market, but they also promoted China's economic development and accelerated China's entry into the World Trade Organization.
The transition from a planned economy to a socialist market economy is a typical process of "crossing the river by feeling the stones". There is no blame for that. Without experience, the only way to forge a path is like this. This is the theory of empirical knowledge of Marxism. Through the above-mentioned reforms and other reforms, the transition was basically completed, the marketization and socialization of the national economy were significantly improved, and the economic vitality was significantly enhanced. All this created favorable conditions for the continued improvement and perfection of the socialist market economic system.
3. An important juncture in historical development and upholding the great banner of Deng Xiaoping’s theory.
After Deng Xiaoping's death on February 19, 1997, whether the Communist Party of China could continue to uphold the great banner of Deng Xiaoping's theory, and whether China's reform and opening up and modernization could continue along the socialist road with Chinese characteristics opened up by Deng Xiaoping, became a major event thatfocuses the attention of the whole Party, the whole nation, and the world. In response to this key issue related to China's overall development, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin at its core, provided a clear answer.



This is: adhering to Deng Xiaoping's legacy, upholding the great banner of Deng Xiaoping theory, persistently advancing along the path of socialist construction with Chinese characteristics pioneered by Deng Xiaoping.
The "Letter to All Party Members, All Military Personnel and People of All Ethnic Groups in the Country" released by the Central Party and Jiang Zemin's eulogy at Deng Xiaoping's memorial service highly praised Deng Xiaoping's tumultuous revolutionary career of over 70 years and his immortal contributions to the independence and liberation of the Chinese nation and the socialist modernization cause of China. The eulogy emphasizes: the most precious wealth left by Deng Xiaoping to us is the theory of building social socialism with Chinese characteristics that he founded and the party's basic line at the primary stage of socialism formulated under the guidance of this theory. This is a must-follow action guide. On the new journey across the century, raising the great banner of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics higher and better implementing the party's basic line is the firm determination and conviction of our party central leadership collective, and it is also the consensus and desire of all party members, the entire military, and people of all ethnic groups nationwide.
On May 29, Jiang Zemin gave a speech at the graduation ceremony of the Central Party School's Provincial and Ministerial Advanced Studies Course, once again emphasizing the issue of upholding the banner of Deng Xiaoping theory. He said, in the new era of socialist reform and openness, and the construction of modernization, on the new journey across the century, we must hold high the grand banner of Deng Xiaoping's theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics, and use this theory to guide our entire cause and all works. This is an unshakeable conclusion that the party drew from history and reality. The issue of the banner is crucial. The banner is the direction, the banner is the image. We must have a high level of consciousness and firmness on this issue, and we should not waver no matter what difficulties or risks we encounter.
In September 1997, the Fifteenth National Congress of the Party was held, and Jiang Zemin made a report titled "Uphold the Great Banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, and Fully Push Forward the Construction of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics into the 21st Century". The report, standing at the height of the era, elaborated on the century-old tremendous changes of the Chinese nation. It pointed out that since the 20th century, our nation has experienced three historic changes, producing three great figures standing at the forefront of the era: Sun Yat-sen, who led the Xinhai Revolution and overthrew the autocratic system that ruled China for thousands of years; Mao Zedong, who led the victory of the New Democratic Revolution and established New China and the socialist system; Deng Xiaoping, who led the reform and opening-up and the construction of socialist modernization, known as the new great revolution. The third historic change successfully blazed a new path of building socialism with Chinese characteristics for the revitalization of the nation, a strong nation, and the happiness of the people. The vigorous vitality and energy shown by socialism in China has attracted worldwide attention. The great contributions made by Deng Xiaoping to China and the world are sincerely respected and loved by the Chinese people and people around the world.
The report of the Fifteenth Congress of the Party further expounded the historical position of Deng Xiaoping's theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics and used the "Deng Xiaoping Theory" formulation for the first time. Jiang Zemin pointed out: The Communist Party of China is a party that attaches great importance to theoretical guidance. The Communist Party of China guided by Marxism-Leninism combines it with the reality of China, realizes two historical leaps, and produces two major theoretical achievements. The main founder of the theoretical results of the first leap was Mao Zedong, our party calls it Mao Zedong Thought. "The main creator of the theoretical result of the second leap is the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. Its main creator is Deng Xiaoping. We of the party call it Deng Xiaoping Theory." The report of the Fifteenth Congress of the Party pointed out the historical position of Deng Xiaoping's theory: Deng Xiaoping's theory is the right theory to guide the Chinese people to realize socialist modernization successfully in reform and openness.



In contemporary China, only the Deng Xiaoping Theory, which combines Marxism with the practice and characteristics of current China, can solve the issue of the future and destiny of socialism. No other theories can do this. Deng Xiaoping Theory is the Marxism of contemporary China, and represents a new stage of development for Marxism in China.

The report pointed out that the reason why Deng Xiaoping Theory can become a new stage in the development of Marxism in China is: 
First, Deng Xiaoping Theory adheres to the principles of liberating thought and seeking truth from facts, inheriting from predecessors yet breaking old conventions based on new practice, opening up new territory for Marxism.
Second, Deng Xiaoping Theory insists on the basic achievements of the theory and practice of scientific socialism, takes hold of the fundamental questions of "what is socialism and how to build socialism", deeply reveals the essence of socialism, and raises the understanding of socialism to a new scientific level. 
Third, Deng Xiaoping Theory insists on observing the world with the broad vision of Marxism, conducting correct analyses of contemporary era characteristics, overall international situations, the success or failure of other socialist countries, the development of developing countries, the development trends and contradictions of developed countries, and making new scientific judgements. 
Fourth, Deng Xiaoping Theory is the scientific system of the theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics, which was gradually formed and developed based on the historical experience of our country's successful and unsuccessful socialist construction, lessons learned from other socialist countries, under the historical conditions where peace and development became the main theme of the era, and in the practice of China's reform and opening up and modernization.
This theory systematically and preliminarily answers a series of basic questions about China's socialist development path, stages, fundamental tasks, driving forces, external conditions, political guarantees, strategic steps, party leadership and relied-upon power, and national unification, and guides our party's basic line in the primary stage of socialism. 
Thus, Jiang Zemin stated, the soul of this congress is to uphold the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory.

In contemporary China, Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory belong to one unified scientific system. 
Adhering to Deng Xiaoping Theory is truly adhering to Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought. 
Raising high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory is truly raising high the banner of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong Thought.
The Party Constitution Amendment adopted by the Congress further establishes Deng Xiaoping Theory as the guiding thought of the Party and clearly stipulates that the Communist Party of China regards Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory as its action guide.

The congress further explained and summarized the fundamental theory of socialism in the primary stage, which is regarded as the foundation of Deng Xiaoping Theory, thus enriching and developing this theory first expounded at the 13th Congress. This mainly includes: 
(1) It was pointed out for the first time that the greatest reality of our country is that it is and will remain in the primary stage of socialism for a long time. 
The comprehensive reform enters the critical stage, encounters many contradictions and difficulties, and some new doubts need to be clarified. 
This requires further understanding of China's national conditions, and firmly believing in the Party's basic line and basic policy at this stage. 
Only with a correct understanding of the basic national conditions can we firmly believe why we must implement the current policies and cannot implement other policies. 
The report clearly pointed out: "We speak of starting from reality, and the greatest reality is that China is now and will remain in the primary stage of socialism for a long time. When we talk about understanding clearly 'what is socialism, how to build socialism', we must understand what is socialism at the primary stage and how to build socialism at the primary stage." Because of this, the Fifteenth Congress of the Party once again emphasized the issue of socialism in the primary stage and reinterpreted this theory.



(2) Based on the new understanding of "what is socialism and how to build socialism", a new definition of the connotation and characteristics of the primary stage of socialism has been made. "What is socialism, and how to build socialism" is a fundamental question that Deng Xiaoping repeatedly asked after summarizing China's historical experience. After the third volume of "Selected Works of Deng Xiaoping" was published in November 1993, the whole Party studied and discussed this fundamental issue, raising its understanding of socialism to a new level. The Fifteenth Party Congress spoke about one important feature of the primary stage of socialism, which is to analyze problems and increase its understanding from this high level, thus resulting in a more enriched understanding. The primary stage of socialism is emphasized as a constant evolution from one state to another, highlighting the dynamic nature of its basic characteristics. The Thirteenth Congress of the Party listed five basic characteristics of the primary stage. The Fifteenth Party Congress looked back based on new experiences and broadened it into nine aspects including the overall characteristics, physical and spiritual civilization development characteristics, and political civilization development characteristics. The summarization of the basic characteristics of the primary stage of socialism by the Fifteenth Party Congress is as follows: 

The primary stage of socialism is a historical stage where society gradually moves away from its underdeveloped status, and essentially realizes socialist modernization; it gradually transforms a predominantly agricultural country relying primarily on manual labor into an industrialized country where the majority of the population is non-agrarian, comprising of modern agriculture and the modern service industry; it gradually transitions from an economy where the natural and semi-natural economy occupy a significant portion, to a stage where market economy is highly developed; it transforms from an era where a significant segment of the population is illiterate and culturally backward, to one where scientific education and culture are relatively developed; it transitions from a stage where a significant weight of the population is in poverty and the standard of living is low, to a stage where the entire populace is relatively affluent; it evolves from an imbalance in regional economic and cultural development to a stage where the gap is progressively narrowing; it is a stage where through reform and exploration, a fairly mature, robust, and thriving Socialist Market Economic System, Socialist Democratic Political System, and other systems are established and perfected; it is a stage where the multitude firmly establish the common ideal of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, constantly striving for self-improvement, forging ahead, fighting hard, building the country through hard work and frugality, while trying to build a spiritual civilization alongside a material one; it is a stage where the gap with the world's advanced levels is slowly closing, and the grand revival of the Chinese nation is realized on the basis of socialism.

(3) According to the spirit of Deng Xiaoping's southern tour speech, it is further affirmed that the primary stage of socialism requires at least 100 years. The contradiction between the people's ever-growing needs for material and cultural life and the backward social productive forces, which is the main contradiction in the society, will "penetrate the whole process of the primary stage of socialism and all aspects of social life". Only by firmly grasping this main contradiction, can we "clearly observe and grasp the overall situation of social contradictions, effectively promote the resolution of various social contradictions", thereby making the premise of "development is the absolute principle, and the key to solving all problems in China is to rely on our own development" more solid.

(4) For the first time, the relationship between "reform, development, and stability", proposed after the Fourteenth Party Congress, is included in the historical framework of the primary stage of socialism. This not only clarifies the strategic position of managing these three relationships in the overall construction of socialist modernization but also further determines that it is a long-term basic policy applicable to the entire primary stage of socialism. In this way, it not only elevates the understanding of the status of the relationship between the three but also enriches the basic issues that should be grasped during the primary stage of socialism. The Fifteenth Party Congress's reinterpretation of the theory of the primary stage of socialism not only makes this foundational theory of Deng Xiaoping's more timely, but also makes it the theoretical basis for the third generation leadership group to propose the basic program of the primary stage of socialism.

IV. Formation of the Basic Program of the Primary Stage of Socialism



At the Fifteenth Congress of the Party, based on Deng Xiaoping's theory and the basic line of the Party, the basic program of the Party in the primary stage of socialism was proposed for the first time in a relatively complete way, in view of the goal of building a socialist modern country characterized by prosperity, democracy and civilization. If we say confirming and summarizing the basic line of the Party after the first explanation of the theory of the primary stage of socialism was a significant theoretical contribution of the Thirteenth Congress of the Party, then clarifying the basic program of the Party at this stage from a new height when re-explaining the problem of the primary stage of socialism was a major theoretical contribution of the Fifteenth Congress of the Party. 

The understanding of the basic program of the primary stage of socialism by the Party also went through a process of exploration. As early as 1979, Ye Jianying, representing the Central Committee of the Party, proposed in his speech commemorating the 30th anniversary of the founding of the People's Republic of China the program for comprehensively achieving modernization, which was subsequently reaffirmed by Deng Xiaoping: "Our country has already entered a new era of socialist modernization. While greatly improving social productivity, we should also reform and perfect the socialist economic and political system, develop highly socialist democracy and a complete socialist legal system. We should improve the scientific and cultural level of the entire nation, develop noble and varied cultural life, and build highly socialist spiritual civilization." Afterwards, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized that the task of building socialism with Chinese characteristics is many, we should not sacrifice one for the other while persisting in the comprehensive development and progress of a socialist society with the economic construction as the center. Therefore, he proposed a series of "two hands" strategic thoughts and policies, requiring us to grasp reform and opening up and combat crime; grasp economic construction and democratic legal system; grasp material civilization and spiritual civilization. He emphasized that both hands must be held tight. Therefore, Deng Xiaoping's theory is the theoretical basis for the comprehensive building and development of the economic, political and cultural aspects of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

At the fourth plenary session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party, Jiang Zemin pointed out that for the basic policies since the third plenary session of the 11th Central Committee, we must be steadfast and unswerving, fully implement them without any second thought. In December 1990, the Seventh Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee of the Party passed "Suggestions on the Formulation of a Ten-Year Plan for the National Economy and Social Development and the 'Eighth Five-Year' Plan", which put forward several principles for the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics covering economic, political and cultural aspects. On July 1, 1991, in his speech at the celebration of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Party, Jiang Zemin made a systematic summary of the basic contents of socialism with Chinese characteristics in terms of economy, politics and culture in accordance with Mao Zedong's thinking on new democracy. He pointed out:

(1) In building a socialist economy with Chinese characteristics, we must adhere to the socialist public ownership of the means of production as the main body, allow and encourage other economic elements to develop appropriately, neither deviating from the level of development of productive forces to engage in a single form of public ownership, nor shaking the dominant position of the public ownership economy. We cannot engage in privatization. We must implement a distribution system based on distribution according to work as the main body and supplemented by other means of distribution, overcome equalitarianism, prevent polarization, and gradually realize the common prosperity of all people. We must establish an economic system and operation mechanism suitable for the development of planned commodity economy under socialism, combine planned economy with market regulation, give full play to the positive role of market regulation under the guidance of national laws and regulations and plans, overcome the previous overly centralized and tightly controlled shortfalls, but also cannot over-disperse and weaken macro-control.

(2) In building a socialist political structure with Chinese characteristics, we must persist in the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants, and can not weaken or abandon the people's democratic dictatorship. We must adhere to and perfect the system of people's congresses, and cannot adopt the Western parliamentary system. We must adhere to and perfect the system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation led by the Chinese Communist Party, and cannot weaken or deny the leadership of the Communist Party, and cannot adopt the Western multiparty system.



(3) To construct a culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics, we must adhere to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism and Mao Zedong thought; we cannot diversify the guiding ideas. We must persist on serving people and socialism; flourishing and promoting socialist culture in line with the principles of "let a hundred flowers bloom, and a hundred schools of thought contend.". We should not allow deleterious and anti-socialist influences to permeate our society. We must carry forward the excellent cultural traditions of our nation while reflecting the spirit of the socialist era, anchoring ourselves in our homeland and absorbing the excellent results of world culture. We should also resist attempts at nihilism and wholesale Westernization. Jiang Zemin emphasized, "the economy, politics, and culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics are an integrated and indivisible whole."

After Deng Xiaoping's southern tour talk in 1992 and the Party's 14th National Congress, significant achievements were made in economic, political, and cultural construction in our country, and the contents of economic, political, and cultural construction of socialist with Chinese characteristics became richer. Based on this, the Party's 15th National Congress, taking the theory of building socialism with Chinese characteristics as summarized by the 14th National Congress, further summarized the experiences of economic, political, and cultural aspects of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and made more incisive statements on how to build such an economy, politics, and culture. It officially proposed the Party's basic program in the primary stage of socialism. This program, centering on the Party's basic line and the goals of socialist modernization, sets out requirements and tasks in the economic, political, and cultural areas.

(1) "Constructing an economy of socialism with Chinese characteristics" means developing a market economy under socialist conditions and continuously liberating and developing productive forces. This requires us to adhere to and improve the basic economic system of socialism with public ownership as the mainstay and multiple forms of ownership developing side by side; adhere to and perfect the socialist market economic system, where the market plays a basic role in allocating resources under national macro-control; and adhere to and improve a system of distribution where contribution is dominant, allowing some regions and people to become prosperous first, and then help others to follow. Ultimately, the goal is for common prosperity.

(2) "Constructing a politics of socialism with Chinese characteristics" means subsequently, developing socialist democracy politics under the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party and based on the principle of the people being masters of their own affairs, and ruling the country according to law. This requires adherence to and perfecting the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants; to adhere to and improve the system of people's congresses and the system of multiparty cooperation and political consultation under the leadership of the Communist Party, and the system of regional autonomy for ethnic minorities; to develop democracy, perfect the legal system, and build a socialist country ruled by law. A vigorous political situation in which the country is stable, the government is clean and efficient, and the people of all ethnic groups live in harmony.




Among the listed basic political systems, the system of ethnic regional autonomy has been added, which is very necessary and consistent with the characteristics of our multi-ethnic country's political system. Subsequent party documents mention this one when discussing the basic political system at the current stage of our country. It also adds the requirements of "building a socialist country under the rule of law" and "clean and efficient government", which not only reflect the wishes of the people, but also express the efforts the party needs to make to achieve the goal of democratic politics. Both of these aspects are part of building socialism with Chinese characteristics, which reflects significant progress in the party's thinking on democracy and rule of law.

(3) "Building a socialist culture with Chinese characteristics" means taking Marxism as a guide and aiming to cultivate citizens with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline. We must develop a socialist culture that is geared towards modernization, the world, and the future and is national, scientific, and popular. This requires arming the entire party with Deng Xiaoping Theory, educating the people, and striving to improve the ideological and moral qualities, education, science, and cultural level of all members of the nation. The content here is based on a speech in July 1991 and incorporates the new results of the party's Sixth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee in October 1996 on "several important issues in strengthening the construction of a socialist spiritual civilization". These results have further enhanced our understanding. In order to succinctly and comprehensively answer what a culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics is, the passage "guided by Marxism, cultivating citizens with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, and developing a socialist culture toward modernization, the world, and the future" combines Deng Xiaoping's thought, and covers various requirements, highlighting the characteristic of keeping up with the times.

The basic goals and policies of building a socialist economy, politics, and culture with Chinese characteristics form the basic program of the party in the primary stage of socialism. Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report of the 15th National Congress of the Party: "This program is an important part of Deng Xiaoping's theory and is the extension of the party's basic line in the economic, political, and cultural aspects. It is a scientific summary of the most important experiences over the years." The proposal of this basic program is of great significance in unifying the thinking of the entire party and unifying the people of all ethnic groups in the country to strive for the cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics.

Chapter 8 Developing Socialist Democracy with Chinese Characteristics and Building a Socialist Spiritual Civilization

I. Actively promoting socialist democratic political construction

Democratic political construction is an important part of the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics. After entering a new stage of reform and opening up, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin at its core, took more practical measures to advance political system reform, establish socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics, and achieved fruitful results in institutional construction and other aspects based on a deep understanding of China's national conditions and the needs of the changing situation.

1. Proposal of the policy of "actively and prudently promoting political system reform"
  
Deng Xiaoping was the chief architect of reform and opening up and modernization construction, as well as the chief architect of political system reform. His several speeches clearly defined the fundamental goal and overall framework of our country's political system reform. After the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee of the Party, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin at its core, persistently adhered to Deng Xiaoping's thoughts on political system reform, and further proposed the policy of "actively and prudently promoting political system reform".



In July 1995, Jiang Zemin noted, "While we are implementing economic system reform, we are also actively and prudently advancing political system reform, striving to build socialist democratic politics with Chinese characteristics." In his speech at the 20th anniversary conference of the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee of the Party in December 1998, he continued to point out that "We must actively and prudently advance the reform of the political system. This is an inherent requirement for the self-improvement and development of our country's socialist political system and also an important decision made by our Party based on historical and practical experience." This decision is a basic policy with far-reaching significance in the course of the development of our country's political system reform.

The policy of "actively and prudently advancing political system reform" has two implications. First, the reform of the political system is still ongoing and has not been interrupted as some people at home and abroad have criticized due to political turmoil. As the report of the Fourteenth Party Congress said, "we should actively promote the reform of the political system to bring about a significant development in the construction of socialist democracy and the legal system." After this, the Communist Party of China made great efforts in strengthening our basic political system, improving the democratic centralism, improving the scientific and democratic mechanisms of decision-making, strengthening democratic construction at the grassroots level, and so on. Therefore, the claim that reform of our country's political system has stalled is groundless. Second, the basic principle of advancing the reform of the political system is to be "active and steady." What we mean by "active" is that the reform of the political system cannot stop and must be actively promoted. Especially when economic system reform enters a critical stage, and the socialist market economic system needs further improvement, political system reform must adapt accordingly.

Jiang Zemin pointed out in June 2000, "To bring the new socialist market economic system to a relatively complete level, a series of deep-seated problems need to be solved, including the management system and operating mechanisms of the government and the leadership system of the Party and the state, which all need to be further improved and perfected through deepened reform." Talking about system innovation, "we must constantly improve all aspects of the system that meet the requirements for developing a socialist market economy and comprehensively building socialism with Chinese characteristics." "Steadiness" is because the reform of the political system is a very complex system project that is very difficult. According to Deng Xiaoping, It was not until the mid-1980s that "the problem has not been completely sorted out." "This problem is too difficult. Each reform involves a wide range of people and things, it's profound, touches many people's interests, and will encounter many obstacles. It requires careful consideration... The country is so large, the situation is too complicated, reform is not easy, so decisions must be made cautiously."

Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report of the Fifteenth Party Congress, "Building socialist democratic politics is a gradually developing historical process, and it is necessary to start from China's national conditions and advance in an orderly manner under the leadership of the Party." Therefore, the reform of the political system cannot be rushed, the only option is to take the policy of being "active and steady."

According to the overall goal of political system reform proposed by Deng Xiaoping and the specific requirement of "sorting out the head", the thought of further integrating and promoting political system reform is integrated. Jiang Zemin pointed out in the report of the Fifteenth Party Congress, "Now and for a period of time to come, the main tasks of political system reform are to develop democracy, strengthen the legal system, carry out the separation of government and enterprises, streamline institutions, perfect the democratic supervision system, and maintain stability and unity." In April 2001, he proposed six principles for promoting the reform of the political system:

(1) Reforming the leadership system of the Party and the state is not to weaken the leadership of the Party, but to strengthen and improve the leadership of the Party.



To be conducive to consolidating the socialist system, conducive to consolidating party leadership, and conducive to developing social productivity under the leadership of the party and under the socialist system.
(2) The goal of reform is to always maintain the vitality of the party and the state, overcome bureaucracy, improve work efficiency, expand grassroots democracy, and mobilize the enthusiasm of grassroots workers, peasants, and intellectuals.
(3) Persist in strengthening and improving democracy within the party, in order to continuously promote the development of people's democracy.
(4) Whether the reform is successful depends on whether the state's political situation is stable, whether it can enhance the unity of people of all ethnic groups, improve people's lives, and whether productivity can continue to develop.
(5) We cannot lose the superiority of our socialist system, and we cannot copy the so-called democracy of the West. We should decide on the content and steps of reform based on our own practice and situation.
(6) The reform of the political system is complex, and every measure involves the interests of millions of people. It needs to be conducted step by step, with leadership and order.
These principles have further strengthened and clarified the idea of advancing the reform of the political system in a positive and prudent direction.
2. Completing the System of Multi-party Cooperation and Political Consultation Led by the Communist Party of China
The system of multi-party cooperation and political consultation led by the Communist Party of China is a basic political system of our country and an important aspect of political system reform. In 1987, the thirteenth CPC congress proposed the task of reforming the political system, and it was proposed to improve the "multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the Communist Party".
After the Thirteenth Congress of the Party, some members of the democratic parties and non-party people in Beijing proposed views and suggestions on the issue of "multi-party cooperation". In early January 1989, after reading, Deng Xiaoping instructed: “A special group can be organized (members must be from democratic parties) to specifically formulate a plan for democratic party members to participate in politics and perform supervisory duties, and to complete it within one year, and start implementation next year." According to Deng Xiaoping's instruction, the special group was led by the Democratic Parties and the leaders of relevant departments such as the NPC Standing Committee, the State Council, the CPPCC, the Organization Department, the Propaganda Department, and the United Front Work Department participated. After more than a year of efforts, the drafting work was completed. In February 1990, the People's Daily published the "Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Adhering to and Improving the Multi-Party Cooperation and Political Consultation System Led by the Communist Party" (referred to as "Opinions"), which made regulations on many issues.
(1) On the form of political consultation..



The "Opinion" summarizes the effective experiences between the Communist Party of China and the democratic parties since the founding of New China, and believes that the following forms of consultation should be adopted: First, the chief leaders of the CPC Central Committee invite the main leaders of the democratic parties and representatives of non-partisan figures to hold high-level, small-scale heart-to-heart talks irregularly according to the needs of the situation, to freely discuss, exchange ideas, and solicit opinions on issues of common concern. Second, the CPC holds symposiums for democratic parties and non-partisan figures to report or exchange important information, convey important documents, and listen to policy suggestions from democratic parties and non-partisan figures or discuss certain topics. Third, in addition to conference consultations, various democratic parties and non-partisan figures can put forward written policy suggestions to the CPC Central Committee on major issues concerning the country's major policies and modernization, and can also invite the person in charge of the CPC Central Committee for direct talks.

(2) On the role of democratic parties in the People's Congress. The "Opinion" stipulates that members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures should hold appropriate proportions among the deputies of the National People's Congress, members of the Standing Committee, and members of the Standing Special Committee, and that members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures with corresponding expertise can be hired as advisors to the Special Committee. The People's Congress of provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the Central Government should ensure that democratic party members and non-partisan figures hold appropriate proportions. In the People's Congress of cities, states, and counties, non-partisan figures should hold appropriate proportions. In cities, states, and counties with democratic party organizations, the democratic party members should hold appropriate proportions in the People's Congress.

(3) Regarding the leading positions of members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures in government and judicial organs at various levels. The "Opinion" believes that effective measures should be taken to select members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures to hold leading positions in the State Council and its relevant ministries and commissions, and in local governments and their relevant departments at the county level and above. It is necessary to recommend qualified members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures to hold leadership positions in prosecution and trial agencies. Hire a group of qualified members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures with specialized knowledge as special inspectors, prosecutors, auditors, and supervisory teachers, etc. The government's inspection, audit, industry and commerce and other departments' investigations into major cases, and tax and other inspections, can absorb members of democratic parties and non-partisan figures to participate.

(4) On the role of democratic parties in the CPPCC. The CPPCC should become an important venue for parties, people's organizations, and representatives from all walks of life to unite, cooperate, participate in politics, and discuss politics. The "Opinion" explicitly stipulates that at various CPPCC meetings, the freedom of CPPCC members to make criticisms and express different opinions must be effectively protected. Democratic party members and non-partisan figures should hold a certain proportion among the standing members and leading members of the CPPCC. There should be democratic party members and non-partisan figures participating in all special committees of the CPPCC. There should be a certain number of democratic party members and non-partisan figures serving as full-time leaders in the CPPCC organs, and they should truly have positions, rights, and responsibilities.

The purpose of the CPC Central Committee in formulating this "Opinion" is to further play the role of democratic parties in participating in politics and democratic supervision. In accordance with this requirement, the "Opinion" makes clear provisions on a series of issues concerning the participation in politics by democratic parties: First, it clearly sets out the purpose of the participation of the participating parties; Second, it clearly points out the difference between the multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the Communist Party of China and the multi-party system in the West; Third, it clearly defines the relationship between the Chinese Communist Party and the various democratic parties; Fourth, it further clarifies the basic policy of the Chinese Communist Party's cooperation with the democratic parties; Fifth, it points out the basic point of the democratic parties' participation in politics; Sixth, it lays down the general principles for the democratic parties to play their supervisory role; Seventh, it stipulates the activity guidelines of the democratic parties.



This "Opinion" is a summing up of both positive and negative experiences from the long-term revolutionary and construction practices of the multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the Communist Party of China (CPC). Practically, it marks the systematic and standardized development of the multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the CPC; theoretically, it has enriched and developed the Marxist theory of party relations by summarizing the practical experience of several decades of cooperation between the CPC and various democratic parties. The formulation and implementation of the "Opinion" is a significant step in advancing political system reform and strengthening the building of socialist democratic politics. It is of great and far-reaching significance for fully leveraging the advantages of the socialist system led by the CPC and developing socialist democratic politics. In December 2000, Jiang Zemin pointed out in his speech at the National United Front Work Conference that "the multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the Communist Party is a crystallization of the political experience and wisdom of the Chinese people. The distinguishing feature of our political system lies in the Communist Party's leadership, multi-party cooperation, the Communist Party's ruling, and multi-party participation in politics. The democratic parties are not opposition parties or opposition parties, but friendly and participating parties closely cooperating with the Communist Party. The Communist Party and various democratic parties conduct democratic consultation and scientific 
decision-making on major national issues, concentrating their efforts on major issues. The Communist Party and the various democratic parties supervise each other, promoting the improvement of the leadership of the Communist Party and the strengthening of the construction of participating parties. This avoids political turbulence caused by multi-party competition and mutual undermines, and also avoids various problems caused by one-party dictatorship and lack of supervision. The tremendous advantage of our party system lies here, and the fundamental difference between our system and the one-party and multi-party systems abroad also lies here." This speech profoundly summarizes the political advantages of this basic political system and enriches the theory of Marxist democracy construction in China.
3. Develop grassroots autonomy and expand grassroots democracy
Regarding the overall thinking of political system reform, there was a significant change around the time of the 14th Party Congress. Before the 14th Party Congress, the approach was mostly top-down, but after the Congress, following a path from simple to complex, a combination of bottom-up and top-down was adopted, with the focus on advancing the building of grassroots democratic political systems and establishing them as a socialist democratic system that must be adhered to and improved.
The main content of grassroots democratic political construction includes the following: first, strengthening rural villagers' autonomy and establishing and improving village committees; second, advancing and improving urban community residents' autonomy system construction; third, giving full play to the role of enterprise worker's congress, making the participation of workers in enterprise democratic management institutionalized. As for rural villagers' autonomy, after the constitution passed in 1982 established the legal status of village committees as grassroots mass autonomous organizations in rural areas, the "Organic Law of Villager Committees of the People's Republic of China (Provisional)" passed by the Sixth National People's Congress Standing Committee in November 1987 made clear regulations on the nature, functions, and related issues of village committees. In November 1994, the Central Committee of the CPC issued a notice, requiring localities to conscientiously implement this law while strengthening the construction of rural grassroots party organizations, improve village committees and village groups, perfect the village self-governance system, and better play the role of grassroots mass autonomous organizations in self-management, self-education and self-service. Regarding the construction of the urban community residents' autonomy system, after the resident committee system was written into the "Constitution of the People's Republic of China" in 1982, the National People's Congress Standing Committee formulated the "Urban Residents' Committee Organization Law" in 1989, providing legal protection for the development of urban resident committees. As for the workers' representative congress, as a basic system for enterprises to build grassroots democratic politics and implement democratic management, it increasingly emphasizes its irreplaceable role in implementing democratic management in enterprises, coordinating labor relations, protecting the legal rights and interests of workers, and promoting the reform, development, and stability of enterprises.



The Fifteenth National Congress of the Party fully affirmed the practice of expanding grassroots democracy and ensuring that the people directly exercise democratic rights, considering this the most extensive practice of socialist democracy. Additionally, it further demanded to perfect the democratic election system in urban and rural grassroots political power and grassroots mass self-governing organizations, carry out political affairs and financial disclosure, let the masses participate in discussing and deciding on grassroots public affairs and public welfare industries, and carry out democratic supervision of officials. The democratic management system of enterprises and institutions with the worker's congress as the basic form should also continue to be persisted in and perfected, organizing workers to participate in reform and management, and safeguarding workers' legal rights and interests. It firmly corrected suppression of democracy and forced commands. According to this requirement, in April 1998, the General Office of the CPC Central Committee and the General Office of the State Council issued a notice on the universal implementation of village-level public affairs and democratic management in rural areas, proposing more specific requirements for perfecting democratic elections, democratic decision-making, democratic management, and democratic supervision. In June of the same year, the Organisation Law of the Villagers' Committees of the People's Republic of China (Draft Revision) prepared by the State Council was deliberated and approved at the fifth meeting of the Standing Committee of the Ninth National People's Congress in November of the same year. Subsequently, the work of democratically electing members of the village committee was fully launched in rural areas across the country, and the village self-governance system was gradually perfected. By the end of 2004, 644 thousand Villagers' Committees had been established in rural areas across the country. A vast majority of provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the Central Government have generally completed five to six rounds of village committee elections.

In terms of the construction of urban grassroots democracy, in 1999, the Ministry of Civil Affairs carried out community construction pilots in 26 urban districts nationwide, strengthened the construction of residents' committees, and implemented democratic elections, democratic decision-making, democratic management, and democratic supervision. By the end of 2004, 71375 residents' committees had been established nationwide. As of September 2004, 595 thousand workers' congresses had been established in enterprises and institutions, covering 78.364 million workers, accounting for 58.5%.

With the deepening of the economic system reform, the central government places more emphasis on the positive role of the workers' congresses in state-owned enterprises in democratic management and democratic supervision. Jiang Zemin pointed out in October 1998: "Implementing democratic management by workers in state-owned enterprises, as well as implementing village self-governance in rural areas, are both important creations in our construction of socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics. In carrying out various tasks in enterprises, democratic management by the working masses can only be strengthened, not weakened. The greater the major issues related to enterprise reform, development and the vital interests of the masses, the more we must listen to the views of the majority of workers through the form of workers' congress, truly achieve collective decision-making and collective strength, jointly improve the management and efficiency of the enterprise." Many workers' congresses in enterprises have played a positive role in promoting the construction of grassroots democracy and the reform and development of enterprises.

II. Implementing the basic strategy of governing the country according to law

The development of socialist democracy must be closely tied to the improvement of the socialist legal system. This is an important task and necessary requirement for the development of socialist democratic politics. An important aspect of pushing forward political system reform is to continuously strengthen the construction of the socialist legal system. The 13th National Congress of the Party made new explorations in strengthening the socialist legal system construction when discussing political system reform, leading China's socialist democratic politics on a step-by-step path towards institutionalization and legalization. Under this ideological guidance, China's legal system and other institutional constructions have steadily progressed. In April 1990, the Central Committee pointed out in its notice on maintaining social stability and strengthening political and legal work: "Strengthening socialist democracy and the legal system is an important aspect of perfecting the socialist system, and also an important guarantee for maintaining social stability." In order to strengthen the leadership of political and legal work, Political and Legal Committees have been restored from the central to the local level.



In 1992, during the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, along with establishing the goal of reforming the socialist market economy system, new requirements were established for perfecting socialist legality. Jiang Zemin pointed out: "We must strengthen legislative work, especially developing and improving laws and regulations that guarantee reform and opening up, strengthening macroeconomic management, and regulating microeconomic behavior. This is an urgent requirement for establishing a socialist market economy system." After the 14th National Congress, during the practice of reforming to establish a socialist market economy system, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China emphasized repeatedly that the development and perfection of a socialist market economy system must be regulated and protected by comprehensive laws. We must learn to use legal means to manage the economy, and achieve unity between reform and opening up and the construction of the legal system. Therefore, the "Decision on Several Issues Concerning the Establishment of a Socialist Market Economy System" of 1993 clearly proposed the goals of legal construction, which is to adhere to the principles stipulated by the constitution, accelerate economic legislation, further improve civil and commercial law, criminal law, laws on state organizations, and administrative management, and initially establish a legal system suitable for a socialist market economy by the end of the 20th century.

Starting from December 1994, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China began to hold legal lectures at the Wren Hall in Zhongnanhai from time to time. The leading members of the Central Political Bureau, the Central Secretariat, and the State Council took the lead in studying legal knowledge, promoting the conscientiousness of studying and applying law, and strengthening legal awareness throughout the party and society. In February 1996, when the Central Committee held the third legal lecture, Jiang Zemin proposed the idea of "governing the country according to law." He said in his concluding remarks that strengthening socialist legality and governing the country according to law is an important component of Deng Xiaoping’s theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics, and it is an important policy for our party and government to manage state and social affairs. Implementing and adhering to the rule of law means gradually making each work of the state more lawful and standardized; it means that the broad masses of the people, under the guidance of the Communist Party, regulate, through various means and forms, the management of the state, the management of economic and cultural industries, and the management of social affairs, according to the provisions of the constitution and law, and gradually make socialist democracy institutionalized and lawful. Implementing and adhering to the rule of law is of great significance for promoting a sustained and healthy development in the economy and a comprehensive progress in society, and ensuring long-term national peace and stability. In March of the same year, the Fourth Session of the Eighth National People’s Congress adopted the "Nine-Five" Plan and the 2010 Long-Range Objectives Outline for National Economic and Social Development, which included "rule of law" as the goal and direction of political system reform.

In 1997, the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, when making strategic deployments for development across the century, raised "governing the country according to law" to a more prominent position as a strategy for ruling the country. The report of the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China pointed out that: the development of democracy must be closely combined with the improvement of the legal system, and government must be conducted according to law. Governing the country according to law and building a socialist country under the rule of law is a basic strategy for the party to lead the people in governing the country, an objective need for the development of a socialist market economy, an important symbol of advanced social civilization, and an important guarantee for a long lasting peaceful and stable country. In March 1999, the Amendments to the Constitution passed by the Second Session of the Ninth National People’s Congress added "rule of law, constructing a socialist country under the rule of law" and established it in the form of the fundamental law of the state.

Since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, huge achievements have been made in building the socialist legal system. As of the end of 2002, apart from revising the Constitution and four amendments to the Constitution, the National People's Congress and its Standing Committee have also enacted 297 laws and passed 125 decisions on legal issues. The State Council has made 933 administrative regulations. The socialist legal system of our country has initially formed. After the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, under the basic strategy of "governing the country according to law, and constructing a socialist country under the rule of law," legislative efforts are further strengthened, judicial system reform is advanced, striving to form a socialist legal system with Chinese characteristics by 2010.



III. Enrichment and Development of the Concept for the Construction of a Socialist Spiritual Civilization in Practice
While promoting reform and opening up, and focusing on economic development, the concept of building a socialist spiritual civilization has been gradually enriched. The "Resolution on the Guiding Principles for the Construction of Socialist Spiritual Civilization" in September 1986 played a significant role in the practice of constructing a spiritual civilization. At the beginning of 1992, Deng Xiaoping's Southern Tour Speech elevated the construction of a spiritual civilization to a new height, emphasizing the importance of grasping both hands, being hard in both hands, and building two civilizations that surpass capitalism. The Fourteenth National Congress of the Communist Party of China clearly pointed out that "both the material civilization and the spiritual civilization should be well-developed to be a socialism with Chinese characteristics", and listed the construction of a socialist spiritual civilization as the driving force for the development of socialism with Chinese characteristics along with the development of a socialist market economy and socialist democratic politics, emphasizing the importance of the construction of spiritual civilization. These discussions not only further clarified the important position of spiritual civilization construction in the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics, but also further clarified the basic principles of spiritual civilization construction. The principle of "emphasizing on the construction of spiritual civilization" is a scientific conclusion drawn from the lessons of history. It requires the resolution of ideological issues through discussion, argument, education, and guidance. Only by adhering to this "emphasis on construction" can we fully mobilize the enthusiasm and creativity of the masses in building socialism, and build a vibrant and thriving socialism with Chinese characteristics. This is a major advance in the guiding principles for the construction of socialist spiritual civilization.
Under the impetus of the Southern Tour Speech and the spirit of the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China has made new explorations and progress in the theory and practice of spiritual civilization construction in strengthening ideological and moral construction, and developing education, science, and cultural undertakings.
In terms of strengthening ideological and moral construction, the Fourteenth National Congress emphasized: Carry out education on the Party's basic line, patriotic education, collectivism, and socialist ideological education among all ethnic groups across the country, especially among young people, to establish correct ideals, beliefs, and values. After the conference, various forms of patriotic, collectivist, and socialist educational activities were widely carried out throughout the society. On August 23, 1994, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued the "Outline for the Implementation of Patriotic Education", which clearly stipulated and deployed the guiding principles, main content, and key points of work for carrying out patriotic education, and required relevant departments at all levels to regard patriotism as the foundation of the construction of socialist spiritual civilization. On August 30, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China also issued the "Several Opinions on Further Strengthening and Improving Moral Education in Schools", requiring the education front to understand the importance of moral education in schools in the new era from a historical height and strategic perspective.
