In accordance with the central requirements, Party committees at all levels have made plans and deployments to carry out patriotic education, and have made great efforts to build patriotic education bases and create a social atmosphere for patriotic education.
In terms of publicity and ideological work, Jiang Zemin stated in his speech at the National Conference on Publicity and Ideological Work in January 1994: Publicity and ideological work must arm people with scientific theories, guide people with correct public opinions, shape people with noble spirits, inspire people with excellent works, and constantly cultivate and create generation after generation of socialist new people with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline, playing a powerful ideological and public opinion support role in the great cause of building socialism with Chinese characteristics. This is not only the guiding principle of cultural propaganda in the new era, but also of great guiding significance for improving the effectiveness of various measures for the construction of spiritual civilization.
Regarding the development of education, the Fourteenth National Congress further emphasized: Education must be placed in a priority development strategic position, and the ideological, moral and scientific cultural level of the entire nation must be improved. This is the fundamental plan for realizing modernization in our country. Therefore, the Fourteenth National Congress solemnly announced that by the end of the 20th century, it would basically eliminate illiteracy among young and middle-aged people, and basically achieve nine-year compulsory education.



The China Youth Development Foundation launched the "Project Hope" in October 1989, which aimed to facilitate education for dropout youths and provide support to schooling in impoverished areas through societal fundraising. This project immediately garnered widespread societal backing. In May 1990, the country's first "Hope Primary School" was set up in Jinzhai County, Anhui Province. The initiation of "Project Hope" has constructed a bridge to education for impoverished youths, thus exerting considerable influence on the development of education.

In terms of cultural development, the emphasis was on promoting the main melody of the times. In 1991, the Central Propaganda Department, sponsored by the CPC Central Committee, organized and implemented the "Five-One Project" among their endeavors of spiritual civilization construction. This project was aimed at propagating the main melody of the times and excellent traditional culture. Provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, and central state organs, among others, participated in the project. Every year, they produced a good book, play, film, TV drama, and a sound theoretical article, with added good song, radio drama, and a good TV theoretical feature later on. Since the implementation of this project, excellent works that passionately praise the theme of reform and opening up, socialist modernization, and conscientiously answer significant theoretical and practical issues have continuously emerged in reality.

Gradually as measures for the construction of spiritual civilization fell into place, spiritual civilization and socio-economic development became increasingly intertwined. At the Fifth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party in September 1995 and in March 1996, the Fourth Session of the Eighth National People's Congress reviewed and approved the "Ninth Five-Year Plan" and the long-term objectives for 2010, integrating the construction of a spiritual civilization into socio-economic development planning.

In order to enhance the Party's guidance on the construction of spiritual civilization under the conditions of a socialist market economy, in October 1996, the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party passed the "Resolution on Several Important Issues Concerning the Construction of Socialist Spiritual Civilization" (or the "Resolution" for short). This is the second resolution adopted by the Central Committee within ten years specifically for the purpose of strengthening the construction of the socialist spiritual civilization. This resolution focuses on our grand objective of development into the next century and further clarifies the guiding ideology, overall requirements, and main objectives for the construction of socialist spiritual civilization in the next 15 years. The "Resolution" points out that the guiding ideology and overall requirements for the construction of spiritual civilization are: To guide the construction of Chinese socialism with the theories of Marxism-Leninism, Mao's Thought and Deng Xiaoping's Theory, to adhere to the Party's basic line and basic policy; to strengthen thought and moral construction and develop education, science and culture; to arm people with scientific theories, guide people with correct public opinions, mold people with noble spirit, inspire people with excellent works; to nurture socialist citizens with ideals, morals, culture, and discipline; to enhance the ideological, moral and scientific-cultural standards of the whole nation; to unite and mobilize people of all ethnic groups to build our country into a socialist modernization nation that is prosperous, democratic, and civilized.

Regarding the main objectives for 15 years of the socialist spiritual civilization construction from 1996 to 2010, the "Resolution" stipulates: To firmly establish the common ideal of socialism with Chinese characteristics among the entire nation, and to firmly establish the firm belief of adherence to the party's basic policy line without wavering; to significantly improve the civic quality with the major content of ideological, moral cultivation, and the level of scientific education, the outlook on democracy and the rule of law; to significantly improve the quality of cultural life with the main requirements of being positive, healthy, rich and diverse, and in service of the people; to significantly improve the degree of urban and rural civilization marked by social atmosphere, public order, living environment; to form a good situation of balanced development between material civilization construction and spiritual civilization construction nationwide.



The "Resolution" initially summarized the experience of spiritual civilization construction under the new situation of the socialist market economy, fully affirming that the development of the socialist market economy helps to enhance people's sense of independence, competitiveness, efficiency, democratic legal awareness and pioneering and innovative spirit. At the same time, it clearly points out that the weaknesses and negative aspects of the market itself will also be reflected in spiritual life. Strengthening the construction of spiritual civilization requires guiding people to correctly handle the relationship between competition and cooperation, autonomy and supervision, efficiency and fairness, the rich first and the rich later, economic benefits and social benefits, advocating putting the interests of the state and the people first while fully respecting the legitimate interests of individual citizens, and strictly preventing the principle of commodity exchange in economic activities from being introduced into the political life of the Party and the political activities of state organs. These experiences reflect the Party's new thinking on the issue of spiritual civilization construction under market economy conditions. The "Resolution" adopted at the Sixth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party marked a new level of understanding of the Party on the construction of spiritual civilization.

After the Sixth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party, all regions and departments have made increased investment in the construction of spiritual civilization and the launching of mass activities for the creation of spiritual civilization an important content in formulating development plans and long-term goals. In order to ensure the implementation of the "Resolution" from an organizational perspective, in May 1997, the CPC Central Committee decided to establish the Central Spiritual Civilization Construction Steering Committee as the central body for guiding the nationwide construction of spiritual civilization. Subsequently, provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the central government have successively established corresponding institutions to strengthen the construction of spiritual civilization. Mass activities, with the creation of civilized cities, towns, and industries as the main content, are booming across the country, presenting a lively scene of concerted efforts by all sides and active participation by the masses, creating a good atmosphere for reform and opening up and economic construction.

IV. Developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics
The development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics is an inherent requirement for comprehensively promoting the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and it is also the goal of the construction of socialist spiritual civilization. The central leadership collective, with Jiang Zemin at its core, has been striving to explore the correct path of developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.

In his speech celebrating the 40th anniversary of the founding of the PRC in 1989, Jiang Zemin pointed out: The construction of spiritual civilization, in the final analysis, is to improve the quality of the entire nation and cultivate the "four haves" modern man. "It is inconceivable that a nation without a strong spiritual pillar can stand on its own in the forest of nations in the world." He emphasized the need to actively absorb all the fine achievements in the historical culture of our country and foreign cultures, and to "oppose the national nihilism that denies traditional Chinese culture and the thinking that worships foreign things". In his speech celebrating the 70th anniversary of the Party's founding in 1991, Jiang Zemin expounded on the guiding ideology, basic elements, and development direction of socialist cultural construction when discussing "socialist culture with Chinese characteristics". He pointed out that we should "resist and eliminate all backward and decadent ideological and cultural influences, and continually create advanced and healthy new socialist culture". "Only by deeply rooted in China's land and relying on the power of the people, facing modernization, the world, and the future, can we create a socialist culture worthy of the great era." Here, the thought seed of developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics has been sprouted.

In 1997, the report of the fifteenth Party congress elaborated on the construction of the cultural program of socialism with Chinese characteristics, adding the requirement to develop a "nationally scientific mass socialist culture", emphasizing the need to "build a socialist spiritual civilization based on Chinese reality, inheriting historical cultural traditions, and absorbing beneficial results of foreign cultures". The new definition of "culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics" by the fifteenth Party congress highlights its "cultural" colors and is basically connected with the connotations of socialist spiritual civilization. Jiang Zemin pointed out: "The culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics, in terms of its main content, is consistent with the socialist spiritual civilization that we have consistently advocated since the reform and opening up. Culture, relative to the economy and politics...



"Spiritual civilization is in contrast to material civilization. Only with coordinated development of economy, politics and culture, and the careful development of both civilizations, can we have socialism with Chinese characteristics." Here, the different corresponding relationships of "civilization" and "culture" are clearly spelled out. Based on such understanding, in order to gradually perfect their respective corresponding relationships, from the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party onwards, this new expression of understanding became a sign of the transition from the theory of socialist spiritual civilization construction to the development of advanced socialist cultural thought with Chinese characteristics.

In February 2000, after Jiang Zemin delivered his "Three Represents" speech, the notion of developing an advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics became increasingly prominent. In the "Three Represents" theory, not only is the concept of "advanced culture" particularly noteworthy, but also it closely connects the development of an advanced culture with party construction. Jiang Zemin said, "Since our party represents the advance direction of advanced culture, all Party comrades must persist in taking Marxism as their guide, strive to inherit and develop all the fine cultural traditions of the Chinese nation, strive to learn and absorb the excellent cultural achievements of all foreign countries, thereby constantly creating and promoting socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, and striving for the coordinated development of socialist material civilization and spiritual civilization, and social progress." 

In his "July 1st" speech in 2001, Jiang Zemin reviewed, from a historical perspective, the Chinese Communist Party's role in representing the advance direction of advanced culture and promoting the historical process and great successes of socialist cultural construction, while also expounding, from a realistic perspective, the theory and practical principles of the Chinese Communist Party  continuing to represent the advanced direction of China's advanced culture. He pointed out, "Our party should always represent the advancement direction of Chinese advanced culture, which means that the party's theories, lines, programs, policies, and all work must strive to reflect the requirements of developing modern, world-facing, future-oriented, our nation's scientific and mass socialism culture; promote the continuous improvement of the ideological and moral quality and scientific cultural quality of the whole nation; and provide spiritual momentum and intellectual support for our country's economic development and social progress." 

He also said, "In contemporary China, developing advanced culture means developing the culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and building a socialist spiritual civilization." Thus, the relationships among the three concepts of "advanced culture," "culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics," and "socialist spiritual civilization" are clear, and their connotations are identical. The "July 1st" speech also discussed the dialectical relationship of comprehensively grasping the construction of the two civilizations, firmly grasping the development trend and requirements of China's advanced culture, the fundamental task of cultural development of socialism, and the relationship with inheriting and carrying forward all excellent cultures, fully reflecting the spirit of the times and creative spirit. From this, the main framework of developing the advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics was essentially built. By the report of the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party in 2002, its chapter structure further unfolded and expounded respectively from "economic construction and economic system reform," "political construction and political system reform," and "cultural construction and reform." In the "cultural construction and reform" section, it comprehensively discussed the content of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, and put forward the overall requirements for developing the advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics in the new century.

According to Jiang Zemin's above explanation, developing the advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics generally includes the following basic principles. 

The first is to insist on the guidance of Marxism. Jiang Zemin pointed out, "What cultural direction to adhere to and what kind of culture to promote is a banner of a political party in terms of thought and spirit." The insistence on the guidance position of Marxism, and not allowing diversification in guiding ideology, is the fundamental principle for building a socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.

The second is to commit to cultivating the "Four Haves" new people as the fundamental task for constructing the advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics. “The fundamental task of developing socialist culture is to cultivate generation after generation of citizens with ideals, morals, culture and discipline."



"This is a comprehensive requirement for the quality of all citizens. Whether it comes to building socialist spiritual civilization or developing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics, this task must be undertaken. It serves as the fundamental driving force for the advancement and development of the undertaking of socialism with Chinese characteristics.
Thirdly, it is to adhere to the "two services" orientation and the "double hundred" policy. Serving the people and serving socialism is the fundamental purpose of the development of socialist culture. Letting "a hundred flowers bloom" and "a hundred schools of thought contend" is the basic policy for constructing socialist culture. After the Third Plenum of the Eleventh Central Committee, both Deng Xiaoping and Jiang Zemin have repeatedly emphasized that the "double hundred" policy must not be altered or abandoned, and must be upheld forever. This policy reflects the characteristics and laws of cultural development and serves as the essential policy for promoting the prosperity and development of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics.
Fourthly, it is to adhere to the development direction of "facing modernization, facing the world, and facing the future". The "three facing" direction guarantees that the construction of socialist culture with Chinese characteristics has distinct characteristics of the times. To achieve the "three facings", we must also adhere to the principle of "using the past for the present, using foreign things for Chinese purposes". We should take the essence and remove the dross of traditional national culture, develop it in line with the characteristics of the times, and constantly innovate to make it shine brightly. We also need to actively absorb all the excellent cultural achievements created by mankind, and incorporate them into the culture of socialism with Chinese characteristics. Only by rooting deeply in the land of China, relying on the power of the people, facing modernization, the world, and the future, can we create a socialist culture worthy of the great era."
Fifthly, it is to adhere to the essence and characteristics of the socialist culture with Chinese characteristics that are "national, scientific, and popular". Its "nationality" lies in its origin in the 5000 years of Chinese civilization and its grounding in the practice of socialism with Chinese characteristics; it has national forms that the masses love to hear and see, and it has rich content that reflects the modern lifestyle, ways of thinking, moral sentiments, aesthetic tastes, and customs of the people. Its "scientific nature" lies in its advocacy of science, its opposition to superstition, and its resolute struggle against all feudal ignorance and pseudo-scientific decaying ideological culture. Its "popularity" lies in its origin in the people, its service to the people, its education of the people, and its enjoyment by the masses.
To sum up, building advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics means vigorously developing advanced culture, supporting healthy and beneficial culture, striving to transform backward culture, resolutely resisting decaying culture, constantly enriching people's spiritual world, constantly strengthening people's spiritual strength, and striving to form theories that reflect the requirements of China's advanced productive forces, directions for China's advanced culture, the fundamental interests of the majority of the Chinese people, and the guiding principles of public opinion, spiritual pillars, and cultural conditions.
While the theoretical understanding of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics is continuously enriched and perfected, the Party Central Committee has also emphasized several important aspects of the specific implementation of advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics and has increased its efforts to improve and reform its investment."



Firstly, promoting the healthy development of social cultural undertakings and the socialist market economy through strengthening the construction of ideological and moral character. Ideological and political work is an important political advantage of the Communist Party of China. Jiang Zemin pointed out that the more the economy develops, the more the reform and opening up, the more important it is to pay attention to ideological and political work. "Strengthening the construction of socialist ideology and morality is an important content and central link in the development of advanced culture." In September 2001, based on years of practical experience, the Party Central Committee issued the "Outline for the Implementation of Citizen Moral Construction". The "Outline for the Implementation of Citizen Moral Construction" proposes: to firmly establish the common ideals and correct world outlook, outlook on life, and values of building socialism with Chinese characteristics among the whole nation; to strongly advocate the basic moral norms of "patriotic observance of law, courtesy, integrity, unity and friendliness, diligence and self-improvement, dedication to duty" throughout the society; to establish a socialist ideological and moral system that is adapted to the socialist market economy, coordinated with socialist legal norms, and inherited from the traditional virtues of the Chinese nation.

Secondly, promoting and cultivating the great national spirit. The national spirit is a spiritual support for a nation's survival and development. A nation without an uplifting spirit and noble character cannot stand in the world of nations. Jiang Zemin pointed out that during the development of more than five thousand years, the Chinese nation has formed a great national spirit of solidarity, peace-loving, hardworking, brave, and self-improving, with patriotism at its core. This national spirit is vast, profound, long-standing, and an indispensable important component in the life of the Chinese nation. This national spirit, in combination with the good traditions and spirit of the times that our party has led the people to form in the long-term revolution, construction and reform, is the strong spiritual motivation for the Chinese nation’s continuous growth and development. 

Thirdly, promoting the development of cultural undertakings fundamentally through developing education and science. The hundred-year plan is based on education; the rise and fall of the nation's fortune is related to education. Education is the foundation for the development of science and technology and the cultivation of talents. It exerts a leading role in the process of modernization and must be placed in a strategic position for priority development. Deng Xiaoping pointed out: "We must try our best, be patient in other ways, and even sacrifice a bit of speed to solve the problem of education well." Jiang Zemin once emphasized that the strategic position of education for priority development must always be adhered to in the process of building socialism with Chinese characteristics and cannot be compromised. If we do not see the problem of education this way, we will lose the opportunity, delay major issues, and commit historical mistakes. Considering that philosophy and social sciences have not received the attention they deserve in society, Jiang Zemin pointed out that philosophy and social sciences are important tools for people to understand and transform the world, and they are important forces for promoting historical development and social progress. "In the process of understanding and transforming the world, philosophy and social sciences are as important as natural sciences; cultivating high-level scholars in philosophy and social sciences is as important as cultivating high-level scholars in natural sciences; improving the philosophical and social science literacy of the national population is as important as improving the national science literacy; employing and fully exerting the role of talents in philosophy and social sciences is as important as employing and fully exerting the role of talents in natural sciences." Some regions and departments' tendency to overlook philosophy and social sciences should be corrected.



Fourthly, vigorously promoting the reform of cultural system. Since the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee of the Party, the Party Central Committee has vigorously promoted the reform of the cultural management system in accordance with the features and rules of socialist spiritual civilization construction, to adapt to the requirements of the development of the socialist market economy. The national conference on propaganda and ideological work held in January 1994 further clarified the cultural construction guidelines of promoting the main melody and advocating diversification. All regions and departments have insisted on orientation, total volume, structure, and benefits in cultural construction, actively cultivating the socialist cultural market and developing it healthily. On this basis, the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th Party Central Committee held in 1996 made a detailed plan for the development of socialist cultural undertakings facing the new century. The plenary pointed out: the prosperity of literature and art, the primary task is to produce excellent works that combine thoughtfulness and artistry under the guidance of the correct guideline, which have strong attractiveness and influence; the news propaganda must adhere to the party principles, strive for truth from facts, focus on uniting and stabilizing spirits, mainly positive propaganda, and firmly grasp the correct public opinion orientation; Philosophy and social sciences must adhere to the guidance of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought and Deng Xiaoping's theory of constructing socialism with Chinese characteristics, adhere to the theory and practice in connection, serve the party and government decision-making, serve the construction of two civilizations; The cultural market should grasp prosperity and management, vigorously support healthy cultural products, advocate beneficial cultural and entertainment activities that are suitable for the consumption level of the masses, and promote the healthy development of the cultural market. To achieve the above goals, the reform of the cultural management system must be continued to quickly form a development pattern in which the state guarantees key points and encourages social cultural undertakings.

Under the above ideological guidance, the reform of the cultural management system and the mechanism of operation has gradually deepened. Regarding the ownership, it has changed the long-standing practice of the state managing cultural affairs, allowing the development of cultural industries in various forms of ownership. In terms of administrative management, it has established the cultural affairs management system of category guidance and level management, reformed the personnel system and distribution system inside cultural affairs units, changed the past notion of nurturing individuals to nurturing affairs, fully stimulating the vitality of cultural affairs units.

After the Sixth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party and the 15th National Congress of the Party, cultural construction, with the “Quality Strategy” at its core, has entered a new phase of prosperity and development under the push of strengthened management and deepened reform. All departments and regions, in addition to continuing to earnestly organise and implement the "Five-One Project" for spiritual civilisation construction, have also strengthened the management of spiritual product production and the cultural market. The state has successively formulated and improved regulations such as the Publishing Management Regulations, the Printing Industry Management Regulations, the Audiovisual Product Management Regulations, the Commercial Performance Management Regulations, and the Radio and Television Management Regulations, providing necessary legal and policy support for cultural quality products entering the market, ensuring that healthy cultural products firmly occupy a dominant position in the cultural market. By the end of 2000, the national population coverage rates of radio and television reached 92.1% and 93.4% respectively, an increase of 13.4% and 8.9% respectively over 1995. Excellent works that reflect the spirit of the times and are close to people's lives continue to emerge. Through the organisation of the "Five-One Project" award-winning works exhibitions, excellent works have fully played a demonstrative role. The cultural front of socialism has been further consolidated, forming a healthy and upward public opinion environment, a civilized and harmonious social atmosphere, and a rich and colorful cultural life.

After the Fourth Plenary Session of the Thirteenth Central Committee of the Party, a comparatively complete and systematic theory was constructed for constructing advanced socialist culture with Chinese characteristics. This is a new development of Marxist cultural construction thought under new historical conditions and a new achievement on the path of sinicization of Marxism.

Chapter Nine: The Reform and Opening-up's Cross Century Development Strategy and the Development of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics
After the 1990s, centering on Jiang Zemin, the Central Committee of the Party has made comprehensive arrangements and deployments on how China can cross the century, from the aspect of development strategy, diplomacy, national defense and reunification of the motherland in advancing the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics.




These issues fully reflect the theoretical development and practical innovation of Marxism conducted by the third generation of central leadership in combination with the world situation and national conditions faced by China.
I. Formulation of Strategies for Reform and Opening-up and Modernization Construction for Cross-century Development
Entering the 1990s, with the early realization of the strategic goals of the "first step" and the "second step" of China's social development, the third generation of the Party's leadership, with Jiang Zemin at its core, made new plans for the realization of the "third step" strategic goals, and successively put forward a series of strategic deployments such as "Rejuvenating the country through science and education", "Sustainable development", and "Combining bringing in and going global", further enriching and developing China's unique modernization development strategy.
1. Strategy for Revitalizing the Country through Science and Education and Sustainable Development
Both strategies for revitalizing the country through science and education and for sustainable development are major strategic decisions put forward by the Party Central Committee according to Deng Xiaoping's theory and the Party's basic line, with a scientific analysis of the trends in world economy and social development and aiming at achieving the grand goal of the "three-step strategy".
From the late 1970s to the early 1990s, Deng Xiaoping repeatedly emphasized: "To realize the four modernizations, science and technology are key, and the foundation is education", "In the long run, we must pay attention to education and science and technology", "Science and technology is the primary productive force", etc.
In the 1990s, the central leadership with Jiang Zemin at its core further clarified the strategic thought of revitalizing the country through science and education on the basis of inheriting Deng Xiaoping's theory, and listed it as a basic national policy. At the 14th National Congress of the Party in 1992, Jiang Zemin pointed out: "We must shift the economic construction to the track of relying on scientific and technological progress and improving the quality of labor." The decision issued on May 6, 1995 by the Central Committee of the CPC and the State Council on accelerating scientific and technological progress for the first time proposed the strategy of rejuvenating the country through science and education nationwide. Jiang Zemin pointed out: "Rejuvenating the country through science and education refers to fully implementing the idea that science and technology is the primary productive force, adhering to education as the basis, placing science and technology and education in an important position in economic and social development, strengthening the country's scientific and technological strength and the ability to transform productive forces, and improving the scientific and technological cultural quality of the entire nation." The same year, the Fifth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee included the implementation of the strategy of rejuvenating the country through science and education as one of the important guidelines for accelerating the construction of socialist modernization in our country for the next 15 years until the 21st century in the recommendations on the "Ninth Five-Year" Plan and the long-term goals for 2010 for national economic and social development. In 1996, the Fourth Session of the Eighth National People's Congress formally adopted the "Ninth Five-Year" Plan and the long-term goals for 2010 for national economic and social development, and "Rejuvenating the country through science and education" as a result became a basic national policy.
Revitalizing the country through science and education not only promotes rapid economic construction, it also promotes harmonious economic and social development. Realizing both speed and harmony demands fully considering the sustainability of development, so that the scale and speed of development are suitable for the basic national conditions and in line with the objective laws of economic and social development. For this reason, after China's economic construction experienced rapid development in the 1980s, the Party Central Committee began to pay more attention to the issue of sustainable development in our country, and put forward the strategy of sustainable development on the basis of summarizing China's historical experience, learning from the lessons of industrialized countries in the world, and keeping in mind the laws of economic development. 
In October 1993, based on Deng Xiaoping's idea about coordinated development of population, environment and resources and China's actual conditions, the Party Central Committee and the State Council proposed the idea of implementing the strategy of sustainable development in China. In 1994, the Chinese government drew up and approved the "Agenda 21 for China—White Paper on Population, Environment and Development in China in the 21st Century", establishing the overall strategic framework and main goals for sustainable development in China in the 21st century. In March 1996, the Session of the Eighth National People's Congress approved the outline of the "Ninth Five-Year" Plan and the long-term goals for 2010 for national economic and social development, making sustainable development an important guiding principle and strategic goal, and made a major decision to implement the strategy of sustainable development in China's economic and social development in the future.



The 15th National Congress of the Party reaffirmed this strategic decision, emphasizing: Our country has a large population and relatively scarce resources, so in the process of modernization, we must implement a sustainable development strategy. The sustainable development strategy is a major breakthrough over traditional development concepts. It thoroughly elucidates the significant issues regarding China's future development from a new perspective, proposing a basic approach to a series of issues such as how a country like China, which is economically and culturally lagging, and where the development level of productive forces is extremely unbalanced, can build socialism, promote economic growth, and comprehensive social development. It points out the correct direction of development for the construction of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

2. Western Development Strategy

The implementation of the Western Development Strategy and the acceleration of the development of the central and western regions are major decisions made by the Party Central Committee with Jiang Zemin at its core in the late 20th century, based on Deng Xiaoping's strategic thinking about the "two major situations" of China's modernization construction, looking forward to the overall situation and facing the 21st century.

In 1988, after the comprehensive implementation of reform, opening up, and modernization, Deng Xiaoping proposed the strategic idea of "two major situations." He said: "The coastal area needs to accelerate opening up to the outside world, so that this vast area with 200 million people can develop faster, thereby promoting better development in the inland. This is an issue of great concern. The inland needs to consider this overall situation. Conversely, when development has reached a certain point, the coast will be required to put forth more effort to help inland development, which is also a major situation. At that time, the coast also needs to comply with this overall situation." He predicted that by the end of the 20th century when the whole country reaches a well-off level, more strength needs to be put into helping the central and western regions to develop faster. In 1995, with the early completion of the second-step development goals of our country's modernization strategy, the Party Central Committee began to consider Deng Xiaoping's second major situation in their planning, making it a key guideline to gradually narrow regional development gaps and promote regional economic coordination in drafting the "Ninth Five-Year" plan and 2010 strategic objectives. The 15th National Congress of the Party also explicitly stated in 1997: We must promote the reasonable distribution and coordinated development of regional economies, and gradually reduce the regional economic development gap. The Central Committee, in accordance with the general principle of "overall planning, adapting to local circumstances, playing to advantages, division of labor and cooperation, and coordinated development", has made a new comprehensive deployment for the healthy development of China's regional economy. On June 17, 1999, Jiang Zemin held a symposium on reform and development in the five northwestern provinces in Xi'an, proposing that the Western Development Strategy should be implemented opportunistically to accelerate the development of the central and western regions. He pointed out: Accelerating the development of the western region is a strategic development of the overall situation, which not only has significant economic significance, but also has significant political and social significance. The conditions for accelerating the development of the central and western regions are basically in place, and the timing is mature. From now on, this needs to be regarded as a major strategic task of the party and the state, and placed in a more prominent position.

After a series of preparations, in October 2000, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee officially proposed the Western Development Strategy in the "Proposals on Formulating the Tenth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development". It pointed out: The implementation of the Western Development Strategy, accelerating the development of the central and western regions, is related to economic development, ethnic unity, social stability, regional coordinated development and ultimately achieving common prosperity. It is a major measure to achieve the third-step strategic goals. Since then, the Western Development Strategy has been rapidly implemented and has achieved significant results.



3. The "Bring In" and "Go Out" Combined Strategy
Following the new trend of world economic globalization and the developmental process of our country's reform and opening up, the Central Party Committee, at the turn of the century, proposed and implemented a combined "bring in" and "go out" strategy to further develop an all-round, multi-level, and extensive field of development. 
In February 1998, Jiang Zemin expounded on the policy to cope with the Asian financial crisis in the Second Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee. He proposed that while actively expanding exports, leaders should step by step organize and support a group of powerful and advantageous state-owned enterprises to invest and set up factories abroad - both "bring in" and "go out". These are two interlinked and mutually promotional aspects of opening up to foreign involvement and are both indispensable. In October 2000, the 5th Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee officially proposed to grasp opportunities, meet challenges, seek gains and avoid losses, promote all-round, multi-level and extensive fields of opening up. Develop an open economy, implement a "go out" strategy, strive to make new breakthroughs in using domestic and foreign resources and the two markets. 
In March 2001, the fourth session of the Ninth National People's Congress adopted the Outline of the Tenth Five-Year Plan for Economic and Social Development. It further proposed the implementation of the "go out" strategy of opening up. By the end of 2001, China had participated in 195 overseas resource cooperation projects, with a total investment of 4.6 billion US dollars; a total of 6610 various overseas enterprises had been established, with a total investment of 12.3 billion US dollars, of which Chinese investment was 8.4 billion US dollars; total foreign contractual engineering contracts signed was 99.7 billion US dollars, completed turnover was 71.5 billion US dollars, and exports were nearly 6 billion US dollars promoted; total foreign labor contracts signed were 26.8 billion US dollars, completed turnover was 20.7 billion US dollars, and foreign labor dispatched was 2.52 million people. 
The open strategy of combining "bring in" and "go out" has effectively promoted the development of the open economy, making the pattern of opening up in all directions, multi-levels, and wide fields clearer. China's economy has further integrated into the process of economic globalization, gaining a broader development space. This is another far-sighted decision made by the Central Party Committee on the development road across the century.
The proposal and implementation of the above development strategy reflects the objective process and rules of China's modernization construction, which not only has Chinese characteristics but also embodies the glorious tradition of Chinese Communists being good at combining Marxist basic principles with Chinese reality.
Second, the Deepening of State-owned Enterprise Reform
State-owned enterprises are the mainstay of China's national economy and have made significant contributions to the country's construction and development over the long term. However, due to the long-term operation under the planned economic system, the country's control over enterprises is excessive, the operating mechanism is rigid, and the role of the market is neglected, which makes the task of reform most arduous.
1. Achieving the three-year detargetation goal and establishment of the modern enterprise system



After the reform goal of establishing a socialist market economic system was established, from 1994, the reform of state-owned enterprises began to enter the stage of transforming the operating mechanism and establishing a modern enterprise system. With the transformation of the system and the drastic changes in the market environment, many contradictions and problems accumulated under the planned system of state-owned enterprises have also been exposed, mainly manifested as inactive mechanisms, and a considerable number of enterprises are not adapted to the requirements of the market economy. Therefore, in the fierce market competition, they fell into an unprecedented predicament. In the first quarter of 1996, after offsetting the profits and losses of the 68,800 independent accounting state-owned industrial enterprises nationwide, the first net loss since the founding of New China appeared.

In response to this situation, the Party Central Committee believes that the only way for state-owned enterprises to get out of the predicament is to adapt to the needs of the development of the socialist market economy, continue to accelerate and deepen reforms, and establish a modern enterprise system. For this reason, the Fifteenth National Congress of the Communist Party further clarified the direction of the reform of state-owned enterprises, and put forward the goal of striving to establish a modern enterprise system in most of the large and medium-sized backbone state-owned enterprises by the end of the 20th century, significantly improving their operating status, and creating new objectives for the reform and development of state-owned enterprises, thus pushing the reform of state-owned enterprises into a crucial stage.

The business difficulties of state-owned enterprises are not only due to inactive mechanisms, but also due to the unreasonable layout and structure of the state-owned economy, which is too long, too scattered, too small in scale, and low in quality. This is an important reason for high investment, low output, high consumption, and low benefits. If this layout and structure do not change, it will be difficult to advance the reform of individual enterprises. Therefore, the Fifteenth National Communist Party Congress also proposed: Adjust the layout of the state-owned economy from a strategic perspective. The state-owned economy must dominate important industries and key fields related to the lifeblood of the national economy; in other fields, it can be done through asset restructuring and structural adjustment to strengthen the emphasis and improve the overall quality of state-owned assets. The reform of state-owned enterprises should be combined with reorganization, transformation, and strengthened management, with a focus on the whole state-owned economy, managing the big ones, letting the small ones go, and implementing strategic reorganization of state-owned enterprises.

The First Plenary Session of the Fifteenth Central Committee clearly stated: It will take about three years to get out of the predicament of most large and medium-sized loss-making state-owned enterprises through reform, reorganization, transformation and strengthening management, and strive to establish a modern enterprise system in most large and medium-sized backbone state-owned enterprises by the end of the 20th century.

After the Fifteenth Party Congress, the comprehensive launch of the reform offensive focusing on establishing a modern enterprise system began. The pilot project of establishing a modern enterprise system that began in 1994 expanded significantly from 1997. The number of pilot cities for “optimizing capital structure” increased from 18 to 111, and the number of pilot projects for establishing corporate groups expanded from 56 to 120. Through these pilots, strategic reorganizations have been implemented for all state-owned enterprises in accordance with the requirements of developing a socialist market economy, establishing a new management system.

Large enterprise groups such as China National Petroleum Corporation, China Petrochemical Corporation, Shanghai Baosteel Group Corporation, the top ten groups of the defense industry, the top three groups of non-ferrous metals, and the top four groups of the information industry have been established one after another. These large enterprise groups operate according to market requirements, no longer undertake administrative functions, are authorized by the government to operate state-owned assets, and have enhanced their ability for self-development and participation in international competition.

The pilot cities of "optimizing capital structure" have begun to form a competitive mechanism of the survival of the fittest through encouraging mergers, standardizing bankruptcy, laying off and diverting employees, and reducing staff to increase efficiency.



For state-owned small enterprises, multiple avenues such as reorganization, association, merger, leasing, contracting, shareholding system, and sales were adopted to liberate and invigorate them. Regulations were also set on some key points in the sales process of small businesses. The defining trait of modern enterprise system is the corporation, and the typical forms of a corporation are a joint-stock company and a limited liability company. They are characterized by the amalgamation of small capital into a corporate entity through a shareholding mechanism to meet the demand for large-scale production in a socialized society, maximizing the added value of capital. This is a typical form of business organization in modern economic society. China's shareholding system reform began gradually in the mid to late 1980s, and by the early 1990s, a large number of pilot enterprises for the shareholding system had emerged across the country.

On December 19, 1990, and July 3, 1991, approved by the State Council, the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the Shenzhen Stock Exchange successively opened. After 1992, inspired by the essence of Deng Xiaoping's talks in the south, shareholding reform entered a new stage. In March of the same year, relevant departments of the State Council jointly formulated 11 regulations including the "Pilot Methods for Shareholding System Enterprises", further standardizing and promoting shareholding reform.

After 1998, in line with the requirements of establishing a modern enterprise system, a large number of state-owned enterprises carried out corporate and shareholding system reform. Many large enterprises and corporate groups, following international customs, successfully listed on domestic or overseas capital markets after asset restructuring. This not only raised a large amount of social capital, improved asset structure and operating conditions, but also played a crucial role in establishing a modern enterprise system, promoting a diverse financing system, expanding national fiscal revenue channels, and improving economic performance.

By the end of 2000, the listed companies in Shanghai and Shenzhen had reached 1088, with 1257 listed securities. The number of investors in the stock market reached 58.01 million. The total market value of stocks reached 4.8091 trillion yuan, accounting for more than 50% of GDP. In just a decade, China's shareholding economy had gone through the path that Western developed countries had taken more than a century, and played a significant role in the national economy.

To turn around the losses of state-owned enterprises, textile industry, the most severely loss-making industry, was selected as the breakthrough point. The restructuring was based on "slowing down, reducing staff, and improving efficiency", restructuring assets and adjusting production structures according to market demands, and changing operational mechanisms. In 1998, 5.12 million outdated cotton spinning frames were eliminated, and 660,000 laid-off workers were reallocated, resulting in a loss reduction of 2.6 billion yuan, which was an important step towards reversing losses in the whole industry within three years.

To ensure that state-owned enterprises achieve the goal of escaping difficulties through three years of reform, the Central Party Committee and the State Council also decided to establish the system of special inspectors of the State Council. The special inspectors of state-owned enterprises were staffed by officials at the deputy ministerial level or above. The national plan was to gradually dispatch special inspectors to 1,000 large enterprises and enterprise groups. The main task of the inspector is to audit, inspect the profits and losses and liabilities of the enterprise, assess the financial status and the work performance of key leadership members, and report to the State Council after auditing by relevant departments. Local governments dispatched supervisors to state-owned enterprises, state-owned sole proprietorships, and state-controlled companies that they were responsible for supervising.



On April 28, 1998, the first group of 21 special inspectors and more than 80 special inspector assistants began training. In order to ensure that the special envoys perform their duties effectively, the State Council formulated and promulgated the "Special Inspector Regulations". The special inspectors represent the state in exercising supervisory power, separating government and businesses, allowing state-owned enterprises to operate independently, and also strengthening government supervision of businesses. Through financial supervision and examination of business results, evaluations were made of corporate leaders' adherence to Party policies, national laws and regulations, and business performance. Based on the results of the inspections, the State Council, through the personnel department, awarded or punished major corporate leaders. The implementation of this system had a strong impetus for the construction of the leadership team of state-owned enterprises and the implementation of various reform measures.

2. Implementing the Reemployment Project for Laid-off Workers in State-owned Enterprises

Securing the basic livelihoods and reemployment of laid-off workers in state-owned enterprises is a crucial part of the success of the reform of state-owned enterprises. "The essence of ruling is to settle the people; the way to settle people is to address their suffering." The Party Central Committee paid close attention to the temporary difficulties faced by some laid-off workers. Jiang Zemin repeatedly stressed that the vast number of workers in state-owned enterprises have made significant contributions to the country's economic construction, reform and opening up, and the development and growth of state-owned enterprises over the past few decades. It's necessary to always care about them and effectively protect their interests.

From May 14 to 17, 1998, the Party Central Committee and the State Council held a meeting in Beijing on livelihood protection and reemployment for laid-off workers, formulating measures for streamlining redundant personnel and implementing reemployment projects. Jiang Zemin pointed out at the meeting that this work is not only a major economic issue, but also a major political issue; it is not only an immediate pressing issue, but also a long-term strategic issue. All levels of the party committee and the government must regard it as a top priority. The meeting stated that the basic living expenses of laid-off workers must be guaranteed. The funds are jointly borne by the government, enterprises, and society, and basic living expenses must be delivered to each laid-off worker on time, without delay, misappropriation, or deduction, otherwise, responsibility will be pursued. The most important thing is to help laid-off workers achieve reemployment. This work is related to the success or failure of the reform of state-owned enterprises, the vital interests of workers, an insurmountable stage in the reform process, and a major and important task.

In June, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council issued a "Notice on Effectively Doing a Good Job in the Basic Life Protection and Reemployment of Laid-off Workers in State-owned Enterprises", pointing out that in the future, to ensure the realization of the reform goals of state-owned enterprises proposed by the Fifteenth National Congress of the Party, and to complete the strategic adjustment of the state-owned economy, it is necessary to take solving the basic life protection and reemployment problems of laid-off workers in state-owned enterprises as the primary task, and strive to achieve a greater number of reemployments each year than the number of newly laid-off workers. By 1998, more than 50% of laid-off workers and new laid-off workers were reemployed. Strive to initially establish a social security system and employment mechanism that meets the requirements of the socialist market economic system in about five years.




Central leaders have also made multiple in-depth visits to the grassroots level to investigate and study the employment and life issues of laid-off workers, and to visit the masses who are living in hardship. According to the central government's deployment, localities have successively established three "safety lines" for laid-off workers: first, the basic living allowance for laid-off workers; second, those who have not found employment after three years can shift to unemployment insurance; and third, those who still have not found employment after two years of unemployment insurance can receive the minimum living guarantee for urban residents according to regulations. At the same time, governments at all levels have expanded employment channels and established re-employment service centers through strengthened vocational training in various forms, guiding workers to change their job selection concepts, and vigorously promoting the re-employment of laid-off workers. From 1998 to 2000, a total of 21 million laid-off workers from state-owned enterprises nationwide entered the re-employment service centers, among which 13 million people were re-employed, providing a strong guarantee for the smooth progress of state-owned enterprise reform.

3. Strengthening the Party's Leadership over Large State-owned Enterprises

In order to strengthen the leadership of large and medium-sized state-owned enterprises, with the approval of the CPC Central Committee, the Central Large Enterprises Work Committee was established on July 9, 1998, with Wu Bangguo, a member of the Politburo of the Chinese Communist Party and Vice Premier of the State Council, serving as the secretary. Its responsibilities include: managing the party leadership positions in large state-owned enterprises and state-holding companies supervised by the State Council, in order to promote the implementation of the party's line, principles, policies, and the related spirit of the Party Central Committee and the State Council in large state-owned enterprises; researching and exploring ways to reform and strengthen the construction of leading groups of party leadership in large state-owned enterprises according to the requirements of the socialist market economy system and the establishment of modern enterprise systems; and completing other tasks assigned by the Central Committee. The State Council also stipulates that government agencies are strictly prohibited from providing guarantees for corporate economic activities. The implementation of these supporting measures has accelerated the pace of state-owned enterprise reform.

During this period, the Party Central Committee strengthened research on state-owned enterprises, with central leaders making multiple in-depth front-line guidance for reforms. From April to August 1999, Jiang Zemin successively visited Chengdu, Wuhan, Xi'an, Qingdao, Dalian and other places, presiding over a series of symposiums and expressing important opinions on the reform and development of state-owned enterprises. He pointed out that fully promoting the reform and development of state-owned enterprises is a barrier that cannot be bypassed. Defeating this difficult problem is not only related to the success or failure of the state-owned enterprise reform, but also to the success or failure of the overall economic system reform. We must seize the opportunity, make up our minds, make great efforts, solve the deep-seated contradictions and problems faced by state-owned enterprises, and further enhance the vitality of state-owned enterprises. The state should develop a group of large enterprises and enterprise groups in important industries and key areas that are related to the national economy's lifeline, making them the main force of the national economy. Small and medium state-owned enterprises should adopt various forms, be liberalized for invigoration, encourage them to adopt more flexible management methods, and accelerate their development. The modern enterprise system is the basic system of enterprises under the conditions of a socialist market economy. Without the establishment of effective mechanisms in management and market operations in enterprises, it is impossible to establish a socialist market economic system in the end, and the organic integration of public ownership and the market economy can hardly be realized. In the reform of state-owned enterprises, we must pay attention to strengthening party leadership. These important speeches further clarified the direction for tackling hardships in the reform of state-owned enterprises.

In September 1999, the Fourth Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee of the Party further discussed the reform and development of state-owned enterprises and passed the "Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Several Major Issues Concerning the Reform and Development of State-owned Enterprises" (referred to as the "Decision"), setting the goal for the reform and development of state-owned enterprises by 2010.



"The Decision" points out: The reform of state-owned enterprises is a broad and profound change. In order to enhance the economic strength, defense capability and national cohesion of the state, it is necessary to continuously promote the development of state-owned economy and overall enhance the vitality of state-owned enterprises and the control of state-owned economy. This is of great significance for establishing a socialist market economic system, promoting sustained and rapid economic health, improving people's living standards, maintaining a stable and united political situation, and consolidating the socialist system. Advancing the reform and development of state-owned enterprises, first of all, we must make the utmost effort to achieve the goals set out in the 15th National Congress and the first plenary session of the 15th Central Committee. By 2010, we should adapt to fundamental changes in the economic system and economic growth model and expand the requirements for opening up. We must basically complete the strategic adjustment and reorganization of state-owned enterprises, forming a relatively rational layout and structure of the state-owned economy, establishing a relatively perfect modern enterprise system, significantly improving economic efficiency, and significantly strengthening the ability of scientific and technological development, market competition, and risk resistance, so that the state-owned economy plays a better leading role in the national economy. "The Decision" also puts forward a series of major policy measures, mainly including: strategically adjusting the layout of the state-owned economy, combining the optimization and upgrading of industry structure and ownership adjustment, insisting on progress and retreat, and having something to do and not to do; distinguishing different situations, continuing to carry out strategic reorganization of state-owned enterprises; focusing on separating the government from enterprises, exploring effective forms of state-owned asset management, carrying out standardized corporate reforms, transforming operating mechanisms, etc., establishing and perfecting the modern enterprise system; gradually solving the problems of high debt ratio in state-owned enterprises, insufficient capital, heavy social burdens, etc. We should do a good job in reducing staff and increasing efficiency, reemployment and social security work; accelerating technological progress and industrial upgrading; strengthening the Party's leadership over the reform and development work of state-owned enterprises; and so on.
The above goals and policy measures make the overall thinking of the reform of state-owned enterprises clearer and the policy is more explicit. It is not only guiding for the goal of completing the reform and getting out of trouble in three years, but also for the development of state-owned enterprises crossing the century.
Under the guidance of the spirit of the Fourth Plenary Session of the 15th Central Committee, state-owned enterprises continue to push forward deep-level reforms from multiple levels. From 1998 to 2000, more than 2,700 modern enterprise system pilot enterprises determined by the central government and selected from various regions, most of them have carried out corporate and shareholding reforms; among the 520 state-owned and state-controlled enterprises on the national key enterprises list, 430 have carried out corporate reforms, accounting for 83.7%. The state-owned and state-controlled industries realized a substantial increase in profits. By the end of 2000, more than 70% of the 6,599 state-owned and state-controlled large and medium-sized enterprises that had lost money in 1997 had decreased; the state-owned and state-controlled industries realized profits of 239.2 billion yuan, which was 1.97 times that of 80.6 billion yuan in 1997; state-owned small enterprises also realized profits of 4.81 billion yuan, ending the continuous net loss for six years. Many state-owned enterprises that have been in trouble for a long time have walked out of the low ebb, and their operating conditions have significantly improved, creating a new situation for the reform and development of state-owned enterprises, and basically achieving the three-year goal of the reform and relief of state-owned large and medium-sized enterprises set by the 15th National Congress. These are the results of the correct decisions taken by the Party Central Committee at a critical stage of reform and development, and the tremendous contributions made by the Chinese working class and the Party in the same heart and morality for the country's economic construction and reform.
Third, persist in "one country, two systems" and carry forward the cause of reunifying the motherland 
Insisting on the "one country, two systems" policy and advancing the unification of the motherland has been opened in the 1980s and has achieved good results. In the 1990s, this cause continued to achieve major progress.
1. The proposal of Eight Points on developing cross-Strait relations 
After the 1980s, with the proposal of the "one country, two systems" policy by the Chinese Communist Party and the historic major changes in the mainland, the Kuomintang authorities in Taiwan were forced to adjust their mainland policy. In 1987, Chiang Ching-Kuo announced the lifting of martial law in Taiwan from July 15 and later opened up for Taiwanese compatriots to visit their relatives on the mainland. Since then, the long-standing separation between the cross-Strait compatriots has finally been broken.



Large numbers of Taiwan compatriots have come to the mainland of the motherland for family visits, tourism, and business, and relations between the two sides of the strait in terms of economics and trade have expanded rapidly. 
The Communist Party of China attaches great importance to this new change in relations across the Taiwan Strait and actively promotes further development of cross-strait relations. In December 1990, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China held a national conference on Taiwan work, stating that the urgent task for Taiwan work was to strengthen ties across the strait, further expand personnel and various exchanges, especially to strengthen economic and trade exchanges, and to achieve "three direct links" in both directions. On March 5, 1994, the sixth meeting of the Standing Committee of the Eighth National People's Congress passed the "Law of the People's Republic of China on the Protection of Investments by Taiwan Compatriots", which incorporated the protection of Taiwan business investments into the legal track, further promoting the development of cross-strait economic relations. In April 1994, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council specifically held a conference on Taiwan economic work, summed up the successful experience of cross-strait economic relations development, proposed the principle of "equal priority, appropriate relaxation" in fields and projects of Taiwan business investment. It called for high emphasis on Taiwan economic work by all regions and departments, adopted practical measures to protect the legitimate rights and interests of Taiwan businesses in the motherland, and improved the investment environment for Taiwan businesses in the motherland. 

To promote substantive progress in cross-strait relations and establish channels of communication across the strait, the mainland established the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits on December 16, 1991. This is a civil association aimed at promoting exchanges across the strait, developing cross-strait relations, and realizing the peaceful reunification of the motherland. In March 1992, the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits began business discussions with the Taiwan Strait Exchange Foundation on the Taiwan side. To clarify adherence to the principle of one China, Tang Shubei, the executive vice president of the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits, further elaborated on the attitude towards the principle of one China in cross-strait business talks after the first working talk in March 1992. On this, the Taiwan side had to express the stance of "adherence to the principle of one China" and recognize the fact that Taiwan is part of Chinese territory. After several consultations, both sides reached the "1992 Consensus" that "both sides of the strait insist on the principle of one China" by expressing it verbally.

On August 4, 1992, Wang Daohan, the president of the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits, wrote to Koo Chen-fu, the chairman of the Taiwan Strait Exchange Foundation, hoping to hold talks on the economic development of the two sides of the strait and affairs of the two associations. On the 22nd, the Taiwan Strait Exchange Foundation replied that it accepted the invitation. After several preparatory consultations, Wang Daohan, the president of the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits, and Koo Chen-fu, the chairman of the Taiwan Strait Exchange Foundation, held their first talk in Singapore from April 27 to 28, 1993. Although this talk was of a civil, economic, business, and functional nature, its content was broad, its significance great, and it caught the attention of people both at home and abroad. The two sides reached the "Wang-Koo Talks Joint Agreement", the "Agreement on Contacts and Talks between the Two Associations", etc. Thereafter, to implement various agreements reached in the "Wang-Koo Talks", from August 1993 to January 1995, the two associations held six deputy-secretary-level working talks in Beijing, Taipei, and Nanjing. Tang Shubei, the executive vice president of the Association for Relations Across the Taiwan Straits, also went to Taiwan to discuss with Jiao Renhe, vice chairman and secretary-general of the Taiwan Strait Exchange Foundation, and reached specific consensus on three items: handling disputes over fishing matters in the waters between the two sides of the strait, negotiating the repatriation of hijackers between the two sides, and the repatriation and related issues of persons who violate relevant regulations by entering the territory of the other side. Both sides believe that strengthening multi-level communication between the two associations is conducive to further enhancing understanding, eliminating misunderstandings, reducing differences, and building mutual trust.



To more clearly explain the policy of the Chinese government on the Taiwan issue both domestically and overseas, Jiang Zemin, representing the Communist Party of China and the Chinese government, delivered an important speech entitled "Continuing the Struggle for the Completion of the Great Cause of the Motherland's Reunification" on January 30, 1995. He put forward eight propositions for promoting cross-strait relations and the peaceful reunification of the motherland at the current stage: (1) Adhering to the one-China principle is the foundation and prerequisite for achieving peaceful reunification; (2) Peaceful reunification negotiations across the strait can be conducted in stages; (3) Strive to achieve peaceful reunification, but do not promise to refrain from using force; (4) Facing the 21st century, vigorously develop cross-strait economic exchanges and cooperation; (5) Compatriots on both sides of the strait should jointly inherit and carry forward the excellent traditions of Chinese culture; (6) Further pinning hope on Taiwan compatriots; (7) Welcome parties and people from all walks of life in Taiwan to exchange views on cross-strait relations and peaceful reunification with us; (8) Leaders of both sides visit each other in appropriate capacities.
Jiang Zemin's eight propositions further advanced the nine principles proposed by Ye Jianying in 1981, making Deng Xiaoping's concept of "peaceful reunification, one country, two systems" more concrete in terms of premise, principle, method, and steps. These eight propositions not only reflect the consistency and continuity of the Communist Party of China and the Chinese government towards Taiwan policy, but also reflect their determination and sincerity to develop cross-strait relations and achieve peaceful reunification of the motherland. They are the programmatic documents for resolving the Taiwan issue in the new era, with strong practical significance and profound historical significance.
2. Successfully Resolving the Issue of Hong Kong and Macao's Return to the Motherland
Just as cross-strait relations were developing smoothly, Hong Kong and Macao's return was counting down. The reason why relations between Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao, and the Mainland can continue to develop is multifaceted, but the most fundamental one must be attributed to the "one country, two systems" policy. Although the concept of "one country, two systems" was initially proposed mainly to resolve the Taiwan issue, it was first successfully applied to resolve the issues of Hong Kong and Macao.
The Hong Kong issue is a historical legacy of British colonialists' aggression against China. The Hong Kong area includes Hong Kong Island, Kowloon, and the New Territories, which have been Chinese territory since ancient times. After the Opium War in 1840, Britain forced the Qing government to sign the unequal treaties of the Treaty of Nanking, Treaty of Beijing, and Convention for the Extension of Hong Kong Territory, and took over Hong Kong, Kowloon, and the New Territories, resulting in Hong Kong falling under British colonial rule. All Chinese governments after the 1911 Revolution did not recognize these unequal treaties, and they negotiated with Britain many times to recover Hong Kong. On the eve of the founding of New China, due to the special domestic and international environment, the Chinese Communist Party and Mao Zedong decided "not to touch Hong Kong for the time being". After the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949, the Chinese government adopted the policy of "taking a long-term view and making full use of" Hong Kong, did not recognize these unequal treaties imposed by imperialism on China, but decided to temporarily maintain the status quo due to historical reasons, and to solve the issue peacefully through negotiations when the time is right. 
Once the reform and opening up a new era began, with the end of Hong Kong’s “lease” period afoot, the Communist Party of China began to consider using the “one country, two systems” policy to reclaim the sovereignty of Hong Kong. The two sides of China and the UK have started since October 1982, after three stages of tough negotiations for 22 rounds, the heads of state of the two countries eventually officially signed the "Sino-British Joint Declaration on the Question of Hong Kong" on December 19, 1984. The declaration announced that the Chinese government decided to resume the exercise of sovereignty over Hong Kong on July 1, 1997, and the British government would return Hong Kong to China on the same day. According to the provisions of the Joint Declaration, the transfer of power from the UK to China took place in Hong Kong from midnight on June 30, 1997, to the early morning of July 1st. The smooth return of Hong Kong is the result of the successful practice of the "one country, two systems" concept. It symbolizes that the Chinese people have wiped out the national humiliation of Hong Kong being occupied for a century, and Hong Kong's development has entered a new era.



After the process of Hong Kong's return, the issue of Macau's return was also put on the agenda. 
In 1974, the Portuguese government announced that it would abandon all overseas colonies and recognize that Macau was not a colony, but Chinese territory. In February 1979, China and Portugal established diplomatic relations, and both sides reached an understanding on the issue of Macau. The Portuguese government recognized that Macau was Chinese territory, and both sides agreed to resolve this issue through negotiations between the two governments at an appropriate time. In June 1986, the two governments began to negotiate on the issue of Macau, and on April 13, 1987, the prime ministers of both governments formally signed the Joint Declaration of the Government of the People's Republic of China and the Government of the Portuguese Republic on the Question of Macau in Beijing. It was announced that the Macau region was Chinese territory and that the Government of the People's Republic of China would resume exercising sovereignty over Macau on December 20, 1999. From midnight on December 19, 1999, to the early morning of December 20, a solemn handover ceremony was held in Macau by the government delegations of both countries with the participation of the highest leaders of the state. President Jiang Zemin solemnly declared: The Chinese government resumes exercising sovereignty over Macau.

The successful return of Hong Kong and Macau has ushered in a new era of joint development between the two regions and the mainland.
