The democracy of democratic centralism refers to the full expression of party members' and party organizations' will and aspirations and the full demonstration of their initiative and creativity; the centralization of democratic centralism represents the aggregation of the party's collective will and wisdom and consistent action.

According to the tasks and requirements proposed by the Fourth Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee of the Party, the Party Central Committee, facing the problem of lack of democracy and centralization within the party, has adopted a series of measures to vigorously strengthen and improve the democratic centralism of the Party.



On the one hand, the party adheres to the goal of realizing the party's program, with the starting point of guiding, protecting, and stimulating positivity. It actively clears and widens the democratic channels within the party, allowing party members to have a better understanding and participation in party affairs. The central committee of the party to each branch, from decision-making in leadership organs to discussions on policy issues at party meetings and on party publications, from internal elections to evaluations and supervision of leadership cadres, all need to fully develop democracy. To protect the democratic rights of the party members, in December 1994, the Central Party Committee formulated and issued the "Regulations on the Protection of the Rights of the Communist Party of China (Trial)", which clearly stipulates the principles for correctly exercising the rights of party members and the measures to guarantee them.

On the other hand, focusing on the overall situation of the party's work, re-affirming the party constitution regulations, emphasizing "four obediences" to ensure the smooth flow of central orders, it is essential to maintain consistency with the central on the party's basic route, overall guideline, overall policy, overall goal, and major issues related to the overall situation. To strengthen and improve the party's leadership, the central also proposed to further improve the deliberation and decision-making mechanism within the party committee according to the principle of "collective leadership, democratic centralism, individual brewing, and meeting decisions". They aim to establish and perfect the decision-making mechanism that combines leadership, experts, and the masses, gradually improve the democratic scientific decision-making system, adhere to and improve the system that combines collective leadership with individual division of labor; formulate regulations for the work of central and local party committees, further clarify and standardize the scope of responsibility, meeting rules, decision-making procedures of the party committee and its standing committee; perfect the party congress system, further play the role of all meetings of the party's central and various levels of local committees; improve the organizational life meeting system, the system of democratic life meetings of party member leaders, perfect various norms of inner-party political life; improve the inner-party supervision, seriously deal with party discipline, formulate inner-party supervision regulations, perfect the inner-party supervision system, and combine the inner-party supervision with mass supervision, public opinion supervision, the supervision of democratic parties and non-party personages, combine top-down and bottom-up supervision, gradually form a strong supervision system; according to the principle of controlling the overall situation, coordinating all parties, further strengthen and perfect the party's leadership system, both to ensure the core leadership role of the party committee, and to fully play the role of the NPC, government, CPPCC, as well as people's groups and other sectors.

The implementation of these principles enables the democratic centralism construction of the party to move gradually towards institutionalization and standardization.
5. Carry out "three talks" education to explore new ways of strengthening party building.

On the journey to the new century, facing the new situation and new tasks of deepening reform and opening up, the party central committee with Jiang Zemin as the core, based on a thorough summary of the party's historical experience, created a new form of party spirit and style education centered on "three talks" (talking about learning, politics, and integrity) and achieved remarkable results.
In 1995, Jiang Zemin pointed out repeatedly the need to educate cadres to talk about learning, politics, and integrity in response to issues faced by some cadres who didn't pay attention to learning and self-improvement under the new situation of developing a market economy, and lost their way in the increasingly complex struggle, embarking on the path of corruption and degeneration. This requirement immediately attracted the high attention of party committees at all levels, and "three talks" gradually became an important content of education for party member cadres. In 1998, the Central Organization Department, in conjunction with relevant departments, after repeated studies and consultations, formulated the implementation plan for "three talks" education.
On November 21 of the same year, the Central Committee issued the "Opinions on Carrying out Party Spirit and Style Education Among Party and Government Leadership Teams and Leaders at Contents of 'Talking about Learning, Politics, and Integrity" at County Level and Above", making comprehensive arrangements for carrying out "three talks" education. Since then, "three talks" education began to be carried out in phases and batches.
This "three talks" education was carried out from top to bottom. The central directly-controlled organs, central state organs, and provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities directly under the central government, and their directly-controlled organs were the first to pilot, and then it was carried out at the county level.




On December 5, 1998, the central government specifically convened a national television and telephone conference, where Hu Jintao delivered a mobilization speech on the "three-stress" education. Since then, the central government has first piloted the initiative in Shandong, Guangxi, and Inner Mongolia, as well as the Ministry of Land and Resources, the Ministry of Education, the State Administration of Radio, Film, and Television, and the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League. The implementation of the “three-stress” in the pilot units was undertaken in four steps: ideological mobilization, learning and improvement, self-analysis, feedback collection, idea exchange, criticism, and self-criticism, targeted rectifications, and result consolidation.

On March 19, 1999, in order to summarize and exchange the situation and experience of the "three-stress" education pilot, and to study and deploy the next-step work, the central government held the first national "three-stress" education work meeting. The meeting heard the experience presentations of the pilot units and made arrangements for the first phase of the "three-stress" education work, deciding to carry out the "three-stress" in two batches at the provincial and ministerial level units. The first batch included 16 provinces, regions, and cities like Beijing and Hubei and 70 central and national ministries and bureaus including the Supreme People's Procuratorate; the second batch included 12 provinces, cities, and regions like Zhejiang and Ningxia, and 6 finance ministries and bureaus.

The Politburo members of the Central Committee attached great importance to the "three-stress" education and also specifically made time for "three-stress" study at the end of 1999, seriously reviewing and summarizing the work and basic experience over the ten years since the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee, and profoundly reflecting on some major strategic issues in the future reform and development.

After the first "three-stress" education work conference, the central government also held the second and third national "three-stress" education work conferences in June 1999 and January 2000, respectively, to deploy the "three-stress" work at all stages. According to these deployments, the central government sent several inspection teams to the provinces, autonomous regions, municipalities, and central and national ministries to understand the situation and strengthen guidance and inspection supervision. After the concentrated "three-stress" education, various regions and units carried out the "look-back" activities according to the central requirements, to consolidate and expand the results of the "three-stress" education.

According to the central deployment, the "three-stress" education has also been carried out at the county (city) level. To successfully carry out this education, the members of the Politburo Standing Committee visited seven counties (cities) to conduct in-depth investigations, research, and specific guidance. On February 20, 2000, Jiang Zemin personally attended the "three-stress" education conference for leaders in Gaozhou City, Guangdong Province, and delivered a mobilization speech. These measures demonstrated the Party Central Committee's high attention to the "three-stress" education and greatly promoted the "three-stress" education at the county (city) level. By the end of September 2000, the "three-stress" education of party and government leadership teams and leading cadres at and above the county level was basically completed and began to summarize and improve and entered a thorough rectification stage.

From 1998 to the end of 2000, a total of 700,000 leading cadres of the party participated in the "three-stress" education. Party cadre and the masses showed a high participation enthusiasm towards this education activity, with more than 5 million people directly listening to mobilization reports, participating in democratic evaluations, and assisting in corrections.



The majority of cadres have undergone a profound education in Marxism and endured a rigorous democaratic training within the party, leading to noticeable improvements in adhering to mass line and the party's democratic centralism. Practice has shown that the "Three Emphasizes" education is a creative exploration and successful practice in strengthening party building under the new circumstances, and in particular, the ideological and political building of leading cadres and teams, and it is an enrichment and amplification of Yanan Rectification spirit and the party's "Three Greate Styles" in the new historical period.

II. Train and select leading cadres of both moral integrity and professional competence, and build a team of high-quality cadres 

After the political route is determined, cadres become the decisive factor. Training and selecting leading cadres of both moral integrity and professional competence, is the fundamental strategy for the long term stability of the party and the state. The work of building a high-quality cadre team started in the 1980s and accelerated in the 1990s. 

In 1991, the CPC Central Committee specifically decided to cultivate and educate young cadre. Clear requirements were made to strengthen the strict requirements and management of young cadres, strengthen ideological and theoretical education, and they were encouraged to gain experience through exchanges and rotations. In October 1992, the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party clearly proposed the cadre team's "Four-Transformations" guidelines and to cultivate and select successors of socialist cause in accordance with the principle of both moral integrity and professional competence. At the Fourth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth CPC Central Committee in September 1994, the training and selection of leading cadres of both moral integrity and professional competence were put forth as two major strategic tasks. At the same time, four requirements for cadre system reform were also proposed: First, to enlarge democracy in the selection and appointment of leading cadres. Regardless of whether they are elected, appointed or hired, they need to follow the mass line, and let the masses participate more through democratic recommendation, democratic testing or democratic review. Second, improve the performance appraisal system for leading cadres, and link it with promotion and reward and punishment system. Third, earnestly implement the rotation system for leading cadres, and combine it with the avoidance system and the term system of leading teams at all levels. Fourth, strengthen supervision and inspection of the selection and appointment of leading cadres to forcefully prevent and correct malpractice in cadre employment. The principles proposed by the Fourteenth National Congress and the four reform requirements proposed by the Fourth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee are guiding opinions put forward for the training and selection of leading cadres from the height of the 1990s. These principles and requirements have clear direction, fully reflect the characteristics of democracy and openness, are easy to operate, and have strong guiding function.

To implement the spirit of the Fourteenth National Congress and the Fourth Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee, the National Organization Work Conference was held in Beijing from November 30 to December 3, 1994. The conference focused on studying and deploying the work of training and selecting leading cadres of both moral integrity and professional competence, and strengthening the building of leading teams at all levels. On November 30, Hu Jintao made a report titled "Focus on training and selecting leading cadres of both moral integrity and professional competence, and build leading teams at all levels capable of upholding the Party's basic line" at the meeting, proposing to make improving the quality of the Party and government leading cadres at the county level or above a focus of future cadre work. On December 2, Jiang Zemin spoke at the meeting, emphasizing that the cadre team must focus on accomplishing two strategic tasks in the current and future periods: first, to fully improve the quality of existing leading cadres and build up the leading teams at all levels above the county level; second, to focus on training and selecting excellent young cadres and strive to create a large number of leading talents who can take on heavy responsibilities crossing centuries. Jiang Zemin and Hu Jintao's speeches further clarified the key tasks of the training and selection of leading cadres with both moral integrity and professional competence.



In order to truly focus and implement the work of training and selecting leading cadres, in January 1995, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued the "Notice of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Urgently Training and Selecting Outstanding Young Cadres." This notice required organizations at all levels to improve and strengthen the work for reserve cadres, ensuring there were adequate substitutes for leadership positions at all levels. The notice also called to intensify training and comprehensively improve the quality of young cadres. It stressed that the training and selection of young cadres must aim for the healthy growth of a generation. In accordance with the above requirements, party committees at the central and local levels have strengthened cadre training and education efforts.

Simultaneously improving the process of cadre training and education, the rational selection of cadres was also put on the agenda. In January 1995, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued a notice on the issue of training and selecting outstanding young cadres, clearly stating the goals, principles, and requirements for selecting young cadres. In February 1995, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China issued the "Interim Regulation on the Selection and Appointment of Party and Government Leading Cadres," which made clear regulations in the form of regulations on the principles, conditions, procedures, and methods for selecting and appointing cadres. 

On June 21, 1996, Jiang Zemin delivered an important speech entitled "Strive to Build a High-quality Cadre Team" at a symposium to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the Communist Party of China. This further proposed to improve the political and professional quality of party cadres according to five standards: Firstly, they should have far-reaching communist ideals, adhere to the correct political direction, firmly walk the path of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and firmly implement the party's basic theory, basic line and various policies and policies. Secondly, they should work hard to practice the party's purpose of serving the people wholeheartedly, maintain close contact with the masses, especially the workers and peasants, and resolutely safeguard the interests of the people. Thirdly, free their minds, seek truth from facts, start from reality in everything, be good at forging ahead, and have the method of dialectical materialism and work style. Fourthly, they should be models of compliance with the law and maintaining integrity, promote the spirit of hard work, consciously resist corruption and oppose negative corruption. Fifthly, they should study diligently and work industriously, continuously strengthen knowledge accumulation and experience accumulation, and have the professional knowledge and ability to do their jobs well.

After 1996, the selection and appointment of cadres gradually moved towards institutionalization and standardization under the joint efforts of the Party Central Committee and party committees at all levels. In August 2000, the Central Government issued the "Outline for Deepening the Reform of the Cadre Personnel System", which made clear regulations on the basic goals, guidelines and principles of reform, the reform of the party and government cadre system, and the reform of the personnel system of state-owned enterprises. In July 2002, based on the achievements of cadre personnel system reform since 1995, and in accordance with the requirements of the new century, new stage, and new tasks, the Central Government revised and improved the "Interim Regulation on the Selection and Appointment of Party and Government Leading Cadres," and promulgated the "Regulation on the Selection and Appointment of Party and Government Leading Cadres". This regulation made more scientific, standardized and strict provisions for the basic principles, basic procedures, basic methods of cadre selection and appointment, and the expansion of democracy and strengthening of supervision etc. This provides basic rules and guarantees for preventing and controlling malpractices in personnel, promoting the scientific, democratic, and institutionalized cadre work from the source. In 2004, the central government further intensified the reform of the cadre personnel system, and the Central Government successively promulgated five documents including the "Interim Regulations on the Open Selection of Party and Government Leading Cadres" and the "Interim Regulations on Competing for Posts in Party and Government Organs". Together with the "Notice on Cleaning up the Concurrent Positions of Party and Government Leading Cadres in Enterprises" issued jointly by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Central Organization Department with the approval of the Central Government at the beginning of 2004, they are collectively referred to as the "5+1" documents. These documents and the "Civil Servant Law of the People's Republic of China" issued in 2005 make systematic and clear regulations on the selection and appointment of leading cadres. The promulgation of these policies and regulations has further improved the system for selecting and appointing leading cadres, and has gradually put the work of selecting and appointing leading cadres on the track of institutionalization and standardization, which has powerfully assured the rise of outstanding talents and timely cooperation and rotation of old and new leading cadres at all levels.



III. Strengthening party style construction and conducting long-term anti-corruption efforts

How can a political party maintain a healthy body is a historical subject that Marxists of all ages have been striving for. After history entered the 1990s, with the development and change of social conditions, the Communist Party of China gradually put forward and formed a set of systems and thought in the practice of anti-corruption and advocacy of integrity. These systems and thought are more reflected in the original development and creation of Chinese communists in the process of sinicization of Marxism.

As China entered a new stage of reform and opening-up, our country is transitioning from a planned economic system to a socialist market economic system. Because the shortcomings of the old system were not completely eliminated, the legal system was not yet perfect, there were certain weak points in supervision and management. Coupled with certain places and departments ignoring ideological and political work, some party and government organs and law enforcement departments were corrupted and trending to spread and develop.

Facing the severe situation of anti-corruption struggle, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council actively took targeted measures. As early as the beginning of the reform and opening up, the party began to pay attention to the problem of opposing unhealthy trends. In 1987, the 13th National Congress of the Communist Party officially proposed the policy of "strictly governing the party". After the 13th National Congress, various measures for integrity construction were introduced one after another. From August 20 to 25, 1993, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection held its second plenary session in Beijing. Jiang Zemin proposed three aspects to strengthen anti-corruption work: First, party and government leaders at all levels should lead by example in integrity. Second, focus on investigating a number of major cases, with priority given to cases involving party and government leading organs and judicial departments, administrative law enforcement departments, economic management department staff. Third, focus on the prominent issues of the local area, department, or unit, and curb the unhealthy trends that the masses are most dissatisfied with. These three requirements pointed the investigation of major cases directly at the "three organs and one department" - Party and government leadership organs, leaders, judicial organs, administrative law enforcement organs, economic management departments and their staff. According to the spirit of Jiang Zemin's speech and the needs of the anti-corruption struggle situation, the plenum made five regulations on the issue of corruption among county (department) level and above leaders: First, they are not allowed to do business or run companies, engage in paid intermediary activities, or use their power to provide any favorable conditions for their spouses, children, and kin to do business or run companies. Second, they are not allowed to hold concurrent positions in various economic entities (including honorary positions), and those who are approved individually are not allowed to receive any remuneration; they are not allowed to reimburse personal expenses at their subordinate units and other enterprise and institution units. Third, they are not allowed to buy and sell stocks. Fourth, they are not allowed to accept gifts and various securities in official activities; they are not allowed to accept credit cards given by their subordinate units and other units, nor are they allowed to use credit cards handled with public funds for personal use. Fifth, they are not allowed to acquire membership in any form of clubs with public funds, nor are they allowed to participate in high consumption entertainment activities with public funds.

On October 5, 1993, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council made a decision on several matters to be focused on in the near term in the fight against corruption, reiterating the three tasks of fighting corruption put forward at the second plenum of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the "five regulations" for leaders.



In February 1994, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China (CCDI) convened its third plenary meeting in Beijing. Based on the "five regulations" proposed at the second plenary session, the following requirements were reiterated: First, it is forbidden to violate regulations to buy and replace imported luxury cars. It is forbidden to use one's power to exchange vehicles, borrow vehicles, and apportion funds for vehicles from enterprises and subordinate units. It is forbidden to use loans, fund-raising, and special funds to purchase cars for use by leading cadres. County (city) party and government leading organs and units are not allowed to purchase cars if they owe wages to their employees. Second, it is forbidden to violate the State Council's regulations on housing system reform to purchase housing at a discount; it is forbidden to misuse one's power to provide preferential conditions for oneself and one's children and friends to buy houses; it is forbidden to use public funds for overstandard decoration of personal houses. Third, leading cadres must be frugal in their domestic official activities, and accommodation and meals should not exceed local reception standards. It is forbidden to hold special dances for leading cadres. Fourth, it is forbidden to hold lavish and wasteful events for personal and family weddings, funerals, job transfers, birthdays, and house moving, especially using public funds and items, or taking advantage of these events to make illicit money. Fifth, it is forbidden to use one's power to withhold public funds; it is forbidden to borrow public funds to buy houses, set up private houses, and engage in profitable activities for oneself and one's relatives and friends. In May, the CCDI formulated the implementation opinions on the "new five regulations" of integrity and self-discipline for leading cadres. 

To further implement the above-mentioned work arrangements of the Party Central Committee and the State Council on the fight against corruption, in June 1994, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China decided to organize 20 investigation groups, which conducted supervisory inspections on the situation of anti-corruption work in 24 ministries of the central state organs and 24 provinces, autonomous regions, and municipalities directly under the central government in late June and early July. Based on the investigations and studies, in January 1995, the Fifth Plenary Session of the CCDI made four supplementary regulations on the integrity and self-discipline of leading cadres: First, it is forbidden to keep for oneself discounts, intermediary fees, and gift money received in business and management activities; it is forbidden to violate regulations to receive wages and bonuses for part-time jobs. Second, individuals are not allowed to run businesses or enterprises privately; it is forbidden to use one's power to provide various convenience conditions for one's relatives and friends to run businesses and enterprises. Third, it is forbidden to violate regulations to occupy more housing; it is forbidden to use public funds to buy and build over-standard residences. Fourth, it is forbidden to buy cars during the period of non-policy losses in enterprises, arrears of wages of employees and teachers; it is forbidden to buy imported luxury cars such as Mercedes, Lincoln, Cadillac, and Duke. The provisions on integrity and self-discipline for leading cadres in public institutions shall be implemented with reference to the provisions on integrity and self-discipline for leading cadres of state-owned enterprises. In April, the CCDI formulated the implementation and handling opinions on the "supplementary regulations" related to the integrity and self-discipline of leading cadres. The regulations stipulate: It is forbidden to violate the rules to build private houses; it is forbidden to violate the rules to participate in collective housing construction; it is forbidden to violate the rules to use military and police license plates and foreign license plates; it is not allowed to use public funds and unit vehicles to learn driving technology without approval; it is forbidden to participate in commercial karaoke halls, dance halls, nightclubs and other entertainment activities paid by public funds; in contacts with units and individuals in the same country, it is forbidden to accept banquets that may affect the fair execution of official duties.

The aforementioned regulations and opinions have put forward clear requirements for the self-discipline of leading cadres and enabled the anti-corruption work to have rules to follow. Based on this, in January 1996, the Sixth Plenary Session of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection further clarified that in order to deepen the construction of party conduct, clean government and the fight against corruption, the work format of self-discipline of leading cadres, investigation and punishment of violations of laws and disciplines, and rectification of improper conduct in departments and industries shall be followed. The conference also specially required that the leading cadres at the provincial and ministerial levels abide by the various regulations of integrity and self-discipline, abide by party discipline and national law. What they ask their subordinates to do, they must do first; what they prohibit others from doing, they must firmly refrain from doing.



The conference proposed the implementation of a responsibility system for the fight against corruption, holding leaders accountable for serious corruption issues in their regions, departments, and among family and friends. 
In order to ensure that all regulations regarding the integrity and self-discipline of relevant leaders are effectively implemented, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection has taken a series of specific measures: First, it has dispatched ministerial cadres to localities and departments for inspections, responsible for understanding the implementation of the party's line, principles, and policies, as well as the integrity situation of the provincial and ministerial leadership teams and their members, and reporting directly to the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and timely reports to the party central committee; Second, it stipulates that the disciplinary committees (disciplinary inspection groups) of the party's local and departmental organizations have the right to conduct preliminary verification and directly report to the superior Discipline Inspection Commission when they find that the party committee (party group) of the same level or its members violate the party's discipline, no organization or individual should interfere or obstruct; Third, it requires the disciplinary committees (disciplinary inspection groups) of the party's local and departmental organizations, when receiving reports and accusations against members of the party committee (party group) of the same level, must report to the party committee (party group) of the same level and the disciplinary inspection committee of the higher level, no one has the right to withhold the report.
While continuously perfecting the above rules and regulations, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council further improved relevant organizations and systems. Among them, in terms of system building, after the sixteen party congress, with Hu Jintao as the general secretary of the party central committee, great emphasis was put on the building and innovation of the anti-corruption system, making an effort to prevent and solve corruption from the source. The third plenum of the 16th Central Committee first proposed to establish a complete system of education, supervision, and punishment for the prevention of corruption that is compatible with the socialist market economy. Subsequently, the four plenary sessions of the 16th Central Committee proposed a 16-character guideline for party conduct, integrity construction, and the fight against corruption in the new situation, namely, "treating both symptoms and root causes, comprehensive management, punishment and prevention, with emphasis on prevention", and required the urgent establishment of a system of education, institutional mechanism, and supervision against corruption. In December 2004, the Central Politburo reviewed and approved the "Outline for the Implementation of a Comprehensive System of Education, Institutional Mechanisms, and Supervision Against Corruption" (referred to as the Outline), clearly stating the guiding ideology, main objectives, and working principles for the establishment of a system against corruption. The main goal of establishing a full system against corruption, as proposed in the Outline, is to establish a basic framework for the punishment and prevention of corruption by 2010; after a period of efforts, to establish a long-term mechanism for moral education, a systemic mechanism against corruption, a mechanism for the monitoring of power, and a complete system for the punishment and prevention of corruption. The working principles are: (1) Persist in and improve the socialist market economy, develop socialist democratic politics, build an advanced socialist culture, and construct a harmonious socialist society; (2) Persist in attaching equal importance to education, institutional mechanisms, and supervision; (3) Persist in the unity of scientific, systematic, and feasible; (4) Persist in the combination of inheritance and innovation. The "Outline" is the guiding document for carrying out the construction of party conduct, integrity, and anti-corruption work at present and for a period in the future. In January 2005, the CPC Central Committee distributed the "Outline" nationwide, urging all levels of party committees and governments to implement all the work of anti-corruption effectively.
During the process of promoting the construction of the integrity system, the Party and the State have successively introduced a series of regulations, continuously enriching and perfecting the content of the integrity system. In December 2003, the CPC Central Committee promulgated the "Regulations on Inner-party Supervision of the Communist Party of China (Trial)", which for the first time comprehensively regulated the main focus, methods, and measures of inner-party supervision through party regulations, clearly stating that the main targets of inner-party supervision are the leading organs at all levels, the leading cadres, especially the main leaders of the leadership teams at all levels . In December 2003, the CPC Central Committee promulgated the revised "Disciplinary Measures of the Communist Party of China", which made comprehensive and specific clear provisions for the handling of various disciplinary violations by party members under the new situation.



In line with the goal of establishing a power operation mechanism that is reasonably structured, scientifically configured, strictly procedural, and effectively constrained, the Communist Party of China integrates the strengthening of institutional constraints on power with effective supervision of cadres. In September 2004, the Central Committee issued the "Regulations on the Protection of Rights of Members of the Communist Party of China". The Central Office has also successively issued laws and regulations such as the "Supervisory and Inspection Measures for the Selection and Employment of Leading Cadres of the Party and Government (Trial)" and the "Interim Provisions for the Open Selection of Leading Cadres of the Party and Government". In July 2005, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection discussed and adopted the "Regulations on Assisting Party Committees in Coordinating Anti-Corruption Work by the Disciplinary Committee (Trial)". In April 2007, the State Council announced the "Regulations on Civil Servant Punishment in Administrative Organs". In addition, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, in conjunction with relevant departments, has successively formulated a series of supporting regulations such as the "Interim Provisions on Inspection Work of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China and the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China", and the "Opinions on the Performance of Supervisory Duties by Discipline Inspection Groups Dispatched by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of the Communist Party of China". The issuance of these laws and regulations has initially formed a system of internal supervision laws and regulations of the Party, with the Party Constitution at the core, supervision regulations as the mainstay, and a series of supporting regulations as important supplements.

Establishing and perfecting the system of combating and preventing corruption is a major decision made by the Party Central Committee based on summarizing historical experience and scientifically judging the situation. It is a further deepening of the Party's understanding of the law of governance and the law of anti-corruption and integrity work. The establishment and gradual improvement of this system has mutually promoted the Advanced Nature Education activities among Communist Party members, effectively strengthened the Party's governance capacity and advanced nature construction, and enhanced the Party's ability to resist corruption and resist risks under the conditions of developing a socialist market economy.

Fourth, the Formation and Establishment of the Guiding Status of the "Three Represents" Important Thought

Since the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Party Congress, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin at the core, has held high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, grasped the characteristics of the times accurately, scientifically judged the historical position of our Party, focused on building socialism with Chinese characteristics, with wisdom of the whole Party, proposed the important thought of the "Three Represents" with tremendous courage for theoretical innovation in Marxism. After the proposal of the "Three Represents" important thought, it became the guiding thought of the Party at the 16th Party Congress in 2002 after further enrichment and development.

1. The Formation of the "Three Represents" Important Thought

Through continuously summarizing the historical experience of the Party and the practical experience since the Fourth Plenary Session of the 13th Party Congress, the Party Central Committee, with Jiang Zemin at its core, has gained a deeper understanding of what socialism is, how to build socialism, and how to build a Party like this and how to build the Party. This laid the foundation for the clear proposal of the "Three Represents" important thought. Based on this, on February 20, 2000, at the "Three Talks" education conference for leading cadres in Guangdong, Jiang Zemin proposed the "Five Always" requirement. After participating in the Gaozhou's "Three Talks" meeting, from February 21 to 25, Jiang Zemin went to Shenzhen, Shunde and Guangzhou for field studies. On the 24th, he held a symposium on Party building in Guangzhou, where he further clearly proposed the "Three Represents" thought. At the meeting, Jiang Zemin said: "Summarizing our Party's more than 70 years of history, we can draw an important conclusion, that is, our Party has won the support of the people because, in the various historical periods of revolution, construction, and reform, it always represents the needs of advanced social productive forces in China, represents the forward direction of advanced culture in China, represents the fundamental interests of the most people in China, and through formulating correct line, principles and policies, strives tirelessly for the realization of the fundamental interests of the country and the people..."



"Under the new historical conditions, all Communist Party members and leaders should deeply understand and firmly grasp the 'Three Represents'. They should use it to guide their thoughts and actions. Only in this way can they truly become qualified members and leaders of the Party." This was Jiang Zemin's creative answer to the question of what kind of party and how to build the party after the fourth plenary session of the 14th CPC Central Committee and the 15th National Congress, based on new changes in the international and domestic situation. This answer made the overall goal and mission of party building more clear, and the direction of party building more explicit. 

The proposal of "Three Represents' important thought" caused a strong response both inside and outside the party, domestically and abroad. The entire party and country enthusiastically studied and researched it, deepening their understanding of this important thought. On this basis, Jiang Zemin discussed the issue of strengthening and improving the party's leadership under new circumstances from different angles at the economic work conference, united front work conference, and central discipline commission conference, enriching and perfecting the "Three Represents' important thought". 

After the proposal of the "Three Represents' important thought", the party central committee mainly focused on two areas of work to implement this important thought:

The first is carrying out study and education activities of the "Three Represents' important thought". On November 30, 2000, the General Office of the CPC Central Committee specifically formulated the "Opinions on Carrying out 'Three Represents' Important Thought Study and Education Activities in Rural Areas", requiring that starting from the winter of 2000 and the spring of 2001, leadership teams and grass-roots cadres in counties (cities), townships, and villages across the country should carry out the study and education activities of the "Three Represents' important thought" in a planned and step-by-step manner within about two years. Party committees and governments at all levels quickly formulated implementation plans. Many provinces, cities (cities), and counties have also implemented a responsibility system, determined contact points, carried out in-depth grassroots investigations and studies, and guided work face-to-face. Through the implementation of this activity, the ideological style and work style of grassroots cadres in rural areas have improved significantly, further promoting rural economic development and improving farmers' lives. 

The second is to carry out extensive topic research on party building as a key subject. Relevant central departments formed a project team, carried out investigation and study, widely solicited opinions, and understood the situations of all parties. Besides, various regions and many departments also carried out various forms of research, providing a lot of valuable materials for thinking about and solving new party building problems. The comrades of the party have achieved some results and consensus through research and discussion, but they also deeply feel that there are still many problems to be studied and solved. Regarding this, Jiang Zemin proposed at the Fifth Plenary Session of the 15th CPC Central Committee convened in October 2000: "In order to make all comrades of the party have a deep understanding and fully and correctly grasp the requirements of the 'Three Represents', there is still a lot of work to be done, first of all, it needs to be further studied from the combination of theory and practice, in order to form a consensus and make a reply." 

On July 1, 2001, the CPC Central Committee held a grand ceremony in Beijing to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the founding of the Communist Party of China. Jiang Zemin delivered an important speech at the meeting, systematically expounding the scientific connotation of the 'Three Represents' important thought.



Jiang Zemin pointed out: Our Party must always represent the development requirements of China's advanced productive forces, that is, the Party's theories, lines, programs, policies, and all works, must strive to conform to the laws of productive force development, reflecting the requirements of constantly promoting the liberation and development of social productive forces, especially the requirements of promoting advanced productive forces. Through the development of productive forces, we must constantly improve the living standard of the people; Our Party must always represent the advancing direction of China's advanced culture, that is, the Party's theories, lines, programs, policies, and all works, must strive to reflect the requirements of developing a modern, world-oriented, future-oriented socialist culture that is national, scientific, and mass-oriented, promoting the continuous improvement of the ideological and moral quality and scientific and cultural quality of the entire nation, providing spiritual motivation and intellectual support for China's economic development and social progress; Our Party must always represent the fundamental interests of the broadest people of China, that is, the Party's theories, lines, programs, policies, and all works, must persist in taking the fundamental interests of the people as the starting point and destination, fully mobilize the enthusiasm, initiative, and creativity of the masses, on the basis of continuous social development and progress, enable the masses to continuously obtain tangible economic, political, and cultural benefits.
In the "July 1st speech", Jiang Zemin not only comprehensively elaborated the scientific connotation and basic content of the "Three Represents" important thought, but also clearly pointed out the problem of how to implement it. After the "July 1st" speech was published, the Central and various places have successively held a series of theoretical seminars to discuss the spirit of Jiang Zemin's "July 1st" speech. The Central Propaganda Department dispatched related department leaders and theoretical workers to form a "July 1st" important speech lecturing group, dispatched to central state organs and all over the country to lecture the "July 1st" speech spirit, and received good results. The Central Organization Department organized related departments to set up research groups to continue to carry out a series of special investigations around the issues of Party building in the new situation. There is a general craze for studying and practicing the "Three Represents" all over the country.
With the deepening of the study and practice activities of the "Three Represents", people have a deeper understanding of how to build the Party according to the requirements of the "Three Represents".
On May 31, 2002, Jiang Zemin delivered an important speech at the graduation ceremony of the advanced training class for provincial and ministerial cadres of the Party School of the Central Committee, elaborating on the guiding significance and spiritual substance of the "Three Represents" important thought around the situation, tasks and working principles faced by the Party in the new century and a new stage. He pointed out: To open up a new situation in the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics, we must hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory and fully implement the "Three Represents" requirements. The "Three Represents" inherit the same line with Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought and Deng Xiaoping Theory, reflecting the new requirements of the development and changes of the contemporary world and China for the Party and state work. The "Three Represents" are the foundation of our Party's establishment, the basis of governance, the source of power, and a powerful theoretical weapon to strengthen and improve the Party's construction and promote the self-improvement and development of our country's social system.
He emphasized: The key to implementing the "Three Represents" requirement lies in keeping pace with the times, the core is maintaining the party's advanced nature, and the essence is insisting on serving the people. All Party comrades must firmly grasp this fundamental requirement and constantly enhance their awareness and determination to implement the "Three Represents" requirement. At the same time, he profoundly elaborated the importance of adhering to the party's ideological line and promoting the party's theoretical innovation, emphasizing the adherence to the ideological line of emancipating the mind and seeking truth from facts, promoting the spirit of keeping pace with the times, is the decisive factor for the party to maintain its advanced nature and creativity under the condition of long-term ruling. Whether our Party can always do this determines the development path and destiny of China.
This speech further unified the thoughts of the whole Party and made ample preparations for the convening of the 16th National Congress of the Party and the establishment of the guiding position of the "Three Represents" important thought in the whole Party.
From November 8 to 14, 2002, the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing.



This congress officially established the "Three Represents" important thought as the guiding ideology of the Party. After summarizing the valuable experience accumulated by our Party over the past thirteen years, the congress report pointed out: "These experiences, in connection with the historical experience since the formation of the Party, could be summed up in that the Party must always represent the development requirements of advanced productive forces in China, represent the direction of progressive culture in China, and represent the fundamental interests of the majority of the Chinese people."

The important thought of the "Three Represents" is proposed based on the scientific judgement of the historical status of the Party. Implementing the important thought of the "Three Represents" must ensure that the whole Party maintains a progressive spirit, continuously explores new horizons in the development of Marxist theory; development must be viewed as the primary task of the Party's governance and nation-building, continuously creating a new situation in modernization construction; the most extensive and fullest mobilization of all positive factors is required, to continually add new strength to the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation; the spirit of reform must be used to advance the construction of the Party, constantly injecting new vitality into the Party's body. In summary, the important thought of the "Three Represents" is about development and advancement. The whole Party must constantly strive to liberate new ideas, produce new developments in theory, constantly innovate in practice, implement the important thought of the "Three Represents" in all areas of socialist modernization construction, and reflect them in all aspects of Party building, so that our Party always keeps pace with the development of the times and shares a common destiny with the people.

The report, through a series of expositions, provided a highly summarized explanation of the epoch background, historical status, scientific connotation, spiritual essence, and guiding significance of the important thought of the "Three Represents". In general terms, the important thought of the "Three Represents" creatively applies Marxism-Leninism, and Mao Zedong's Thought, especially Deng Xiaoping's Theory, closely tied with new situations of the era development, new demands of the vast people of China, and the new practice of China's reform and opening up and modernization construction, etc. And they continue to explore a series of innovative theoretical achievements have been formed; on the question of how to build the Party and what kind of Party to build, we must persist in looking at ourselves in light of the requirements of the times, strengthening and improving ourselves with the spirit of reform, effectively solving the two historical issues of improving the Party's leadership level and governing level, improving its ability to resist corruption and risk, and fully advancing the new great project of Party building, forming a new understanding of Party building.

Due to the formation of a complete set of new theoretical achievements by the important thought of the "Three Represents", therefore, the Sixteenth National Congress of the Party established the important thought of the "Three Represents" along with Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong's Thought, and Deng Xiaoping's Theory as the guiding ideology of the Party. Establishing the important thought of the "Three Represents" as the guiding ideology of the Party is a historical decision of this congress and also a historical contribution.



Based on a series of discussions at the 16th National Congress, the Party Constitution amendment passed by the congress incorporated the important idea of the "Three Represents" along with Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, and Deng Xiaoping Theory, as the action guideline of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP). It clearly stipulates that the Chinese Communist Party is the vanguard of the Chinese working class, the Chinese people, and the Chinese nation, the leading core of China's socialism with Chinese characteristics, representing the development demands of China's advanced productive forces, the direction of China's advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the largest number of people. The CCP adopts Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the "Three Represents" as its action guideline. The "Three Represents" is the guiding ideology that the party must uphold for a long time. 

Just as the Seventh National Congress of the Party established Mao Zedong Thought as the party's guiding ideology and the 15th National Congress established Deng Xiaoping Theory as the party's guiding ideology, which played an extremely important role in promoting the victorious development of China's revolution and construction. The 16th National Congress established the "Three Represents" as the party's guiding ideology, this will also have an extremely important role in promoting the new situation of socialism with Chinese characteristics.

After the "Three Represents" important ideology was included in the Party Constitution at the Sixteenth Congress, on March 14, 2004, the Second Session of the Tenth National People's Congress passed the "Amendment to the Constitution of the People's Republic of China," which incorporated the "Three Represents" important ideology into the constitution, establishing its guiding position in our country's political and social life. This is of great significance to our Party and country. In the new century and new stage, the Chinese Communist Party will hold high the banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory and the "Three Represents" important thought, stick to the road of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and lead the people to strive for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society and the basic realization of modernization.

2. The historical significance of the "Three Represents" important ideology as the guiding ideology of the party

The establishment of the guiding position of the "Three Represents" important thought in the entire Party, has an extremely significant historical significance in the development history of Marxism, especially in the development history of scientific socialism.

First, Marxism has been advanced to a new height in the era and theory. The "Three Represents" important thought is the product of China's reform and opening up and socialist modernization. This important thought answers the questions of "what is socialism and how to build socialism" and creatively answers the questions of "what kind of party to build and how to build the party" from the perspective of the development of China and the world. It greatly enriches the theoretical treasury of Marxism and opens up a new realm of Marxist theory development. 

Second, Marxism is endowed with a new era connotation. The "Three Represents" important thought is an inheritance and development of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought and Deng Xiaoping Theory. This important thought creatively combines the party's construction with the development changes of today's world, the development trends of contemporary China, the self-improvement and development of our socialist system, and the realization of the grand goal of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and various tasks, endowing the party's nature, purpose, guiding thought, historical mission with distinct era content and characteristics.

Third, it has creatively inherited and developed the basic viewpoints of Marxism.



The "Three Represents" important thought innovatively develops the Marxist view that human society's progress is ultimately determined by productive forces, guided by advanced culture, and driven by the masses in the understanding of the party's governing laws, socialist construction laws, and human social development laws. These ideas uncover that socialism with Chinese characteristics is the organic unity of socialist market economy, socialist democratic politics, and socialist advanced culture. It is a society where socialist material civilization, spiritual civilization, and political civilization are comprehensively developed; it profoundly explains the intrinsic link between the socialist modernization led by the Chinese Communist Party, China's social progress and development, and the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation. These main viewpoints, all based on the inheritance of existing Marxist understanding, innovatively develop the basic theory of Marxism.
In conclusion, the important thought of "Three Represents" is closely integrated with new era conditions, maintains and develops Marxism with tremendous theoretical courage and scientific spirit, imbues Marxism with new vitality, and once again forcefully proves that the basic principles of Marxism remain a sharp ideological weapon for us to correctly understand and transform the world and promote the continuous advancement of social practice.

Chapter 11: The proposal for a comprehensive construction of a well-off society and the scientific outlook on development
Under the guidance of Deng Xiaoping's theory and the important thought of "Three Represents," China's economic and social development and various aspects of work have achieved significant progress. By the end of the 20th century, China has initially established a new socialist market system, and people's living standards overall have reached a well-off level. On this basis, the party central committee further proposed a new goal of completely constructing a well-off society based on the domestic and international situation and the basic conditions of China's economic and social development. For better guiding the comprehensive construction of a well-off society, and smoothly advancing China's economic and social development, the Chinese Communist Party timely proposed the scientific development outlook after entering the new century. With the goal of comprehensively constructing a well-off society and guided by the scientific development outlook, China's society has embarked on a new historical journey of socialist modernization construction.
I. The new goal of a comprehensive construction of a well-off society and the reform program for improving the market economy
Since the 14th National Congress of the Communist Party in 1992, the party has been increasing efforts to get rid of the old and establish the new, according to the reform goal of establishing a socialist market economy system. This has led to important breakthroughs in many areas of reform, promoting a fundamental transformation from the traditional planned economy system to the socialist market economy system. By the year 2000, a socialist market economy system was initially established, and people's lives had basically reached a state of being well-off.
1. Initial establishment of the socialist market economy system and overall achievement of a well-off state
The initial establishment of the socialist market economy system mainly manifested in the following aspects: the ownership structure is becoming increasingly diversified; the micro-dynamics of the national economy are strengthening; the market system is basically formed; the production factor market is taking shape; exploration of the new macro-control system is active; reform in the income distribution sector is deepening; the construction of the social security system is steadily advancing; the pace of government institution reform and function conversion is accelerating. The deepening of reforms significantly increased the marketization level of the national economy and the fundamental role of market allocation of resources has been gradually strengthening. By the end of 2000, China had initially established a socialist market economy system and became a developing market economy country. This is a fundamental change in China's economic system over the two decades of reform and opening up, especially since the 14th party congress. This fundamental change has brought profound influence not only to the institutional environment of China's economic development but also to the social life and ideological concepts of the Chinese people. It is of decisive significance for China's reform and construction, as well as for the development and innovation of the party's theory.
While judging that China has basically established a socialist market economy system, our party also made another judgment on a macro level: our country has overall achieved a state of "well-off", and based on this, it made a new plan for the development goals of the new century.



The concept of "Xiaokang" has gone through a historical process in its application in our society in the new era. As early as 1979, Deng Xiaoping proposed the concept of "Xiaokang", and envisioned achieving the goal of "Xiaokang" by the end of the 20th century. Since then, he has repeatedly interpreted the idea of "Xiaokang" from different perspectives, enriching its connotations.

In December 1990, the Seventh Plenary Session of the 13th CCP Central Committee passed the "Proposal on Formulating the Ten-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development and the Eighth Five-Year Plan", stating "people's lives have gone from subsistence to moderate prosperity. Living materials are more abundant, the consumption structure is becoming reasonable, living conditions have noticeably improved, cultural life is further enriched, health standards continue to rise, and social service facilities are continuously improving". These were mainly planned from the perspective of life quality. In 1991, National Bureau of Statistics and 12 other departments proposed 16 indicators of Xiaokang level, including per capita GDP, Engel's coefficient, per capita disposable income of urban residents, and net income per capita of farmers. According to this standard, by the year 2000, people's life in China overall reached Xiaokang level. 

In 1995, at the Fifth Plenary Session of the 14th CCP Central Committee, in the "Suggestions on Formulating the 'Ninth Five-Year' Plan and the 2010 Long-Term Goals for National Economic and Social Development," it was clearly stated that the deadline for achieving "Xiaokang" would be by the year 2000. By this time, China planned to "basically eliminate poverty and bring people's living standard to Xiaokang level". Generally speaking, the definition of a Xiaokang lifestyle, similar to the universally accepted definition of quality of life, includes material living conditions—food, clothing, housing, transportation, etc.; environmental conditions—including air, traffic, water quality, greening, etc.; and social environmental conditions—including social order, sense of security, social morals, and ethics.

After years of development through reform and opening up, by 2000, overall achievement of "Xiaokang" and the realization of the second strategic goal of socialist modernization were consolidated. In this context, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 15th CCP Central Committee clearly declared in 2000 that China has generally achieved "Xiaokang", "At the beginning of the new century, China is about to enter a new phase of development, comprehensively building a Xiaokang society, and accelerating the advancement of socialist modernization". "The implementation of the third strategic plan has begun. This is a new milestone in the history of Chinese nation’s development." According to the suggestions of the Fifth Plenary Session, the State Council formulated the "Outline of the Tenth Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development," which was approved at the Fourth Session of the Ninth National People's Congress in March 2001. This outline planned the blueprint for economic and social development for the first five years of the new century, defined the guiding principles and main tasks, and became the action program for people of all ethnic groups across the country to strive together at the beginning of the new century. With the implementation of the "Eleventh Five-Year" Plan, China entered a new phase of development: fully building a Xiaokang society and speeding up the process of socialist modernization.

By the end of the 20th century, people's lives in general had achieved Xiaokang, "this is a new milestone in the history of China’s national development". This also laid a solid foundation for further development in the new century.

2. The 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China and the Establishment of the Goal of Fully Building a Xiaokang Society

Shortly after entering the new century, the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing from November 8 to 14, 2002.




The Congress adopted the report titled "Comprehensively Building a Well-off Society and Creating a New Situation in the Cause of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics," presented by Jiang Zemin on behalf of the 15th Central Committee. It also passed the "Amendment to the Constitution of the Communist Party of China" and the work report of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection. It elected the new Central Committee and the new Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, which consists of 198 Central Committee members and 158 alternate members.

The theme of this congress is: To hold high the great banner of Deng Xiaoping Theory, comprehensively implement the important thought of the "Three Represents," carry forward with the times, comprehensively build a well-off society, accelerate the modernization of socialism, and strive to create a new situation for socialism with Chinese characteristics.

The entire content of the 16th National Congress report revolves around this theme and clearly signals to the world that the banner held high by the Chinese Communist Party in the new century and the new stage is the banner of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thought of the "Three Represents." The road that the Chinese Communist Party must take is the road of socialism with Chinese characteristics that has been persisted and developed by the Party Central Committee with Jiang Zemin at its core since Deng Xiaoping pioneered it. 

The report comprehensively reviewed the 13-year struggle and basic experience since the 15th National Congress, especially since the 4th Plenary Session of the 13th Central Committee in 1989. The report pointed out that this 13-year period is recognized as a time when China's overall national strength has greatly improved, the people have received the most benefits, social stability has been maintained, and the national cohesion has been significantly enhanced. 

The 16th National Congress of the Party determined the goal of striving for a comprehensive well-off society based on the requirement of comprehensively creating a new situation in the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. This is done on the basis of a profound analysis of the new situation and new tasks faced by the party and the country.



On November 8, Jiang Zemin clearly stated in his report at the 16th National Congress of the Party: According to the development goals proposed by the 15th National Congress, to the year 2010, the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Party, and the 100th anniversary of the founding of New China, "We should, in the first two decades of this century, concentrate our efforts to comprehensively build a more advanced well-off society benefiting billions of people, making the economy more developed, democracy more robust, science and education more progressive, culture more prosperous, society more harmonious, and people's lives richer. This is the necessary development stage for achieving the strategic goal of the third step of modernization construction, and also the key stage of improving the socialist market economy system and expanding opening up. After the construction of this phase, after continuing to struggle for several decades, we should basically achieve modernization by the mid-21st century, making our country a wealthy, democratic, civilized socialist country".

Into 2020, China's future will present the following bright prospects:
(1) On the basis of optimizing the structure and improving benefits, the GDP by 2020 strives to be doubled from 2000, and the overall national strength and international competitiveness have significantly increased. Basic industrialization has been realized, a complete socialist market economy system has been built, and a more dynamic and open economic system has emerged. The proportion of urban population has greatly increased, the trends of difference between workers and peasants, urban and rural areas, and regions have been gradually reversed. Social security systems are relatively complete, social employment is relatively sufficient, family wealth generally increases, and people live a richer life.
(2) Socialist democracy has been further perfected, socialist legal system has been further perfected, and the basic strategy of ruling the country by law has been fully implemented, and people's political, economic and cultural rights have been practically respected and guaranteed. Grassroots democracy has become more complete, social order is good, and people live and work in peace.
(3) The ideological, moral, scientific, and cultural qualities and health qualities of the whole nation have risen significantly, and have formed a relatively complete modern national educational system, technological and cultural innovation system, and nationwide fitness and health system. People enjoy the opportunity to receive a good education, basic universal secondary education is achieved, and illiteracy is eliminated. A learning society with lifelong learning for everyone has been established, promoting the all-round development of humans.
(4) The ability for sustainable development continues to increase, the ecological environment improves, the effectiveness of resource utilization is greatly increased, promotes harmony between man and nature, and promotes the entire society towards the civilized development path of prosperous production, rich life, and good ecology.
The goal of all-round construction of a well-off society determined by the 16th Party Congress, compared with the past, although only adds the term "all-round" in expression, its implications are richer and its significance is more profound. The phrase "all-round construction of a well-off society" refers to the low level, incomplete, and unbalanced development of a well-off state that China reached at the end of the 20th century. Therefore, the construction of an all-round well-off society from its basic implications to the development indicators, can be summarized into "higher level", "more extensive benefits", and "more coordinated development".
The goal of fully constructing a well-off society set by the 16th National Congress is the goal of all-round development of the economy, politics, culture, and society with Chinese characteristics, and it further enriches and develops the strategic ideas of the three steps of socialist modernization construction in China.



Firstly, the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society has elevated our country's conception of social development to a new height. Development is the primary task of the Chinese Communist Party in governing and rejuvenating the country; from ensuring that people's basic needs are met to establishing a moderately prosperous society, this is a leapfrog progression that the party, leading the Chinese people, has achieved in development issues. But even after achieving this leap-forward development, there still exist many contradictions and issues in our country that need further resolution, such as the relative backwardness in productivity and technologies, education, and the pressure we still face from developed countries owning superior advantages in the economic, technological, and other areas. The economic system and other management systems are still not perfect, the dual urban-rural economic structure has not changed, and the trend of widening regional disparity has not entirely reversed; there remains a portion of the population that needs to be lifted out of poverty, the total population continues to grow, the proportion of the elderly population is rising, and the pressure on employment and social security is increasing; problems with natural resources, ecological environment, and contradictions between economic and social development are becoming increasingly prominent; there are some unignorable issues in cultural construction, democratic rule of law, ideological, and moral construction, etc. All of these require us to take everything into consideration and address them comprehensively. The proposal of the idea and goal of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society indicates that the Chinese Communist Party's high-level decision-makers have fully recognized this. Therefore, it has lifted our country's socialist modernization from the comprehensive development of economy, politics, culture, and society, to a new level of comprehension.

Secondly, the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society extends the perspective of consolidating and developing socialism from the angle of productive forces to that of people’s livelihood. The report of the 16th National Congress of the party, while summarizing the basic experiences of the past thirteen years, clearly mentioned the need to "solve problems in the course of development with developmental methods". Authors of the Marxist classics have long pointed out incisively that the reason why socialism is superior to capitalism lies in its ability to create higher social productive forces than the latter. This conclusion is beyond doubt. However, judging from the historical experiences both at home and abroad since the 1990s, people's identification with a country, a party, or a society is not only reflected in the social productive forces, but also in whether the living standards and quality of life of the people can be continuously improved, and whether the social environment and cultural atmosphere can be continuously optimized. The proposal and formulation of the idea and goal of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society are a new understanding and development in Marxism's idea of liberating and developing social productive forces.

Thirdly, the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society concretely embodies the practical requirements of the "three represents" important thought. The comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society essentially means continuously liberating and developing social productive forces, continuously building advanced socialist culture, continuously improving the living standard and quality of the people, and achieving comprehensive development of politics, economy, culture, and society. Implementing the "three represents" important thought, the primary task is development, which reflects advanced productive forces, advanced culture, and the fundamental interests of the majority of the people. From the perspective of promoting social development, the implementation of the "three represents" important thought and the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society have historical and logical unity.

Fourth, the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society is an action program that fully embodies the spirit of the times in the new century. Drafting a struggle aim and action program that meet the requirements of the times and reflect the aspirations of the people is key whether a party can mobilize all positive factors to struggle together for common aims. From a historical perspective, at different historical periods, the party has proposed inspirational objectives based on changes in the era and social development needs, rallying the broad masses around itself, thus making the revolution, construction, and reform continuously proceed from one victory to another. The fighting aim of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society proposed by the 16th National Congress of the party is undoubtedly an aim of struggle that is in line with national conditions, conforms to the times, represents the fundamental interests of the people, reflects the needs of the times, is realistic, and is full of innovative spirit. Therefore, it forms an action program for continuing to advance the cause of socialist modernization in our country in the new century.



3. Further Improving the Program for Reforming the Socialist Market Economy System 

The development of a socialist market economy is a significant innovation of the Chinese Communist Party in Marxist economic theory. According to the reform direction of the socialist market economy, China has not only gradually transitioned from a planned economy system to a socialist market economy system but also gradually enriched and developed the reform program of the socialist market economy through practical exploration.

After the Third Plenum of the Eleventh Central Committee, China began to carry out reform and opening up. After more than a decade of practical exploration and theoretical summarization, the relationship between planning and market has gradually become clear, laying the foundation for the establishment of the reform goal of the socialist market economy system. The reform goal of the socialist market economy system was established at the Fourteenth Party Congress in 1992. In 1993, the "Decision on Some Issues Concerning Establishing the Socialist Market Economy System" passed by the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party preliminarily formulated China's overall plan for reforming the socialist market economy system, and initially outlined its basic content and framework, providing an action program for China's economic system reform in the 1990s.
