The subsequent Fifteenth and Sixteenth sessions deepened the Party's understanding of the socialist market economy based on the summary of practical experience, and initially established the socialist market economy system, making significant progress in China's economic system reform.

Firstly, a pattern of public ownership being dominant with various forms of ownership economy developing together has basically formed. Through years of adjustment and improvement of the ownership structure, China's ownership structure has become increasingly reasonable. The realization form of public ownership has become more diversified, the entire state-owned economy's layout is becoming reasonable, and by 2000, most state-owned large and medium-sized enterprises have initially established a modern enterprise system. Urban and rural collective economies have gained new vitality in reform and restructuring. Some enterprises with a good foundation have achieved new development by introducing market mechanisms; individual, private, joint venture, foreign-funded and other non-public economies have shown vigorous vitality from weak to strong; stock-based and mixed-ownership economies have increasingly become important types of economy under state policy encouragement. With market-oriented reform and adjustment of the ownership structure, the distribution system of distribution mainly according to work supplemented by various distribution ways has been continuously improved, the incentive mechanism has been gradually perfected, and labor, capital, technology, management, and other production elements participate in the distribution according to contribution.

Secondly, the socialist market economy system has initially been established. With the establishment of basic economic systems and the continuous development of various market elements, the micro-foundation of the socialist market economy system has gradually formed. With the further development of the commodity market, the pace of development of the capital, labor, technology, real estate, and other markets has also accelerated, and the basic role of the market in resource allocation has gradually strengthened. While promoting market reforms, the country has also comprehensively promoted the reform of the macroeconomic management system, the country's ability to regulate the economy has continuously improved, and through the cooperation of national planning, fiscal policies, monetary policies and various regulatory measures, the policy system of macro control has been gradually improved.

Thirdly, the level of China's social and economic development has improved significantly. China has moved from the initial stage of industrialization to the middle stage. The mode of economic growth has gradually shifted from extensive to intensive, and the quality of the economy has greatly improved along with the expansion of the total economy..



The overall economy and total import-export trade of our country have entered the world's front ranks. There have been two historic leaps in the quality of people's lives. In the 1980s, the basic issue of feeding the population was solved, and in the 1990s we have gone from just feeding people to bringing about a moderately prosperous society. The problem of securing food, which has vexed the Chinese for thousands of years, has been fundamentally resolved under the leadership of the Communist Party of China. The dream of living a moderately prosperous life, dreamt by our ancestors, is now becoming a reality. With the rapid growth of the economy and the continuous progress of society, achievements in education, science, culture, population, environment and other social undertakings have been historic and have started to embark on a path of sustainable development and overall societal progress. This is a great victory for the socialist system and a new milestone in the history of the Chinese nation.

Fourth, the social security system has been initially established and is continuously improving, with pension, unemployment, and medical insurance for urban workers as its main components. The sources of social security funds are diversified, social management services are provided, and the three 'guarantee lines' of the basic livelihood security system for laid-off workers from state-owned enterprises, the unemployment insurance system, and the minimum living security system for urban residents are continuously perfected, playing an important role in maintaining social stability.

Through a series of reforms over a considerable period of time, China's economy and society have achieved tremendous progress under market conditions. It can be said that these achievements are attracting worldwide attention. However, we should also see that, while achieving these accomplishments, some long-term and deep-seated contradictions have not fundamentally resolved, and new conflicts and issues have accumulated in economic and social fields. Notably, problems include an unreasonable economic structure, enduring urban-rural and regional development gaps, slow income growth for farmers, increasing numbers of laid-off workers, prominent employment problems, intensifying resource and environmental pressures, lack of overall economic competitiveness, etc. The reasons for these problems are multifaceted, an important one being that China's socialist market economic system is not perfect enough, and in many ways, it can't adapt to the development of productivity, especially advanced productivity.

Reform is a powerful driving force for economic development and social progress. To adapt to the international environment of economic globalization and accelerating technological progress, and to the new situation of comprehensively building a moderately prosperous society, in October 2003, the Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Party adopted the 'Decision on Some Issues for Improving the Socialist Market Economic System' (hereinafter 'Decision'), focusing on important systemic issues that need to be solved in the current and future period, setting out reform goals and tasks, and making decisions and deployments.

First, on the main goal of improving the socialist market economic system. The 'Decision' proposes to coordinate urban-rural development, regional development, economic-social development, human-nature harmonious development, domestic development and opening-up, further play the fundamental role of the market in resource allocation, enhance enterprise vitality and competitiveness, improve the national macro-control system, improve the government's social management and public service functions, and provide a strong systemic guarantee for the comprehensive construction of a moderately prosperous society.

Second, on the primary task of reforming the socialist market economic system...



The "Decision" clearly states: to improve the basic economic system where public ownership is dominant and various forms of ownership develop together; to establish a system conducive to gradually changing the dual urban-rural economic structure; to form a mechanism to promote the coordinated development of regional economy; to build a unified, open, competitive and orderly modern market economy system; to perfect the macro-control system, administrative management system and economic legal system; to improve the employment, income distribution and social security systems; to establish a mechanism to promote the sustainable development of economy and society.
Third, regarding the guiding ideology and principles of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy system. The "Decision" clearly states: to adhere to Deng Xiaoping Theory and the "Three Represents" important thought as the guide, to implement the Party's basic line, basic program, basic experience, to fully implement the spirit of the Sixteenth National Congress, to liberate thoughts, seek truth from facts, and keep pace with the times. To persist in the reform direction of the socialist market economy, pay attention to institutional construction and system innovation. To persist in respecting the pioneering spirit of the masses, and fully exert the positivity of both the central and local levels. To persist in handling the relationship between reform, development, and stability correctly, advance reform with focus and steps. To insist on overall planning and consideration, coordinate various interest relationships in the process of reform. To insist on people-oriented principle, establish a comprehensive, coordinated, sustainable development concept, and promote the all-round development of economy, society and people. Looking at the guiding ideology of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy from this "Decision" compared to the "Decision of the CPC Central Committee on Some Issues Concerning the Establishment of a Socialist Market Economy System" in 1993, it integrates the latest spirit of the Party's creative understanding of Marxist ideology, reflecting the Party's guiding ideology keeping pace with the times.
The "Decision" reflects the Party's latest understanding of China's economic and social development situation entering the 21st century, with distinctive inheritance and continuity, and is a historical document connecting the past and opening up the future. It systematically enriches the content that could not be unfolded due to insufficient time or immature conditions ten years ago, and is a programmatic document for improving the socialist market economy in the new century. It deepens the program of socialist market economy reform from three major aspects.
First, it further developed Marxist economic theory. Since the Third Plenary Session of the Eleventh Central Committee, especially since the Fourteenth National Congress of the Party and its Third Plenary Session, with the gradual establishment and improvement of the socialist market economy system, some new features have emerged in the reform process: China's reform is no longer the "crossing the river by feeling the stones" of the 1980s, but is carried out under the guidance of the overall reform plan; the topics for discussion by the leadership and the theoretical circle have shifted more from "whether to reform" to "how to reform". The theory of socialist market economy has been continuously developed and improved in the deepening of reform practice and theoretical debates.
After transiting economic operations into the market system, and having achieved basic consensus within and outside the party, the focus of theoretical exploration began to turn into the field of ownership. Therefore, differences of opinions were expressed in the form of whether the reform surnames "public" or "private". The fifteenth party congress answered this question in a distinct manner. In terms of recognizing the status of the non-public economy, the Fifteenth Party Congress Report, based on the basic national conditions of the primary stage of socialism, broke through the previous judgments of "important supplement" and "beneficial supplement" for the status of the non-public economy, considered that public ownership with various forms of ownership developing together is a "basic economic system" in the primary stage of socialism in our country, and identified that the non-public economy is an "important component" of the socialist market economy.



In terms of understanding the public ownership economy, the report emphasizes that the public ownership economy not only includes state-owned economy and collective economy, but also includes the state-owned and collective components in the mixed ownership economy; The implementation forms of public ownership should be diversified, and all management methods and organizational forms that reflect the laws of socialized production can be boldly utilized, striving to find implementation forms of public ownership that can greatly promote the development of productive forces. In terms of understanding the state-owned economy, the report believes that the leading role of the state-owned economy refers to controlling the lifeline of the national economy, but this is in terms of the whole country; The leadership role of the state-owned economy is mainly reflected in control and efforts should be made to strategically adjust the layout of the state-owned economy. In the 15th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the theory of socialist market economy was placed under the theoretical background of the primary stage of socialism, clearly answering the question of the reform "surname" and "private" "public", fundamentally developing the theory of socialist market economy. 

In the mid-to-late 1990s, the strategic goal of the second step of China's modernization construction was basically achieved. At the beginning of the new century, the third step of the strategic goal was timely launched, from top to bottom, people were discussing the coexistence of the "strategic opportunity period" and the "period of prominent contradictions". The new Central leadership team elected by the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, in response to new situations and tasks, put forward the concept of scientific development that "people-oriented" and "comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable" at the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee, and made a resolution on several issues concerning perfecting the socialist market economic system. In the "Decision on Several Issues Concerning Perfecting the Socialist Market Economic System", the Party also innovated the theory of socialist market economy, mainly reflected in the great breakthroughs in the theory of ownership and property rights. The "Decision" for the first time proposed that "we should vigorously develop the mixed ownership economy of state-owned capital, collective capital and non-public capital, realize the diversification of investment subjects, and make the stock system the main form of public ownership". Before that, it was only suggested that the shareholding system is a form of implementation. The proposition of the 16th National Congress report is to "actively promote shareholding and develop mixed ownership economy." The major change in this proposition in the "Decision" will greatly accelerate the diversification of state-owned enterprises and create opportunities for more private enterprises and foreign businesses to invest in state-owned shareholding companies. In terms of property rights theory, the "Decision" for the first time proposed that "property rights are the core and main content of ownership, including all kinds of property rights such as property rights, creditor's rights, stock rights, and intellectual property rights." The reform of enterprises has developed from establishing modern enterprise system to modern property rights system, indicating that both the theory and practice of China's enterprise reform have entered a new stage.

Secondly, it deepened and perfected the connotation of the goal of reforming the socialist market economy. The Third Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party stated in the "Decision": According to the requirements of overall urban and rural development, overall regional development, overall economic and social development, overall harmony between man and nature, and overall domestic development and external opening, it is necessary to play a more significant basic role of the market in resource allocation, enhance the vitality and competitiveness of enterprises, improve state macro-control, improve government social management and public service functions, and provide institutional guarantee for the building of a moderately prosperous society in an all-round way. According to this statement in the "Decision", it deepened and perfected the connotation of the goal of the socialist market economy reform from three aspects. The first is to establish the "Five Overall Planning" as the basis for deepening the reform. This is a very important reform idea put forward by our party based on the summary of the reform history experience since the Third Plenary Session of the 11th Central Committee. It is a distinct feature of the reform goal proposed in this "Decision". The second is to reflect the organic unity of the stage and continuity in China's economic system reform. The Third Plenary Session of the 14th Central Committee put forward the reform goal of establishing a socialist market economy system, that is, the basic role of the market under macro-control. After 10 years of hard practice and bold exploration, the goal of the reform has been basically achieved.



On this basis, the "Decision" has further added the basic connotations of expanding the fundamental role of the market, enhancing the vitality and competitiveness of enterprises, improving the national macro-control system, and strengthening the government's public service functions. Thus, it is combined with the basic connotation of developing a socialist market economy proposed by the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party, which together constitute the main connotation of the reform goal of deepening the socialist market economy system. This not only enriches the connotation of the reform goals of the socialist market economic system but also reflects the organic unity of the stage and continuity of China's economic system reform. The third is the integration of system guarantee content. From the basic view of Marxism, society is an open system, there is high interdependence between urban and rural areas, regions, humans, and nature, and the economy is inseparable from society, with internal conditions and external environments interrelated. Therefore, reform must analyze problems from multiple perspectives such as economy and society, urban and rural, human and nature, domestic and international, developed and underdeveloped regions, propose reform goals, in order to more effectively promote the liberation and development of productive forces.

Third, it makes the historical task of deepening the reform of the socialist market economy more specific and clear. The "Decision" of the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee of the Party proposed seven tasks for further deepening the reform: ① perfecting the basic economic system with public ownership as the main body and various forms of ownership developing together; ② Establishing a system conducive to gradually changing the dual economic structure of urban and rural areas; ③ forming a mechanism for promoting regional economic coordinated development; ④ building a unified, open, competitive, and orderly modern market system; ⑤ improving the macro-control system, administrative management system, and economic legal system; ⑥ improving the employment, income distribution, and social security system; ⑦ establishing a mechanism to promote sustainable economic and social development. The Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee of the Party proposed to establish a socialist market economic system, mainly proposing reform tasks in the construction of state-owned enterprise market systems, macro-control systems, distribution systems, and social security systems. From the historical conditions at that time, the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee emphasized the integrity of the market system when determining the tasks of reform. The tasks proposed by the "Decision" of the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee are based on the "Decision on Several Issues Concerning the Establishment of a Socialist Market Economic System" of the Third Plenary Session of the Fourteenth Central Committee, which further strengthens the practical relevance, thereby making the historical tasks of economic reform more clear and specific. From the current situation, if issues such as the effective implementation form of public ownership, orderly market competition, and transformation of government public functions cannot be resolved, China's economy will not be able to sustain healthy and rapid development, industries will not be able to form strong competitiveness, and it will be difficult to maintain the good situation of opening up to the outside world; if it cannot be guaranteed from system and mechanism, gradually solving problems such as urban-rural gap, regional disparities, and disharmony between humans and nature, it is difficult to maintain long-term social stability, and it is difficult to achieve the grand goal of comprehensively building a well-off society. Aiming at these practical problems, the "Decision" proposed seven clear and specific reform tasks, the fundamental purpose of which is to eliminate the institutional obstacles to the development of productive forces and provide strong institutional guarantees for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society.

The above-mentioned historical process fully reflects the development of China's reform practices and reflects our party's exploration of integrating the basic principles of Marxism with the practice of China's reform and opening up, and reflects our party's deepening understanding of the laws of developed socialist market economies.

II. The new situation of deepening reform and development and the proposal of the Scientific Development Concept 

After entering the new stage of the new century, China's economic and social development has entered a critical period. In the face of the complex situation faced by China in the critical period, the Central Party led by Hu Jintao inherits the beneficial ideas of predecessors, summarizes the historical experience of many years, scientifically analyze the current situation, and timely proposed the concept of Scientific Development.

1. The situation and problems China faces during the critical period of reform and development 

The proposal of the concept of Scientific Development is not accidental. It is the inevitable requirement of the development of international and domestic situations and is the latest summary of world development thoughts.



Looking at the international situation, the world today is characterized by the trends of peace, development, and cooperation. The trend of global multipolarization and economic globalization continues to develop profoundly, countries increasingly depend on each other, major power relations have changed significantly, and the balance of world power continues to shift. Technological advancement is changing rapidly; technology innovation and diffusion are accelerating. The international restructuring of industries and the transfer of production elements are speeding up, and regional economic integration is thriving. The world economy is in a new round of recovery and growth. In this tide of world development, the international community generally has positive expectations for the development prospects of our country. They appreciate the role and influence of our country, and the willingness to cooperate with us is generally strengthened. This is the favorable aspect for our country's development. But at the same time, we must soberly see that the development of our country also faces some major challenges: hegemonism and power politics still exist, the unstable and uncertain factors affecting world peace and development are increasing, the world economic development imbalance is worsening, the international competition around resources, markets, technology, and talent is becoming increasingly intense, trade barriers and trade frictions are noticeably increasing, the pressure of developed countries' superiority in the economy and technology will exist for a long time. The environment we face will still be generally conducive to our country's development, but unfavorable factors may also increase. Faced with such an environment, we must put China's development in the perspective of the world's overall situation, exploit advantages and avoid drawbacks, seize opportunities, respond to challenges, and accelerate development, and strive for the initiative in development.

Looking at the domestic situation, after the unremitting efforts since the founding of the People's Republic of China, especially since the reform and opening up, our country has achieved remarkable development achievements. Major profound changes have taken place from the productive forces to the relations of production, from the economic foundation to the superstructure. By 2000, we had successfully realized the second-step development goal of the "three-step" strategy of modernization construction, and people's lives had generally reached a well-off level. The 16th National Congress put forward a grand goal to build a well-off society in all respects benefiting billions of people in the first 20 years of the 21st century. This phase of development is directly linked to the goal of enhancing socialism and expanding foreign trade. The prominent feature and main problem during this period are that China's economy and society have entered a new stage of development. China's industrialization and urbanization processes have accelerated, and the adjustment of economic structure has sped up; the level of marketization in the economy has rapidly increased, deepening reforms have further tapped into deep-seated contradictions and problems, and system innovation has entered a crucial stage; the imbalance in regional development, the uncoordinated development of economy and society, the task of narrowing the gap in regional development and promoting coordinated development of economy and society has become more difficult; China's economic dependence on the outside world has been increasing, and the impact of the world economy on China's development has noticeably deepened; People's material and cultural needs are constantly upgrading and becoming more diversified, social interest relations are becoming more diverse and complex, and the difficulty of balancing various interests is increasing; the awareness of democracy and law among the people is constantly enhancing, the enthusiasm for political participation is constantly improving, new requirements have been put forward in developing socialist democracy and implementing the basic strategy of ruling the country according to law; channels and level of people's exposure to various ideological influences have noticeably increased, and the independence, selectivity, and variability of ideological activities have significantly enhanced.   

Lastly, looking at world experience, reaching a per capita GDP of 1,000 dollars in economic development is a significant mark. It signifies that economic development has stepped up to a new level, approaching an important juncture.



When a nation exceeds a per capita GDP of $1000, two outcomes or results may occur: some may skyrocket and progress, while others may stagnate and fail to move forward. Only appropriate responses can help accelerate growth. Some East Asian nations and regions effectively managed various relationships during this period, leading to consistent fast growth for many years. Some countries in Latin America, however, took inappropriate measures and fell into turbulence and stagnation, getting stuck in what we call the "Latin American Trap." By 2003, China's GDP per capita exceeded $1000. According to internationally recognized standards, China has risen from the low-income nations group. This marks a great milestone in the development history of the Chinese nation and creates a new starting point for pushing forward socialist modernization more vigorously. After China's socio-economic development reached this new starting point, discussions emerged about how China could learn from the successful experiences of other countries and avoid their failures. These became hot topics in the world of intellectual and theoretical discussion, as well as issues that the top leadership of the Chinese Communist Party had to consider.

2. The Proposal of Scientific Development Concept

The Scientific Development Concept launched by the Party Central Committee, led by Hu Jintao as General Secretary, expounds on the ideology of "development" from Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the "Three Represents" essential thought. This concept drew on the developmental achievements and practices from various countries around the world, in-depth insight into the characteristics of China’s developmental stages, and summarized the long-term experiences of China's development.

As early as March 1999, Hu Jintao proposed during the deliberation of the Fujian delegation at the second session of the Ninth National People's Congress that "we must firmly establish the thought that development is an absolute principle and establish a scientific development perspective." On April 15, 2003, during his inspection tour in Guangdong, Hu Jintao explicitly proposed the idea of persisting in a comprehensive development view. On July 28, at a national conference for the prevention and treatment of SARS, he pointed out, "Through fighting SARS, we have recognized more profoundly than ever that China's economic development and social development, urban development, and rural development are not well coordinated... we need to attach great importance to existing problems and resolve them with practical measures, making the fight against SARS an important opportunity to improve our work and better promote our cause."

In promoting development, we should not only focus on economic indicators but also pay attention to human, resource, and environmental indicators. We should not only increase the investment in promoting economic growth but also enhance the funding for social development and the protection of resources and the environment. In October, the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee of the Party officially adopted "Adhere to people-oriented, establish a comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development perspective, and promote the comprehensive development of the economy, society, and people" as guidance and principles for deepening economic system reform. On October 14, Hu Jintao further proposed at the second full meeting of the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee, "Establishing and implementing the scientific development concept of comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development is significant to our persistence that development is an absolute principle. 

To establish and implement the scientific development view is the summary of the experiences from more than 20 years of reform and opening up, an important lesson from our victory over SARS, as well as an urgent requirement for promoting a comprehensive build of a well-off society... Such a development concept conforms to the objective law of social development." Here, the concept of people-centered, comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development was officially given the concept of "Scientific Development Concept."



In February 2004, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CCP) held a special research class for provincial and ministerial main leaders on "Establishing and Implementing the Scientific Outlook on Development" at the Central Party School. Central leaders such as Wen Jiabao, Zeng Qinghong, and Zeng Peiyan explained the important significance of the scientific outlook on development in the class, emphasizing that insisting on people-orientedness is the essence and core of the scientific outlook on development, and put forward specific requirements for leaders at all levels to establish and implement the scientific outlook on development. As a result, the concept of the "Scientific Outlook on Development" is widely used among the central leadership.

On March 10, 2004, at the Central Population Resources and Environment Work Conference, Hu Jintao gave a comprehensive and profound explanation of the guiding significance, basic content, and basic requirements of the scientific outlook on development. He pointed out: sticking to people-oriented, comprehensive, coordinated, and sustainable development outlook is a major strategic thought proposed by us with Deng Xiaoping Theory and the "Three Represents" important thought as a guide, and starting from the overall situation of the party and the country's development in the new century and new stage. The Scientific Outlook on Development summarizes over twenty years of successful experiences in China's reform and modernization construction and absorbs lessons from other countries in the development process. It encapsulates the important inspirations that the SARS epidemic gave us, reveals the objective laws of economic and social development, and reflects our party's new understanding of development issues.

In October 2005, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the CCP proposed that the scientific outlook on development is a concentrated reflection of the worldview and methodology guiding development issues. The plan of the "11th Five-Year Plan" reviewed by the plenary session fully implemented the requirements of the scientific outlook on development. This plenary session elevated the scientific outlook on development to the level of "worldview and methodology", further clarifying its guiding position in the party. Since then, General Secretary Hu Jintao has repeatedly elucidated and instructed the connotation, core, basic content, and requirements of the scientific outlook on development on different occasions, making it a consensus of the entire party and the people nationwide and an important guarantee for realizing the ambitious goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects. In 2007, the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China officially incorporated the Scientific Outlook on Development into the Party Constitution, giving it an even higher guiding position.

3. The inheritance and development of the scientific outlook on development to Marxist theory

The Scientific Outlook on Development is a major strategic thinking put forward by our party, insisting on Deng Xiaoping Theory and the "Three Represents" important thought as a guide, accurately understanding the trend of world development, seriously summarizing the experience of China's development, and conducting in-depth analysis of the specific characteristics of China's development stage.



This major strategic idea, is the inheritance and development of Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory, and the important thinking of "Three Represents." It is the concentrated embodiment of the Marxist worldview and methodology about development, it is the guiding principle that must be adhered to for the comprehensive development of socialist economic construction, political construction, cultural construction, and social construction.
Firstly, the scientific development concept inherits and develops the Marxist basic thought about development. The scientific development concept adheres to the basic principles of Marxism, closely integrating with the great practice of socialism with Chinese characteristics, absorbing the new achievements of human civilization progress, standing at the height of history and the era, aiming at enriching the connotation of development, innovating development concepts, exploring development ideas, solving development problems, further answered a series of major questions such as why and how China is developing in the new situation, and preliminarily formed the Marxist systematic theory about socialist development. In general, it emphasizes that human society is constantly developing and progressing, development is the eternal theme of human society; it emphasizes the coordination and sustainability of development, advocating the harmonious coexistence of man and nature; and it emphasizes that the ultimate goal of development is to realize the comprehensive progress of society and the comprehensive development of human beings. This development perspective shows that our party has reached a new realm in understanding the issue of development based on adhering to the Marxist perspective of development.

Secondly, the scientific development concept centrally embodies the Marxist methodological thinking on what is development and how to develop. The scientific development concept reveals the correct road for our country's economic and social development. The scientific development concept requires the correct handling of a series of major relations in socialist modernization construction such as economic development and social development, development speed and efficiency, market mechanism and macro-control, reform development stability, emphasizing comprehensively promoting economic construction, political construction, cultural construction and social construction, realizing economic development and comprehensive social progress. The basic requirement of the scientific development concept is overall planning. It runs through the Marxist standpoint, viewpoint, and method. In practice, it is to adhere to the "five coordination."

Thirdly, the scientific development concept sticks to the principle of people-oriented, reflecting the Marxist values. The people-oriented principle is the consistent social value orientation of Marxism. It emphasizes respect for the value of human existence, the value of demand, and the value of development, which is an important feature of Marxist theory of social development. In scientifically elucidating the law of human social development, the historical materialism also indicates the law of the masses creating history.



The concept of scientific development clearly advocates for putting people first, and emphasizes it as the "essence and core" of the scientific development concept. Everything is for the people, everything depends on the people, taking the masses as the main body and basic driving force of development, and at the same time, satisfying the growing material and cultural needs of the people as the fundamental starting point and ending point of development. This fully reflects the basic value orientation of the Marxist party and is a prominent expression of socialist value goals. Therefore, it is also the inevitable conclusion of the combination of the historical materialistic principle of putting man first and the nature and purpose of our party's founding for the public and governing for the people.
Three, the series of major strategic decisions to promote scientific development
The setting of the goal of building a well-off society in an all-round way and the proposal of the scientific development concept have provided a guarantee for our society to embark on the path of scientific development. On this basis, the Party has successively launched a series of major strategic decisions to ensure the health and rapid development of our society.
The proposal of the concept of scientific development is a summary of our party's experience in reform and opening up over the past more than twenty years, reflecting the Chinese Communist Party's new understanding of development issues, embodying the urgent requirements of building a well-off society in an all-round way, conforming to the trend of times and the contemporary China's national conditions.
In order to effectively implement the concept of scientific development and promote scientific development, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council have taken a series of major measures:
The first is to further strengthen and improve macro-control. In response to new problems arising in economic life such as food, investment, and tension in coal and electricity transportation, the central government has taken targeted control measures in credit, land, and agricultural production, suppressed unhealthy and unstable factors in economic operation, avoided large fluctuations in the national economy, and maintained the momentum of rapid economic growth.
The second is to improve the socialist market economic system. In October 2003, the Third Plenary Session of the Sixteenth Central Committee of the Party passed the "Decision on Several Issues Concerning the Improvement of the Socialist Market Economic System" (hereinafter referred to as the "Decision"), which clearly put forward the goal and main tasks of improving the socialist market economic system. Fulfilling these tasks would enhance enterprise vitality and competitiveness, improve the national macro-control system, improve government social management and public service functions, and provide a strong system guarantee for building a well-off society in all aspects. 
The third is to propose a general strategy for coordinated regional development. According to the requirements of the scientific development concept, the CPC Central Committee adheres to overall planning, rational planning, leveraging advantages, and implementing policies, and continuously makes new deployments for coordinated regional development. In March 2004, the State Council issued "Several Opinions on Further Promoting the Development of the Western Region", proposing to strengthen economic exchanges and cooperation between the western and eastern and central regions, establish a market-oriented cross-regional and cross-enterprise cooperation mechanism, and combine the capital, technology and talent advantages of the eastern and central regions with the resource, market and labor advantages of the western region to achieve complementary advantages, mutual benefit and common development.



In October 2005, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party reviewed China's experiences in socialist modernization, and further proposed a comprehensive strategy for regional development. This strategy emphasized the continued promotion of the development of the western regions, the revitalization of old industrial bases such as the northeast region, the rise of the central region, and the encouragement of the eastern region to take the lead in development to form a rational pattern of regional development. The Fifth Plenary Session outlined the developmental orientation and overall thinking for different regions based on their respective conditions, focusing on their comparative advantages, strengthening their weak links, and promoting coordinated development. The session stressed the need to implement mechanisms for regional coordination, clarify the functional positioning of different regions, and promote healthy urban development.

4. Formulating the "11th Five-Year Plan". In October 2005, the Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee passed the "Proposals for Formulating the Eleventh Five-Year Plan for National Economic and Social Development" (hereinafter referred to as the "Proposals"). The "Proposals" considered the trends and conditions for China's development over the next five years, and put forward the main goals for the "11th Five-Year Plan": doubling the per capita GDP by 2010 compared to 2000; reducing energy consumption per unit GDP by about 20% compared to the end of the "10th Five-Year Plan"; effectively controlling the trend of environmental degradation and excessive reduction of arable land; forming a batch of dominant enterprises with strong international competitiveness, independent intellectual property rights and well-known brands; further improving the socialist market economy system, reaching a new level for an open economy, and achieving a basic balance of payments; universally spreading and consolidating nine-year compulsory education, continuously increasing the number of urban job positions, and improving the social security system, reducing the population living in poverty; generally improving the income level and quality of life of urban and rural residents, and maintaining price stability, improving the conditions of housing, transportation, education, culture, health care and the environment; making new progress in democratic and legal construction and spiritual civilization construction, further improving social order and safety, and making new progress in constructing a harmonious society.

5. Strengthening the construction of the New Socialist Countryside, continuing to deepen rural reform, and intensifying the fundamental role of agriculture. In December 2002, the Central Politburo held a meeting emphasizing that issues related to "agriculture, rural areas, and farmers" should be made the priority of the Party's work, and given even greater prominence. From 2004 to 2008, the Central Committee issued documents concerning the "three rural issues" ("agriculture, rural areas, and farmers") consecutively for five years with the "No.1 Document". At the Fifth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee of the Communist Party in 2005, it proposed the historical task of constructing the New Socialist Countryside and established the construction goals of "productive development, affluent living, civilized manners, clean and tidy villages, democratic management". In early 2006, the Central Committee issued the "Several Opinions of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council on Promoting the Construction of the New Socialist Countryside" in the form of the "No.1 Document", laying out a comprehensive plan for the construction of the New Socialist Countryside. The Communist Party, in response to the changes in the stages of economic and social development, clearly proposed the establishment of a long-term mechanism of "promoting agriculture by industry and bringing the countryside along with the cities", adhering to the policy of "giving more, taking less and allowing vitality", and focusing on the "giving more" part to promote the construction of modern agriculture and strengthen the industrial support for the construction of the New Socialist Countryside. In terms of rural reform, the Communist Party decided to abolish the agricultural tax on the basis of accelerating the reform of rural taxes and fees and gradually reducing agricultural taxes. On December 29, 2005, the 19th Meeting of the Tenth Standing Committee of the National People's Congress officially decided to abolish the "Agricultural Tax Regulations" from January 1, 2006, which put an end to the "imperial grain and national tax" that had been in existence for over 2000 years in China. It was a historic change in the pattern of national income distribution, and brought rural reform to a comprehensive stage of reform that mainly involved town and village institutions, rural compulsory education, and county and village fiscal administration systems.

6. Constructing an innovative nation. Innovation is the soul of a nation's progress, and the inexhaustible driving force for a country's prosperity.



Since the 16th National Congress, the Party Central Committee has made a significant decision to promote independent innovation and build an innovative country, starting from the overall situation of comprehensively building a well-off society and opening up a new situation for the cause of socialism with Chinese characteristics. After nearly five years of refinement and development, in January 2006, Hu Jintao formally proposed the main struggle goal for China to build an innovative country at the opening ceremony of the National Science and Technology Conference, that is, by 2020, significantly enhance China's independent innovation capability, the ability of science and technology to promote economic and social development and ensure national security, and the comprehensive strength of basic science and frontier technology research, achieve a number of scientific and technological achievements with significant impact in the world, and join the ranks of innovative countries, providing strong support for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society.

Seventh is to orderly promote the construction of socialist democratic politics and strive to build socialist political civilization. The 16th National Congress of the Party set the development of socialist democratic politics and the construction of socialist political civilization as an important goal for the comprehensive construction of a well-off society, and required to continue to actively and steadily promote political system reform. After the 16th National Congress, the Party Central Committee, while pushing forward the construction of material and spiritual civilization, adapted the reform of the political system to the goal of building a socialist political civilization through adhering to and improving the people's congress system, strengthening the multi-party cooperation and political consultation system led by the CPC, continuously expanding grass-roots democracy, and steadily promoting the socialist rule of law and other aspects of construction.

Eighth, it is to deepen the cultural system reform and prosper the advanced socialist culture. With the economic transition and social transformation, the economic foundation, system environment, and social conditions for the construction and development of our culture have undergone profound changes. The 16th National Congress of the party required all party comrades to deeply understand the strategic significance of cultural construction, promote the development and prosperity of socialist culture, and proposed to formulate the overall plan for cultural system reform as soon as possible. On June 27 to 28, 2003, the National Cultural System Reform Pilot Work Conference studied and deployed the pilot work of cultural system reform. On December 23, 2005, the CPC Central Committee and the State Council issued the "Several Opinions on Deepening the Reform of the Cultural System", which clearly stated that the goal and task of the cultural system reform is to take development as the theme, reform as the driving force, and system and mechanism innovation as the focus, form a scientific and effective macro-cultural management system, an efficient cultural production and service micro-operation mechanism, and a cultural industry pattern and a unified, open, competitive, and orderly modern cultural market system that is dominated by public ownership and developed by various forms of ownership; must form a perfect cultural innovation system, form a cultural openness pattern that is dominated by national culture, absorbs beneficial foreign cultures, and promotes Chinese culture to the world. In March 2006, the National Cultural System Reform Work Conference summarized the pilot work of cultural system reform and made specific deployments to promote cultural system reform. As a result, the cultural system reform has entered a new stage. The pilot areas followed the principles of "separation of government and enterprises", "separation of political affairs", and "separation of management and operation", further transforming government functions. The reform of the non-profit cultural affairs is deepened, and the public service ability and level are significantly improved. Breakthrough progress has been made in the transformation of profit-oriented cultural business units to enterprise and market management, and a large number of large cultural groups have formed one after another.

In the process of promoting scientific development, the Party Central Committee has a clearer understanding of the systemic and mechanistic contradictions accumulated in China's economic and social development over the long term, as well as new situations and issues faced, and the understanding of the objective laws of economic and social development is further deepened. Grasping the laws of development, innovating development concepts, transforming development methods, solving development problems, and improving the quality and efficiency of development have gradually become the consensus of the whole party. On this basis, the Party Central Committee further put forward the requirement for "good and fast" development. In December 2006, the Central Economic Work Conference clearly stated: "We must deeply understand that good and fast development is the essential requirement for comprehensively implementing the scientific development concept…"



"From the previous "fast and good" to "good and fast", although it is just a change in the order of the two words, it better reflects the inner requirements of the scientific development perspective, reflecting the Party's guiding ideology elevating on development issues. It enables the entire party to have a more comprehensive understanding of the laws of development at the new stage, making the guidelines for guiding development more in line with reality, and the ways to solve difficult development problems are clearer.

IV. Strengthening the Party's capability in governance and progressive construction

Strengthening the party's capability in governance and continuously improving the ability and level of governance has always been an important aspect of the proletarian party's ideology of party building. As early as the establishment of the Soviet regime, Lenin had proposed that how the Communist Party consolidates power after governing will be an "extremely difficult new career" and "this is a severe test". He demanded that every CPSU member should "enrich their minds with all the knowledge that humanity has created", and continuously improve the party's ability and level of governance. After the establishment of New China, several generations of Chinese Communists have always taken strengthening the party's ability in governance as a major issue. Entering the new century and stage, with Hu Jintao as the general secretary, the party centrally made decisions to strengthen the party's governance capability according to the needs of the new situation and tasks.

On the eve of the establishment of New China, Mao Zedong warned the whole party about the new situation that our party will soon become a ruling party, "Victory over the whole country is only the first step in the Long March", "But the journey after the revolution is longer, and the work is more important and difficult." Beginning to govern on a nationwide scale is like "rushing to the exam in Beijing". Mao Zedong's thoughts initially put forward requirements for strengthening the party's ability in governance. After the reform and opening up, our party has always paid attention to the two historical issues of improving the party's ability in governance and leadership level, and improving the party's ability to fight corruption, prevent degeneration and resist risks. After entering the new century, with profound changes in the international and domestic political and economic situations, more severe challenges have been posed to our party's governance ability and leadership level, while also putting forward new and higher requirements for strengthening the party's governance ability.

Adapting to the requirements of new situation development, the 16th National Congress of the Party based on our party's historical status and the historical mission entrusted by the times, focusing on the direction of China's socialism with Chinese characteristics, proposed from the strategic height of the long-term stability of the party and the state, the basic requirement of striving to improve the five aspects of governance ability: First, continuously improving the ability to judge the situation scientifically. Second, continuously improving the ability to control the market economy. Third, continuously improving the ability to deal with complex situations. Fourth, continuously improving the ability to rule by law. Fifth, constantly improving the ability to have an overall grasp of the situation.

To grasp the issue of the party's governance capability, on September 7, 2004, the new party central committee held a political bureau meeting to discuss the work of the central political bureau since the third plenary session of the sixteenth session and further studied the issue of strengthening the party's governance capability. On September 19, the fourth plenary session of the 16th Party Congress was held in Beijing. The "Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Strengthening the Party's Governance Capability" adopted by the plenary session comprehensively analyzed the current situation and tasks, scientifically summarized the main experience since the party's governance, scientifically summarized the party's governance capability, and clearly put forward the guiding ideology, overall goals, and main tasks for strengthening the party's governance capability."



The so-called governance capability of the party refers to: the ability of the party to propose and apply correct theories, lines, guidelines, policies and strategies, to lead the formulation and implementation of the constitution and laws, to adopt scientific leadership systems and leadership methods, to mobilize and organize the people to manage state and societal affairs, economy and cultural undertakings in accordance with the law, to effectively govern the party, the country and the military, and to build a modern socialist country.

The guiding thought of strengthening the party's governance capability is: to adhere to Marxism-Leninism, Mao Zedong Thought, Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents" as the guide, to fully implement the scientific development concept, to fully implement the party's basic line, basic program, and basic experience, taking maintaining the flesh-and-blood ties between the party and the masses as the core, building a high-quality cadre team as the key, reforming and improving the party's leadership system and working mechanism as the focus, and strengthen the grassroots organizations of the party and the construction of party members as the foundation, striving to reflect the characteristics of the times, grasp the regularity, and be creative.

The overall goal of strengthening the party's governance capability is: through the common efforts of the entire party, to make the party always become the ruling party that establishes the party for the public and governs for the people, becomes the ruling party of scientific governance, democratic governance, rule of law, becomes a truth-seeking, pioneering, diligent, efficient, clear and incorrupt government, and ultimately becomes a Marxist ruling party that always achieves the "Three Represents", always maintains its advancement, and can withstand all kinds of challenges.

The main task of strengthening the party's governance capability is: according to the requirements of promoting the coordinated development of socialist material civilization, political civilization, and spiritual civilization, continuously improve the ability to control the socialist market economy, develop socialist democratic politics, build socialist advanced culture, construct socialist harmonious society, and cope with international situations and handle international affairs.

In addition, the "Decision of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China on Strengthening the Governance Capacity of the Party" passed by the Fourth Plenary Session of the 16th Central Committee also made specific strategic deployments for improving the party's governance capacity on the basis of the "five aspects of governance capacity" proposed by the 16th National Congress of the party.

According to the relevant deployments of the Central Committee, in order to strengthen the party's governance capacity and ensure that the party is always at the forefront of the times and better shoulder the historical mission, on November 7, 2004, the central committee issued "Opinions on Carrying out the Practice of 'Three Represents' Important Thought as the Main Content to Maintain the Advanced Nature of Communist Party Members" (referred to as "Opinions"), making specific deployment for advanced education activities:
In terms of target requirements, in general, it is necessary to improve the quality of party members, strengthen grassroots organizations, serve the people, and promote all work; from the overall process, this activity to maintain the advanced nature of communist party members education is divided into three batches, each batch takes about half a year. The first batch is the party and government organs at the county and above levels and some enterprises and institutions, starting from January 2005 and ending in June 2005. The second batch is urban grassroots and township organs, starting from July 2005 and ending in December 2005. The third batch is rural and some party and government organs, starting from January 2006 and ending in June 2006. In terms of methods and steps, the centralized education is carried out in three stages, namely, learning and mobilizing, analysis and evaluation stage, and rectification and improvement stage.

After the "Opinions" were issued, from January 5 to 6, 2005, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China also held a work conference on maintaining the advanced nature of Communist Party members education, and made specific deployments for advanced education work. According to the overall arrangement of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the Politburo Standing Committee of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China participated in the first batch of advanced education activities. On January 14, at the special report meeting on maintaining the advanced nature of Communist Party members in the new era, Hu Jintao made an important speech on the importance and necessity of strengthening the construction of the party's advanced nature and carrying out advanced education activities, the basic requirements for Communist Party members to maintain their advanced nature in the new era, and other issues, calling on all Communist Party members to actively participate in advanced education activities.




Following the Central Advanced Education Work Conference, from January 2005 onwards, the advanced education activities for Communist Party members were launched in three batches, and by June 2006, the nationwide advanced education activities for Communist Party members had essentially concluded. During this one-and-a-half-year period, more than 3.5 million grassroots party organizations and nearly 70 million party members participated in the advanced education activities. In practice, the entire education movement was healthy and orderly, solidly implemented, made smooth progress, and achieved noticeable results in advancing the Party's progress and governing capability, receiving praise from the vast majority of party members, cadres, masses, and all sectors of society.

V. Uphold the path of peaceful development and advocate for building a harmonious world

Entering a new stage in the new century, China's socialist modernization has reached a new strategic opportunity. Under the leadership of the Party Central Committee with Hu Jintao as General Secretary along with the entire Party and all of the people, facing a series of new changes in the international and domestic environment, the nation is accelerating economic development while also paying more attention to the modernization of the military and national defense, actively carrying out diplomatic work, and tirelessly promoting the peaceful unification of the motherland and safeguarding strategic opportunities.

In order to realize the synchronous development of national defense and national economy, adapting to the changing international military situation after entering the 21st century, the Party Central Committee requires the entire military to actively meet the severe challenges of the new world military reform by pressing ahead with China's military reform with urgency, striving to complete the dual historical duties of mechanized and informatized construction, unswervingly realizing the strategic goal of building an informatized army and winning informatized warfare. On September 20, 2004, at the expanded meeting of the Central Military Commission, Hu Jintao, who had just taken over as Chairman of the Central Military Commission, proposed that they "continuously improve the ability to strengthen the ideological and political construction of the troops, grasp the correct direction of troop construction, continuously improve the ability to lead military struggle preparations, lead the troops to accomplish combat missions under informatized conditions, continuously improve the promotion of military reform with Chinese characteristics, and promote mechanization and informatization construction of the troops, continuously improve the legal and strict military governance, strengthen the standardization construction of the troops".

On March 13, 2005, Hu Jintao delivered an important speech at the plenary meeting of the PLA delegation to the Third Session of the Tenth National People's Congress, on behalf of the Central Military Commission he proposed new requirements for the historical mission of our army which were to "provide important guarantees of strength for the Party to consolidate its ruling position, provide strong safety guarantees for maintaining the country's important strategic opportunities, provide powerful strategic support for safeguarding national interests, play an important role in maintaining world peace and promoting common development". This new mission entrusted to our army by the Party Central Committee and the Central Military Commission carries epoch-making significance.

To put this mission into practice, our army has further accelerated its reform along the Chinese characteristic path of a fine and capable troop. Following the large-scale military cutbacks of one million in the mid-1980s and 500,000 in the mid to late 1990s, in September 2003, the Chinese government decided to reduce another 200,000 troops before 2005. Simultaneously with the reduction of troop strength, the state has increased its investment in national defense construction. The military and political qualities of the army's officers and men have been significantly improved and the development of weapons and equipment, and the cause of national defense and science and technology have made remarkable strides.

Since the 16th National Congress of the Communist Party of China, the most noteworthy aspect of China's diplomacy has been its advocacy and active promotion of the construction of a "harmonious world". This international strategic thought reflects the basic judgment and value of the Chinese Communist Party on the current international situation, global issues, and the fate of humanity, and it is a new summary of the goals of China's independent and peaceful foreign policy in the new era.

On April 22, 2005, at the Asian-African Summit in Jakarta, State President Hu Jintao appealed to countries around the world to "promote friendly coexistence between different civilizations, equal dialogue, development prosperity, and jointly construct a harmonious world," putting forward for the first time the proposition of building a "harmonious world".



On July 1, the leaders of China and Russia held a meeting, incorporating the concept of a "harmonious world" into the "Sino-Russian Joint Declaration on the International Order of the 21st Century", for the first time acknowledging it as a consensus between the two major countries. On September 15, Hu Jintao delivered a speech titled "Striving to Build a Harmonious World of Enduring Peace and Common Prosperity” at the 60th anniversary of the United Nations, proposing that "in the face of the complex world today, we should pay more attention to harmony, emphasize harmony, promote harmony, and build a harmonious world of enduring peace and common prosperity", fully expressing the rich connotations of a "harmonious world". In August 2006, the Communist Party of China held the National Foreign Affairs Conference, identifying the construction of a "harmonious world" as the goal of China's diplomatic work. 

To promote the construction of a harmonious world, the Chinese government actively carried out a series of productive diplomatic activities. China's relations with major countries continued to maintain stability and development, and the friendship and cooperation with neighboring countries continued to be consolidated. 

In 2003, the second China-Africa Cooperation Forum passed the "Addis Ababa Action Plan (2004-2006)", planning cooperation in various fields such as economy, trade, and social affairs for the next three years; Following the signing of the "Framework Agreement on Comprehensive Economic Cooperation between China and ASEAN" in 2002, China and ASEAN signed the "Goods Trade Agreement" and the "Dispute Settlement Mechanism Agreement" in November 2004, stipulating the gradual elimination of most bilateral trade tariffs and other trade barriers by 2010. From November 28 to 30, Wen Jiabao visited Laos and attended the eighth ASEAN and Chinese Leaders Meeting (10+1) held in Vientiane, delivering the "Action Plan Implementing China-ASEAN Strategic Partnership for Peace and Prosperity Joint Declaration". In April 2005, Wen Jiabao visited Pakistan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and India, and attended the fourth foreign ministers' meeting of the Asia Cooperation Dialogue held in Islamabad. During the visit, China-Pakistan and China-India announced the establishment of strategic partnership, while China-Bangladesh and China-Sri Lanka announced the establishment of comprehensive partnership. 

As of 2008, China has participated in more than 100 intergovernmental international organizations, more than 300 international conventions, 22 UN peacekeeping actions, dispatched tens of thousands of peacekeepers, and is the nation that has sent out the largest number of peacekeepers among the five permanent members of the UN Security Council.

After active efforts, China's diplomacy has bilateral and multilateral aspects, attaches equal importance to traditional security and non-traditional security, and has begun to form a new model of comprehensive development of politics, economy, diplomacy, military, culture, and other aspects. 

Since the 16th National Congress, the new central leadership collective has strictly dealt with the issues of the Hong Kong and Macau Special Administrative Regions in accordance with the "one country, two systems" policy, and implemented some important measures in light of new developments in Hong Kong and Macau.



In cross-strait relations, the central government actively responds to new changes in the Taiwan Strait situation and has taken significant and positive steps. The struggle against "Taiwan independence" and to uphold national sovereignty has made new progress. Since Hong Kong and Macao returned to the motherland, the party central committee and the state council have always regarded maintaining the long-term prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macao, maintaining and developing the fundamental interests of Hong Kong and Macao compatriots as the starting point and foothold for handling Hong Kong and Macao affairs, and have unwaveringly adhered to the principles and the Basic Law of the Special Administrative Regions of "one country, two systems", "Hong Kong people ruling Hong Kong", "Macao people ruling Macao", and a high degree of autonomy. The central government has resolutely supported the special administrative regional chief executives and the government to govern according to the law. 

The central government has given full support to the prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macao. Not only has it taken effective measures to help Hong Kong and Macao successfully get rid of the negative impacts brought about by the Asian financial crisis, but it has also promoted common development with the mainland by further strengthening mainland and Hong Kong and Macao ties, engaging in multi-field exchanges and cooperations, and implementing policies such as the regional cooperation of the Pan-Pearl River Delta. It has provided a broader development space for the prosperity and stability of Hong Kong and Macao. With the support of the central government and mainland compatriots, the economies of Hong Kong and Macao have become more prosperous, democracy has developed in an orderly manner, the people live in peace and contentment, and society remains stable. The majority of Hong Kong and Macao compatriots passionately love their motherland and care for Hong Kong and Macao, demonstrating a diligent and upward spirit. 

Since the return of Hong Kong and Macao, cross-strait relations have received more attention from the Communist Party of China and all Chinese people. The party central committee, in response to the changes in cross-strait relations and Taiwan's situation, proposed some new ideas and took some new steps based on existing policies to continuously promote the development of cross-strait relations. 

On March 4, 2005, Hu Jintao put forward four points of view on the development of cross-strait relations under new circumstances, emphasizing unswerving adherence to the principle of one China, persistent efforts for peaceful reunification, unchanging policy of entrusting hope to Taiwan people, and uncompromising opposition to "Taiwan independence". The four "unswervings", which have caused a major response in the Taiwan Strait and the international community, have been widely welcomed and highly praised. On March 14, the Anti-Secession Law was approved by a high vote at the third session of the tenth National People's Congress, engraining the central government's major policy guidelines on resolving Taiwan issues and opposing the division of the motherland. The enactment and approval of this law fully reflect the consistent position of the Communist Party of China to strive for peaceful reunification with the utmost sincerity and effort and also demonstrate the firm determination of the Communist Party of China and Chinese people to maintain national unity and territorial integrity. 

Under the correct policies of the party central committee, after efforts from various parties, party exchanges between the two sides of the Taiwan Strait successfully began. In 2005, Lien Chan, Chairman of the Chinese Nationalist Party in Taiwan, James Soong, Chairman of the People First Party, and Yok Mu-ming, Chairman of the New Party, each led delegations to visit the mainland in turn. Hu Jintao, the General Secretary, met and talked with them separately, jointly issued statements, and reached many common understandings — such as adhering to the "1992 Consensus", opposing "Taiwan independence", seeking peace and stability across the Taiwan Strait, and promoting the development of cross-strait relations. In the three cross-strait economic, trade, and cultural forums held by the relevant parties of the Communist Party of China and the Chinese Nationalist Party, the Mainland side launched 48 policy measures to promote cross-strait exchanges and cooperation and to benefit Taiwan compatriots, including expanding Taiwan's agricultural product sales in the Mainland, recognizing Taiwan higher education degrees approved by Taiwan's competent education authorities, allowing Taiwan compatriots who meet the required conditions to apply for practice registration and short-term medical treatment in the Mainland, etc. The CPC and the PFP also held a "Cross-Strait Civilian Elite Forum". Through extensive exchanges and cooperation between political parties across the Taiwan Strait, a new situation has been created to curb "Taiwan independence" separatist activities and to promote the development of cross-strait relations.



Activities such as "legal independence", "new constitutional referendum", "joining the United Nations in the name of Taiwan" and other "Taiwan independence" activities by the Taiwan authorities have been repeatedly foiled. The struggle against "Taiwan independence" has also received widespread understanding and support from the international community. Many countries of significant influence have repeatedly reaffirmed their adherence to the one-China policy. In September 2007, the 62nd General Assembly of the United Nations overwhelmingly rejected the so-called "Taiwan joining the United Nations" proposal instigated by the Chen Shui-bian administration and a very few nations. In March 2008, elections were held in Taiwan, where the ruling Chen Shui-bian administration, which was getting more and more distant on the path of "Taiwan independence", was finally abandoned by the Taiwanese people, and the Kuomintang regained its ruling status. Cross-strait relations saw new changes favorable to peaceful development.

Chapter 12: Implementation of the Scientific Development Concept and Building a Socialist Harmonious Society

Since the 16th National Congress of the Party, the Party Central Committee, with Hu Jintao as General Secretary, has clearly proposed the concept of scientific development in the practice of fully building a well-off society, further summarized the theoretical system of socialism with Chinese characteristics, and under the guidance of the concept of scientific development, has set new requirements for the goal of fully building a well-off society, promoted the building of a harmonious society, deepened administrative system reform and rural reform, and generated a series of strategic decisions promoting the scientific development of Chinese society, pushing forward the steady and healthy progress of our society.

I. New Summary of the Theoretical System of Socialism with Chinese Characteristics

From October 15 to 21, 2007, the 17th National Congress of the Communist Party of China was held in Beijing. The main theme was: Holding high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, guided by Deng Xiaoping Theory and the important thought of "Three Represents", thoroughly implementing the Scientific Development Concept, continuing to emancipate the mind, adhering to reform and opening up, promoting scientific development, promoting social harmony, and striving for new victories in building a well-off society in all respects. Hu Jintao, on behalf of the 16th Central Committee, delivered a speech titled "Holding high the great banner of socialism with Chinese characteristics, striving for new victories in building a well-off society" to the congress. The congress elected the new Central Committee and Central Discipline Inspection Commission, and adopted resolutions on the report of the 16th Central Committee, the report of the Central Discipline Inspection Commission, and the resolution on the Amendment to the Constitution of the Communist Party of China.

The report of the 17th Congress scientifically answered major questions such as what banner the Party should hold, what road it should take, what kind of spiritual state it should maintain, and what development goals it should aim for in the key stage of reform and development. It made comprehensive arrangements for the grand goal of building a well-off society in all respects, and made clear requirements for comprehensively advancing the new great project of Party building with the spirit of reform and innovation.
